Marrisa is married and has operated a general store for many years to make a living. She earns well to provide for her family. 

She had respectfully repaid her previous loan used for her store. Aside from working in her store, she also was engaged in selling fruits in their community. She took another loan from Gata Daku MPC  to purchase more fruits to sell in the market. 

Marrisa hopes to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future as well as her business to build a fruit stall in the market and to be a supplier of fresh fruits in the supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell in the market

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa is very mush thankful for her first Kiva loan and pleasant partnership. Alisa lives with her son in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Her husband is in the Russian Federation working abroad. She also has a daughter who is married and lives with her family.

Alisa graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, the faculty of Teaching in the Elementary Schools and Teaching Methodologies. She has 25 years of pedagogical experience and now she also works of her beloved profession. She is a teacher at the school and she teaches Armenian Language and Literature. She also gives paid private courses at her house to the pupils who are going to have entrance exams. She is very patient and clever pedagogue who greatly tries to help and support each of her pupils.

This loan of 300.000 Armenian drams she asks as she wants to buy a big table and chairs for her work room and make it more comfortable for her pupils to attend and pass their courses.

loans.use: to buy a big table and chairs for her working room and make it more comfortable for her pupils to attend and pass their courses

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita works hard to support her family. Margarita is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Margarita requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Margarita has been in this business for 5 years now.

Margarita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, los cuales están estudiando, dos de ellos educación básica y el mayor estudia a nivel de bachillerato de su localidad, todos dependen económicamente de él, José se dedica a la venta de lácteos, oficio que aprendió de sus padres y un amigo hace diez años; pero desde hace ocho años cuenta con su propio negocio todo su grupo familiar colabora para elaborar todos los productos que ofrecen a sus vecinos.
Jose, solicita el crédito para invertirlo en leche, bolsas, pastillas, recipientes, sal, etc., con esto sus productos tendrán una mejor presentación y calidad para atender a sus clientes, lo que le permitirá tener más ingresos financieros que de gran manera le ayudaran para  ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.
Su mayor sueño es poder tener una estabilidad económica, familiar y social para continuar dándole estudio a sus hijos y que estos puedan ser unos profesionales el día de mañana.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and three children, two of whom are at middle school, while the eldest is studying for his high school diploma. All are economically dependent on José.

José sells dairy products, and was taught the job by his parents and a friend 10 years ago. He has run his own business for the last eight years, and his whole family help out to make the products which he offers for sale to his neighbours.

José is requesting a loan to buy milk, bags, tablets, containers, salt, etc. so that he can improve the quality and presentation of his products. His increased earnings will allow him to offer his family a better quality of life.

His biggest dream is to enjoy economic, familial and social stability, so that he continue to provide for the education of his children in the hope that they will become professionals one day.

loans.use: buy milk, bags, tablets, containers, salt, etc.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Marife works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling beverages. Marife is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as flour, sugar, etc.

Marife has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a single woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old and has one child still in school. She has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Corazon has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more rice grains to sell. She has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Chanak's Group

texts.en: Chanak’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chanak makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old and she is married and blessed with three children. She has expanded her fruits and vegetables business since the last loan to include a retail shop. She has been in the business for four years. She earns a monthly income of 4,000 KES in the retail shop and 15,000 in the vegetables business.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of cereals to sell. She will use the profits from the expanded business to educate her children. Her hope and dreams are to ensure her children are educated to protect them from poverty.

loans.use: to buy stock of cereals to sell.

loans.name: Nelson Enrique

texts.es:
Nelson, de 36 años de edad, está acompañado, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos de 5 y 7 años de edad, ambos asisten a la escuela de la comunidad, mientras su pareja trabaja en los oficios domésticos.

Nelson, trabaja en la agricultura y en la pesca artesanal en una laguna, este trabajo lo aprendió de su familia, porque ellos siempre se han dedicado a esta labor; el lugar donde pesca está a pocos minutos de su casa y lo hace de noche y de día.

Nelson, necesita el dinero para mejorar su equipo de pesca, mejorar las redes y la lancha; porque la que posee actualmente está ocasionando muchas dificultades.

Nelson, sueña con mejorar su vivienda para brindarle a su familia una vivienda en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Nelson, aged 36, lives with his partner and their two children, aged 5 and 7. The children go to the local school, while his partner takes care of their home.

Nelson works in agriculture and fishing. His family, who have always worked in this area, taught him to fish. He fishes in a lake located close to his house, and works day and night.

Nelson is requesting a loan to improve his fishing nets and his boat, which has caused him many problems.

Nelson dreams of being able to improve his home so that he can provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to improve his fishing nets and boat.

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma is 35 and she is married. She lives with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband purchase clothing from market which she sells from her home and her husband sells from his shop. In this way both contribute in monthly income. They have been selling clothing related to summer season; now the weather is going to change and customers demand for warmer clothing
Asma is compelled for taking a Kiva loan so she can buy warm clothing to offer and can cope with the demand. In this way both can offer warm clothing and can generate maximum income for their cherished family.
She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and she can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide a better living standard and charming clothes for her children.

loans.use: to buy warm clothes for her clothing  business to cope with increasing demand.

loans.name: Souy's Group

texts.en: Souy’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Souy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 51 years old. She is married and blessed with five children.

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya.

She will use the loan to buy farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds to improve her crop production.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a better business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds to improve her crop production.

loans.name: Velmin

texts.en:
Velmin is a single woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 31 years old and has three children who are presently in school. She has a buy-and-sell crabs business in the Philippines.

Velmin has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more crabs and shrimp to sell to her customers. Velmin has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more crabs and shrimp to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ivan Dario

texts.es:
Ivan es un joven con toda la energía y disposición para enfrentar el mundo y superarse.

Desea iniciar un negocio de venta ropa y calzado, con este negocio podría obtener ingresos para poder mantener y ayudar a su madre.

Es un joven muy aplicado pues estudia y tiene deseos de salir adelante y ser profesional.

Solicita un crédito para la compra de inventario en productos como camisetas, jeans, zapatos, accesorios, entre otros.
Con este préstamo puede cumplir su sueño de ser independiente y darle a su madre todo lo que necesite, además de poder pagar sus estudios y progresar gracias al apoyo de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar.

Apoya el proyecto de un joven emprendedor Colombiano!
texts.en: Ivan is a young man with all the energy and disposition to face the world and get ahead. He wants to start a business selling clothing and footwear. With this business, he could obtain earnings to support himself and his mother. He is an achieved young man who studies and has dreams of getting ahead and become a professional. He is asking for a loan to buy inventory in products such as t-shirts, jeans, shoes, accessories, among others. With this loan he can achieve his dream of becoming independent and give his mother what she needs, in addition to pay for his own studies and get ahead,  thanks to Kiva's support and the Interactuar Corporation. Support the project of a young Colombian entrepreneur!

loans.use: To buy inventory in products such as t-shirts, jeans, shoes, accessories, and others.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with nine children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs, etc., to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

Rebecca dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en:
Felina is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felina is 54 years old and has one child still in school.

Felina has a fishing business in the Philippines. Felina requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishnet, gasoline for her boat, bamboo and other materials.

Felina has been in this business for 40 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishnet, gasoline for her boat, bamboo and other materials.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 27 years old with three children.

Sylvia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Sylvia has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling coconut wine.

Sylvia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Las Manzaneras De Panimache Primero Sector I Group

texts.es:
Cecilia es una gran mujer, pues con mucho sacrificio a su familia ha sacado adelante, Cecilia es una más de las muchas personas que sus vidas sean visto beneficiadas con los créditos  pues gracias a su préstamo ella logro realizar la inversión en su negocio de ropa típica, comprando una variedad de estilos y colores de güipiles, desafortunadamente le fue tan bien, pues no le genero ganancias pero a pesar de esto, Cecilia no se conforma por esa razón solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de más productos de ropa tales como; fajas, cortes y güipiles, pues la época de fin de año ya se acerca y ella espera provechar mejor.
Su sueño es fortalecer aún más su negocio para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a great woman. With a lot of sacrifice she has helped her family to move forward.

Cecilia is one of the many people who has benefitted from loans. Thanks to loans, she has been able to invest in her business of selling typical clothing. She buys traditional clothing in a variety of styles and colors. Unfortunately, it did not go so well for her because it did not generate income. In spite of this, Cecelia does not stop.

That is the reason that she is requesting a new loan to buy more typical clothing like woven belts, skirts, and blouses. The end of the year season is approaching, and she hopes to make the most of it. Her dream is to strengthen her business even more in order to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing like woven belts, skirts, and blouses.

loans.name: Aziz Bibi

texts.en:
Aziz Bibi is a 39-year-old, married woman and mother of two children. She is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. Her husband is a shoemaker and very expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing baby shoes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot of experience about his profession.

He sews Rexine shoes through a machine, and after that attaches its sole through stitching by his hands. In this way, he is getting income for his family.

Nowadays, he has gotten a huge contract, but he does not have an amount to buy raw materials to complete the contract. Therefore, Aziz Bibi requested a loan for her husband so he can buy raw material such as Rexine, threads, glue, soles, etc.

Aziz Bibi is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as Rexine, threads, glue, soles, etc., for her husband's shoe-making business.

loans.name: Than

texts.en:
Than is a 21-year-old single freshman who is from the Kampong Chhnang Province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Finance and Banking at university in the province. His parents are rice farmers and practice animal husbandry. Due to a shortages of finances they cannot pay his tuition fees.

Than has decided to secure a loan. With the loan, he will graduate successfully with skills for his future job. After graduation, he wants to have a good job with a reasonable salary, therefore he will be able to build a proper house. If he has children, he wants his children to study to pursue bachelor or master degrees if he can support it.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees from the first to the fourth year in Finance and Banking. His parents are rice farmers

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 31 anos de idade, vive maritalmente mãe de 3 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, não responsabiliza-se por ninguém.
Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku com o qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio de adquirindo produtos de beleza como: mechas, tissagem e varios cosméticos para satisfazer os seus clientes.
Futuramente pretende terminar a sua obra de residência e casar-se oficialmente. O seu maior desafio é garantir o ensino dos seus filhos até ao nível superior.
texts.en:
She was born in Namaacha, Maputo province. She is 31 years old. She lives in common-law marriage, and is the mother of three underage children. All of them go to school, and she is not responsible for anyone else.

This is her first loan from Hluvuku, and she is planning to use it to expand her business by buying beauty products such as artificial locks of hair, hair extensions, and cosmetics to fulfill her customers' needs.

In the future, she is planning to finish building her house and get married officially. Her biggest challenge is to guarantee her children's education up to the university level.

loans.use: to buy artificial locks of hair, hair extensions, and cosmetics to fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 26 years old, married and had two young children. Her husband is a construction worker, while she is selling clothes and curtains for income.

She wanted to buy more goods to sell; that is why she is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy curtains and clothes to resell them for profits. She will continue selling affordable merchandise and saving funds for her family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy curtains and clothes to resell for profits.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 66-year-old widow who is blessed with six children.

Regina has been in the farming business for eleven years. She earns a monthly income of ten thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and maize seeds for planting.

Regina will use the profits from her expanded business to educate her children as well meet her family’s basic needs.

Her hopes and dreams are to see her children complete their education and for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and maize seeds for planting.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jovelyn is 32 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Jovelyn has a barber shop business in the Philippines. Jovelyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like scissors, towel, combs and others for her business.

Jovelyn has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like scissors, towels, combs and others for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Jocelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with seven children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Ma. Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 56 years old and married with nine children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Violeta has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, coffee, beverages, biscuits, rice, junk foods and other groceries. In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Kosol's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Battambang province, Kosol is 56 years old. She is a widowed mother of three children. To make a living, she has been growing rice and working as a tailor. Lack of working capital is the main challenge to her rice growing business.

Kosol, who has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles already, is now leading a group of two members to request loan support. Past loans have helped her have enough ability to renovate her house and to provide family members with enough healthy food.

Kosol, the group leader, will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields and to pay for plowing and laborers' fees. She hopes that she will harvest abundant rice yields to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields so that she can harvest abundant rice to improve her standard of living.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 49 years old and has five children. Conchita is a married woman.

Conchita is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Conchita has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Sughra

texts.en:
Sughra is a 44-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children, and her husband is engaged in a scrap-material recycling business.

Sughra's husband needs to buy scrap material in bulk to recycle, but due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in a suitable position to make the bulk purchase. Therefore, Sughra has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

This loan will enable Sughra's husband to purchase the scrap material in bulk so that he can earn a good profit from his business.

Sughra is very thankful to Kiva's lenders and BRAC Pakistan for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy scrap material in bulk for her husband's recycled-material business.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 40-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has owned an enterprise of stitching and selling embroidered dresses in nearby towns for many years. He has been recruiting skilled people to do embroidery work for daily wages; he also brings some materials home for Parveen, because she helps him with embroidery work. He is very expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his arts and appreciate his efforts.

He wants to meet the demand for bridal dresses. That is why he wants to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance. He requires some capital to buy the desired inventories, but does not have sufficient cash on hand. Therefore, Parveen has humbly requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan her husband will be able to buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Parveen is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enable her husband in purchasing stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors for his embroidery firm.

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca is 32 years old and lives in the Nyanga District of Zimbabwe with her family. She runs a successful farming project growing and selling potatoes.

Jesca used her first Kiva loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and to buy an ox for easier plowing. Jesca also sells sweets, biscuits, and snacks at the nearby school. She has used her profits to pay her children’s school fees, and she is now financially independent.

After a hailstorm destroyed some of her crops, Jesca seeks a second Kiva loan to purchase more seeds and pesticides, as well as to buy material to improve the infrastructure of her business.

Jesca has been trained as a Camfed Community Health Volunteer. She also will continue to repay the interest on her “social-interest” loan through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, assisting students with their studies at her local school.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and pesticides, as well as to buy material to improve the infrastructure of her business.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lorna works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and buying and selling nipa roofing.

Lorna is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her businesses.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net and pay for maintenance for her boat.

loans.name: Floredelina

texts.en:
Floredelina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Floredelina dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel is a 39-year-old married woman with one child who is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Mabel has a fishing business in the Philippines. Mabel requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat and other materials for her business.

Mabel has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fish net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.en:
Fortunata is married and works hard to support her family. Fortunata has a buy and sell frozen foods and soft drinks business in the Philippines.

Fortunata requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft-drinks and packs of frozen foods to sell.

Fortunata has been in this business for 5 years now.

Fortunata would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft-drinks and packs of frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is 34 years old, with four children. With four children in school, Marieta works very hard to provide for them.

Marieta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, condiments, home product care, and other groceries.

Marieta has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, biscuits, vinegar, junk foods, and other groceries.

In the future, Marieta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, condiments, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Ruos' Group

texts.en:
A farmer from Kampong Cham province, Ruos is 47 years old and married with four children, three of whom are dependent. Ruos still has a school-aged child needing support. Income for this family comes from growing wet-season rice and chili peppers. Pests are a challenge to her rice farming business.

This is the second cycle loan for her with VisionFund; her past loan has helped her to improve living condition and buy school supplies. As the leader of two-member group, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer and fuel for the pumping machine. She hopes that this loan will enable her to get more income, to keep sending her children to school and upgrade their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to input on her farmland to grow her crop fruitfully.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Roxen

texts.en:
Roxen is a 45-year-old married woman with four children; three children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Roxen has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Roxen requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials for her business.

Roxen has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Radha

texts.en:
Radha is a 32-year-old married woman living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides services for sheltering for houses under construction. Most of his work depends upon the contract and most of the time he unable to get any contract for sheltering services.

Recently her husband has gotten a huge contract but he does not have enough sheltering material to provide proper services.

Radha requested a loan so that her husband would be able to buy more sheltering material to provide his best services.

Radha is very thankful to the Kiva and BRAC Pakistan she is hopeful that the Kiva lenders take pity on her and support her in the form of loan raising.

loans.use: to buy sheltering material for her husband's sheltering services.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 36-year-old married woman with three children, two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marites has had a fishing business for 3 years and requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy a fish net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy a fish net, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Recil

texts.en:
Recil is a 42-year-old married woman with five children, all attend school. Recil works very hard to provide for them.

Recil has run a general store for 10 years and requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy candies, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Recil would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy candies, canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Bala

texts.en: Bala is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Bala has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Bala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Bala can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Bala will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Bala is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kunduzoy

texts.en:
Kunduzoy was born in 1975. She is the divorced mother of five children. Kunduzoy is bringing up her children alone and she works hard to offer good living conditions for them.

Kunduzoy is a seamstress, and she has her own sewing workshop. She sews different kind of clothes and she has some pupils. She teaches her skills to these pupils.

Kunduzoy has been working in this field for more than ten years and she has great experience. She works every day for 8 hours without weekends.

Kunduzoy now is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy fabrics and a sewing machine to increase her working capacity. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and a sewing machine to increase her working capacity.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a married woman with six children who works hard to support her family.

She grows rice and earns additional income from motorcycle transportation business. Flordeliza is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests an additional loan to further build her business.

Flordeliza has sustained her business activities through 24 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a married woman with four children. Cheryl is 38 years old and has four children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Cheryl has a food vending business in the Philippines. Cheryl requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, fish, meat, spices, etc..

Cheryl has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, fish, meat, and spices.

loans.name: Noris Evelec

texts.es:
Noris de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta hasta 8º grado, tiene una hija que va a la escuela y vive con ella, es madre soltera  pues no tiene ayuda de su compañero de vida.


Noris se dedica a la venta de antojitos, trabaja 3 días por semana, el negocio lo desarrolla en la colonia donde ella habita, por lo que no gasta en pasajes, en el negocio se involucra su hija, Noris emprendió este negocio por la necesidad de salir adelante con su hija.


Noris necesita este crédito para comprar maíz, yuca, plátano, aceite entre otros insumos para la venta de antojitos.


Noris siempre ha soñado con tener una tienda en su casa ya que la vida esta difícil en la calle y quisiera no salir a exponerse a la delincuencia.
texts.en:
Noris, aged 34, studied up to the eighth grade. She has a daughter who goes to school and lives with her. She is a single mother, and receives no support from her partner.

Noris sells street food. She works three days a week, selling her products in the neighborhood where she lives so that she has no transport costs. Her daughter is also involved with the business. Noris began her business in order to be able to support herself and her daughter.

Noris is requesting a loan to buy corn, yuca, plantains, oil and other supplies for making and selling street food.

Noris has always dreamed of opening a store in her house, because life is difficult working on the street and she would like to avoid being exposed to crime.

loans.use: to buy corn, yuca, plantains, oil and other supplies for preparing street food for sale.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a married woman, 64 years old with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Salvacion has a fishing business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other material for her business.

Salvacion has been in this business for 30 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other material for her business.

loans.name: Alexis Edenilson

texts.es:
Alexis, de 23 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador que estudio hasta tercer grado, pero dejo de estudiar porque tuvo que ayudarle a sus padres a cultivar granos básicos, actualmente vive junto a su esposa quien es ama de casa y tiene dos hijos, uno de 3 años de edad y un recién nacido.

Alexis, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz, maicillo, pipianes ayotes y hortalizas, se ha dedicado desde pequeño a sembrar este tipo de cultivos; pero también trabaja como corralero en una pequeña granja, en donde a las 2 de la madrugada ordeña las vacas y luego regresa a realizar las otras actividades. 

El préstamo que está solicitando es para comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo, porque está en la época que necesita abono y riego de pesticidas para la maleza. 

El sueño de Alexis, es ver crecer a sus hijos y que puedan estudiar y tengan la oportunidad que él no tuvo.
texts.en:
Alexis, 23, is a working man who studied up to the third grade, but quit his studies because he had to help his parents to cultivate cereals. He currently lives with his wife, who works as a housewife, and his two children; one of them is three years old, and the other one is a newborn.

Alexis works growing vegetables, such as corn, sorghum, and squash. He has cultivated these kinds of crops since he was a child, but he also works as a day laborer for a small farm, starting at 2:00 a.m. to milk the cows. He then returns to his other activities.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers for his plantations, now that the season has arrived and he must fertilize and weed them.

Alexis' dream is to see his children grow, and that they can study and have the opportunities he did not have.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his plantations.

loans.name: José Gilberto

texts.es:
José de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está soltero y no tiene hijos, vive con una hermana y sobrinos.


José se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace 18 años, aprendió el trabajo cuando estaba muy pequeño, él vive frente a la bahía y su principal herramienta de trabajo es una lancha, generalmente realiza la pesca durante la noche, y en el día sale a vender.


Él necesita este crédito para reparar el motor de su lancha ya que sin ella no podría realizar su trabajo de pesca.

Él sueña con tener dos motores para no atrasarse en su trabajo y además espera formar su propia familia y procrear hijos.
texts.en:
34-year-old José studied up to the fifth grade. He is single and has no children. He lives with one of her sisters and his nephews/nieces.

José has worked as a traditional fisherman for eighteen years. He learned this job when he was a child. He lives in front of the bay, and his most important tool is a small boat. He normally fishes at night, and sells the fish during the day.

He needs this loan to repair his boat's engine. Without it, he will not be able to go fishing. His dream is to have two engines in order to work without delays. He also hopes to have his own family and have children in the future.

loans.use: to repair his boat's engine and continue with his fishing activities.

loans.name: Rim's Group

texts.en:
Rim, 41, is a resident in Battambang province and a married mother of four children, two attend school. She and her husband have grown cassava for ten years as their main source of income. Rim sometimes works for others for a fee for additional income. They lack working capital.

She leads a two-member group to apply for loans from VisionFund. Two previous loans enabled her to meet the family’s basic needs, renovate her house, and buy school supplies.

She is going to use her loan to have her farmland plowed and buy cassava seedlings to plant. She will also buy organic pesticide and pay for labor fees.

She hopes that she can earn more income, improve living conditions, and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to  plow the farm and buy  cassava seedlings.

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is a 44-year-old lady; she is married and passing her life with her two daughters and three sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is receiving this loan for her son's embroidery shop. He has been selling embroidery material for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive but its turnover very high.

Due to high cost he is facing the shortage of material and unable to purchase expensive raw material to sell. Therefore, Bushra requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her son can overcome the shortage of embroidery material. Through this amount he will buy stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones pearls of various colors.

Bushra is very thankful to the Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy expensive embroidery material for her son's shop so he can overcome material shortage.

loans.name: Chhoeunpichet

texts.en:
Chhoeunpichet is a 19-year-old student who is from the Kampong Cham Province in Cambodia. He is studying English literature and Computer skills at an institute in the city. His parents earn some money from farming .

Chhoeunpichet doesn’t have enough finances to pay his tuition fees, so now he is applying for a loan. This loan will help him to earn knowledge for his future job. For his dream, he wants to run his own business.

loans.use: to pay his college tuition fees in English Literature and Computer skills. His parents are farmers.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 44-year-old married woman with four children, two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gina has raised pigs for 6 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 61 years old and married with three children.  

Marciana is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Marciana requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marciana has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Nestora

texts.en:
Nestora is single and has a selling ornamental plants business in the Philippines.

Nestora requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Nestora has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Nestora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Alhaji has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. Alhaji can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alhaji is thankful that he has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to eliminate selling maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 46-year-old married woman with two children.

Nancy has grown rice for 10 years and requests 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

She has previously borrowed 9 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rogelyn

texts.en:
Rogelyn is a 28-year-old woman with two children, one child attends school.

Rogelyn has raised pigs for 5 years and requests 16,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

She has previously borrowed 7 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rogelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec sept enfants à charge. Afi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Afi  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois en vue de mieux revendre puis de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with seven children whom she cares for. Afi resells charcoal that she purchases once a month at the market and resells from the front of her home. Afi needs this loan to finance her order of bags of charcoal. Her goal is to have good sales and make a larger profit to assist her husband with the family's expenses and provide their children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy 50 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: San's Group

texts.en: San’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. San makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Remalyn

texts.en:
Remalyn is a 30-year-old married woman who lives at Solana with her two children. She raises hogs to sell to butchers in the village.

Remalyn will use the loan to buy feed and medicines for the hogs. She hopes to improve their growth and sell them at higher prices.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for the hogs.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en: Petronila is 52 years old, married and blessed with 7 children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for 8 years.  This is her 3rd  loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she successfully repaid her previous loans. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and a water tank for storing water to irrigate her crops and hopes this will enable hr to get more farm produce for sell. She will use the generated profits to pay school fees for her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to improve her farming and make more income to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and a water tank for storing water to irrigate her crops

loans.name: Katuku

texts.en: Kituku is 39 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. He sells household plastic goods as well as sandals and the business has been profitable. This is his 4th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he successfully paid his previous loans. He will use the loan to buy stock of buckets, basins and plastic sandals and hopes this will enable him to get more income to support his family. He will use the profits from his expanded business to educate his children and provide food for his family. His future hopes and dreams are to grow his business,make more income and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy stock of buckets, basins and plastic sandals and hopes this will enable him to get more income to support his family.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 45-year-old married woman with five children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 6 years. She requests a 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Alma has previously borrowed 6 loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from food vending.

Alma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda works hard to support her family. Florenda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Florenda has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Florenda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jovelia

texts.en:
Jovelia is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jovelia is 46 years old and has one child in school.

Jovelia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jovelia requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, meat, vegetable, etc..

Jovelia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Jovelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, meat, vegetable, etc.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley, 53, is married and has six children, one of whom is still in school. For five years she has raised pigs in the Philippines. Shirley requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Shirley would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, 37, is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. For 15 years, Corazon has farmed corn in the Philippines. She requested a 4000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Corazon has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ma. Remia

texts.en:
Ma. Remia is a 52-year-old married woman with seven children, three attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Remia has had a rice business for 1 year and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers.

In the future, Ma. Remia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Jose Davier

texts.es:
Jose es un padre de 37 años de edad, emprendedor y dinámico. 
Con el ánimo de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar, decidió iniciar su propio negocio de salsamentaria, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que le colabora en las mañanas, así ha logrado solventar los gastos familiares y personales durante 9 meses que lleva funcionando su negocio. 

El crédito que solicita estará destinado para la compra de surtido de insumos como bebidas y licores, esto le permitirá continuar con su labor y ofrecer sus alimentos de una mejor manera, abriendo paso para un mejoramiento en las ventas y por ende, en los ingresos que percibe. 

Jose, con su espíritu de superación y su proyección hacia la consecución de sus objetivos, se traza la meta de ampliar su negocio, para tener la capacidad de atender a mayor cantidad de clientes, mejorando así la rentabilidad del establecimiento para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José, a father aged 37, is dynamic and entrepreneurial.

He decided to open his own delicatessen in order to earn an income for his family. His wife helps in the mornings, and he has been able to cover family and personal expenses for the 9 months that he has been running his business.

He is requesting a loan in order to increase his stock of supplies such as drinks and liquor, and to be able to improve the presentation of the food. In this way, he will improve his sales and increase his earnings.

José, who is determined to overcome difficulties and achieve his objectives, has set himself the goal of expanding his business, being able to serve more clients, and improving his establishment's profitability so that he can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as drinks and liquor so that he can continue his business.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa de 44 años de edad, estudió hasta 7º grado, está soltera y tiene dos  hijos que viven con ella los cuales se encuentran estudiando.

Rosa tiene negocio de plátanos, desde pequeña se ha dedicado al negocio, su padre le enseñó el trabajo, también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos. La platanera está como a 1 cuadra de  distancia de su casa y la venta la hace 1 vez por mes.

Este crédito lo solicita para comprar abono para aplicar a la platanera y así mejorará su producción.

El sueño de Rosa es sembrar más en su terreno para hacer crecer mas el negocio, espera que sus hijos se encarguen del negocio cuando ella no esté y las ganancias las usará para pagar la cuota del préstamo y para superarse.
texts.en:
Rosa, 44, studied up to the seventh grade. She is single and has two children who go to school and live with her.

Rosa grows bananas. She has done so since she was a child, taught by her father. She also raises pigs. The banana plantation is located around one block from where she lives. She sells her produce once a month.

She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her plantations, in order to improve her harvest.

Her dream is to plant more banana trees in her land, in order to expand her business. She hopes that her children take over the business when she dies. She will use the profits to pay back the loan and continue getting ahead.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her banana plantations, and improve her harvest.

loans.name: Shaista

texts.en:
Shaista is 37-years-old married woman, she is a responsible mother and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. This is her fifth loan with the BRAC and first with the Kiva. She owns a small business of selling clothing from home. She purchases clothes from the market at low prices and sells them for higher prices in her community. The ladies of town like her garments collection and selection a lot. He family members appreciate her for her efforts.

Now the winter season is going to be start, she wants to buy the clothes related to winter season to sell. But she does not have cash in hand due to household expenses. Therefore, She has requested a loan so she can buy winter seasons's clothing to cope with the demand. She wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream to provide a better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy winter season's clothes for reselling from her home. .

loans.name: Putheary's Group

texts.en: Putheary’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Putheary makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming cassava in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from her raising pigs.

Laila dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 34 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rosalie has a gardening business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalie has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is 55 years old and married with one child. Francisca works very hard to provide for them.

Francisca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Francisca has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Francisca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Hamisu

texts.en: Hamisu is a maize farmer from Sarkin Fada village in Nigeria. As a Babban Gona member, Hamisu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Hamisu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. Hamisu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Hamisu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Hamisu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en:
Yusra, 32, lives with her parents. She is single and she has her own business. It’s a bookstore and also sells office supplies, photocopying etc.

Her bookstore is near her house which she can buy variety kinds of materials such as files, pens, clips, calculators…etc. Yusra wants to grow her bookstore to have the ability attract more customers and improve her income.

As a result, Yusra is asking ALIBDAA for a loan of $1000, in order to purchase new supplies such as clips, scissors, hanging files, notebooks, pens. Yusra is very thankful for Kiva’s partner ALIBDAA.

loans.use: to purchase new supplies such as clips, scissors, hanging files, notebooks, pen etc.

loans.name: Yuraima

texts.es:
Yuraima tiene gran experiencia en el área de panadería, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia panadería que hasta ahora le ha generado muy buenos resultados.
Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm

Actualmente necesita un auxilio para comprar insumos como Harina, queso, levaduras, entre otros.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones a través de uno buenos ingredientes.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran panadería que surta diferentes tiendas y restaurantes en la región.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada y con un mayor y mejor cantidad de insumos.
texts.en:
Yuraima has a great experiences as a baker. Some time ago, she opened her own bakery, and so far it has had good results. She has always preferred to work independently. She works every day, from 8:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.

She needs now some help to buy ingredients such as flour, cheese, and yeast.

This loan will help her to improve her working conditions, and guarantee the good quality of the things she prepares by using ingredients of good quality.

Her biggest dream is to be able to have a large bakery that supplies products to stores and restaurants in the region.

With this help, she will be able to work in an orderly way, and with more and better ingredients.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, cheese, and yeast.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 51 year old lady who owns a boutique and a salon at Mombasa,Kenya. She is a mother of one child.

Alice has been in this business for the last five years with a good income.

This is her fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business, after repaying the previous ones successfully.

She will use the money requested to purchase beauty soaps, hair oil, shampoo and nail polish and the anticipated profit to repay her loan.

She hopes to own a big boutique in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase beauty soaps, hair oil, shampoo and nail polish

loans.name: Seven Home Group

texts.en:
The Seven Home group is composed of 5 women. All members live next door. Novi,(in the middle) a 30 year old woman is the leader and representative of the group on Kiva. Novi is married to Daniel, a 27 year old employee.

As the parent Novi and husband have a dream to provide a good education for her children in the future. This reason led her to help her husband in making money by selling snacks, sugar, corn, coconuts, etc at one of elementary school. She started this business since 2 years ago. She has planned to enhance the business as the income enables her to meet their daily living.
When she got information about TLM group loan product from an Account Officer she then shared it with other women in the village. When four women were interested, she then formed the Seven Home group and requested a loan of totaling IDR 15,000,000 for their business improvement and other thing. They are really appreciated for Kiva support via TLM for those with the small businesses.

loans.use: to purchase more stock and supplies such as, snacks, sugar, corn, coconuts, etc

loans.name: Ivan Dario

texts.es:
En la música encuentran muchas personas una oportunidad para progresar y salir delante de una manera humilde y con mucho coraje, tal es el caso de Ivan que a sus 27 años es un joven con gran talento y pasión por este arte.
Toca varios instrumentos musicales, casi todos ellos de origen colombiano y latino.

Solicita un apoyo económico para realizar la compra de una planta de sonido y un karaoke, el cual le permitirá continuar con su arte con el cual ha intentado obtener algunos ingresos para el sostenimiento de sus estudios y aportar con la economía de su hogar.

Una de las grandes dificultades que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de oportunidades para crecer y desarrollarse como músico, pero poco a poco intentara tener una vida mejor.

Apoya a Ivan con su arte y haz que su vida sea mejor con un préstamo.
texts.en:
In music, many people find an opportunity to progress and get ahead in a humble way and with more courage. This is the case of Ivan who, at 27 years old, is a young man with great talent and passion for this art.

He plays various musical instruments. Almost all are of Colombian and Latin origin.

He is requesting economic support to buy a sound amplifier and a karaoke machine, which will allow him to continue with his art and with which he intends to obtain some income to support his studies and support his household.

One of the biggest difficulties that he has had is facing the lack of opportunities to grow and develop as a musician. But, gradually, he is trying to have a better life.

Support Ivan with his art and make his life better with a loan.

loans.use: to buy a sound amplifier and karaoke machine, which will allow him to continue with his art.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristina is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Cristina has a bakery business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, etc..

Cristina has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Delmy

texts.es:
Delmy, de 67 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, estudio hasta noveno grado, no quiso seguir estudiando para ayudar a sus padres en los ingresos del hogar y se dedicó a ayudarle a su madre en un negocio que tenían de venta de verduras, actualmente vive sola, porque sus hijos son mayores de edad y ya formaron su propias familias.  

Delmy, se dedica a la venta de ropa americana usada, este negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitación y tiene la ventaja de que está ubicada en una zona céntrica, tiene 10 años de tenerlo y la experiencia en el negocio la adquirió con su mamá cuando le ayudaba en el negocio familiar. 

Delmy, necesita el préstamo para comprar más ropa, porque se lo están vendiendo más barato y quiere aprovechar la oferta. 

Delmy, sueña con seguir trabajando y crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Delmy, 67 years old, is an entrepreneurial and hard working woman. She finished ninth grade. She didn't want to keep studying so she could help her parents with the family income and she dedicated herself to helping her mother with the business they had selling vegetables. Currently, she lives alone because her children are adults and already have their own families.

Delmy is dedicated to selling used American clothing. She has this business in her house and has the advantage that it is located in a central area. She has had it for ten years and she acquired experience in the business with her mother when she helped her with the family business.

Delmy needs the loan to buy more clothing because it is on sale and she wants to take advantage of the offer.

Delmy dreams of continuing to work and grow with her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes because they are on sale and she wants to take advantage of the offer.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y su compañera de vida se dedica a los oficios domésticos, solo su hija de 2 años vive con él y por lo tanto solo dos personas dependen de Guillermo.

Guillermo tiene ganado para repasto, lleva 5 años en el trabajo con ganado, decidió dedicarse a esto porque le ayuda  para salir adelante, él lugar donde labora está a 4 kilómetros de su casa y viaja en caballo. 


Guillermo solicita este crédito para comprar una novilla.


Él sueña con darle un buen futuro a su hija y continuar trabajando en la ganadería.
texts.en:
Guillermo, aged 38, attended school up to the sixth grade. He has a partner, who carries out the household tasks. Only his 2-year-old daughter lives with them, so he has just two dependents.

Guillermo has worked with livestock for pasture for the last five years. He chose this business because it allows him to make a living. He works 4 kilometers from his home and makes the journey on horseback.

Guillermo is requesting a loan in order to buy a heifer.

He dreams of being able to provide his daughter with a good future, and to be able to continue working with livestock.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Lim's Group

texts.en: Lim’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Lim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Blanca Aminta

texts.es:
Blanca, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, debido a la situación económica de su familia no pudo continuar estudiando, está casada y es madre de tres hijos, los cuales están en la escuela, mientras su esposo trabaja como agente de seguridad publica. 

Blanca, tiene 8 meses de experiencia en cuidar pollos de engorde, esta actividad la aprendió por si sola porque no tenia una fuente de ingresos estable; antes trabajaba solo con su esposo en la siembra de granos básicos, ahora en este nuevo negocio trabajan también sus hijos mayores. 

Blanca, necesita el préstamo para comprar terneras para que sus hijos vayan teniendo experiencia en como trabajar en el campo.

Blanca, sueña con ayudar a sus hijos para que se preparen academicamente y que puedan tener una profesión y tengan más oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Blanca, 30, finished high school. Due to her family's financial situation, she could not continue studying. She is married, and the mother of three children, who go to school. Her husband works as a public security officer.

Blanca has been raising broilers for eight months, an activity she learned on her own, since she did not have a stable source of income. She used to work with her husband growing vegetables. Her oldest children work with her in this new business.

Blanca needs this loan to buy heifers. She wants her children to gain experience in farming.

Blanca dreams of helping her children, so that they receive a good education, become professionals, and can find good job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary, who is in her early 30s, is single with two schooling-going children. She has been selling cosmetics for five years now. She works from 08am to 08pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mary's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy up-to- date cosmetics to meet her customers' requirement. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees for her children, to repay loan, to reinvest in business, and to cover household expenses.

She will use this loan to increase the cosmetics stock. She dreams of expanding her business and selling at wholesale prices.

Mary will make sure she pays back her loan within the loan schedule.

loans.use: to increase the cosmetics stock.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 46 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Sonia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Sonia has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Jesus Dario

texts.es:
Jesus es del municipio de San Pedro, se dedica al comercio hace 8 años, es soltero, y con la ayuda de su madre se ha abierto camino y hoy día ya es muy conocido en el sector donde ubica su negocio.

Se dedica a la venta de elementos para el hogar, ropa, accesorios, entre otros, y con ello puede tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia. 

Es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora que quiere salir adelante y tener una vida llena de éxitos y triunfos.

Pide este préstamo para la compra de surtido, de manera a que pueda mejorar sus ingresos por medio de su trabajo y puede ir aumentando su negocio de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Jesus is from the town of San Pedro. He has been dedicated to trade for eight years. He is single and, with the help of his mother, he has made his way and today he is very well known in the area where his business is located.

He is dedicated to selling items for the home, clothing, accessories, among other things and thus can have the means to be able to help his family.

He is a very hard working person and a fighter who wants to progress and have a life full of successes and triumphs.

He is requesting this loan to buy stock in a way that he can improve his income through his work and be able to keep expanding his business in the best way.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing, accessories, among other items to sell.

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth, who is in her mid 40s, is married with six children who are still in school. She has been running a gengeduka for 20 years now. She works from 06am to 08pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Magreth's twentieth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open a duka and increase the genge stock. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully.

She is doing fine with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay loan, bought a plot of land, bought a flat screen TV set, a radio, bought a farm, bought beds, mattresses, cupboards, built her house and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to restock the out-of-stock items in the gengeduka store. She dreams of buying Irish potatoes from up country and owning a car.

Magreth will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out-of-stock items in the gengeduke store.

loans.name: Ediht Yaneth

texts.es:
Ediht, a sus 29 años de edad es soltera y no tiene hijos. Desde pequeña ha tenido un gusto particular por los animales, especialmente por las aves, razón por la cual, hace 5 años con el apoyo de sus padres comenzó a criar gallinas y pollos de engorde.

Logró tener una muy buena cantidad de animales para obtener recursos, siendo sus principales clientes  los habitantes del municipio de Yolombo; así genera ingresos para aportar al sostenimiento de su hogar. 

Ediht es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora, siempre va en busca de opciones que le permitan progresar, por esta razón solicita el crédito que será invertido en la compra de pollos y comprar el alimento para continuar con el cuidado y cría de todas sus aves, de esta manera podrá tener disponibilidad suficiente para vender y así generar mejores utilidades. 

Ella sueña con tener el dinero suficiente para mejorar las condiciones en su hogar.
texts.en:
Ediht, at 29, is single and does not have any children. Since she was young, she has had a particular liking for animals, especially for birds, the reason for which five years ago, with the support of her parents, she started to raise hens and chickens to fatten.

She managed to have a very good quantity of animals to obtain income. Her main customers are the residents of the town of Yolombo and she thus earns income to support her household.

Ediht is a very enterprising and innovative woman. She is always in search of options that allow her to progress. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will be invested in the purchase of chickens and buy feed to continue with the care and raising of all of her birds. In this way, she will be able to have sufficient availability to sell and thus generate better profits.

She dreams of having enough money to improve the condition of her home.

loans.use: to buy chicken and feed to continue with the care and raising of all of her birds.

loans.name: Leydi Noemy

texts.es:
Leydi, de 30 años de edad, estudio bachillerato contador, tiene una hija de cuatro años, está casada, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y en esta temporada se dedica a cortar café en la finca, son una familia muy unida y trabajadora.

Leydi, tiene una tienda desde hace 5 años, ya que en busca de llevar un ingreso extra a su familia ella decidió colocar su propio negocio, el cual le genera un buen ingreso; y para llegar al lugar donde está tiene que caminar durante 15 minutos todos los días, pues está ubicada en la casa de sus padres.

Leydi, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como azúcar, frijol, arroz, aceite, galletas, jugos y gaseosas  para surtir más su tienda. 

Ella sueña con ver a su hija crecer y que sea una persona de bien y que estudie una carrera universitaria; y también quiere que su pequeña tienda crezca más.
texts.en:
Leydi is 30 years old, and studied accounting in high school.  She has a four year old daughter, is married, and her husband works in agriculture and during this season he picks coffee on the farm.  They are a very close and hard working family.

Leydi has had a grocery store for 5 years, since looking to provide extra income for her family she decided to put up her own business, which generates a good income.  To reach the place where it is she has to walk for 15 minutes every day, as it is located in the house of her parents.

Leydi needs the loan to purchase more goods like sugar, beans, rice, oil, cookies, juices and soft drinks to stock her store.

She dreams of seeing her daughter grow up and be a good person and get a university degree.  She would also like her small store to grow.

loans.use: to purchase more goods like sugar, beans, rice, oil, cookies, juices and soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Sou's Group

texts.en:
A 60-year-old woman from Battambang province, Sou is married and blessed with six children. She supports her family’s living by growing cassava. Her business’s challenge is a lack of working capital.

Sou has been with VisionFund for a loan cycle already, and it has enabled her to improve her living conditions and meet the family’s basic needs in a timely manner.

In a group which is comprised of three members, Sou is the leader, and she will use her loan to buy cassava seedlings and organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity, and to pay for laborers and plowing fees.

She hopes she will earn more income to upgrade her standard of living.
