loans.use: to buy cassava seedlings and organic fertilizer to improve crop productivity so her living conditions can be improved.

loans.name: Ireen

texts.en:
Ireen is a 36-year-old mother living in a fishing community in the Nyami-nyami district of Zimbabwe. She has been running her business since 2007, and sells clothing, jewelry, travel bags, and food items.

Ireen used the money from her first Kiva loan to increase the diversity of products in her shop and has since expanded her client base. Her success has improved her standard of living and made it possible to send her 15-year-old daughter to boarding school. Ireen is also able to care for her ailing sister.

Building on her success, Ireen seeks a second Kiva loan to purchase more stock for her business, especially for the increased demand around Christmas.

Ireen is the leader of her local Cama chapter, and will continue to repay her interest as “social-interest” through her weekly volunteer work as a Community Health Trainer.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her business, especially for the increased demand around Christmas.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresa is 52 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Teresa has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials to her business.

Teresa has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Diego Leon

texts.es:
Diego, con 32 años de edad, es casado. Aprendió las labores del campo con su madre.

Gracias a esto, se dedica a criar ganado lechero, cuya producción se utiliza para elaborar y vender quesos y el líquido como tal; de esta forma obtiene los ingresos suficientes para apoyar con los gastos del hogar. 

El cliente es un hombre luchador, pujante, activo; ni la necesidad económica, ni la falta de oportunidades de empleo la detienen para seguir luchando y progresar. 

Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de más ganado (vaca productora de leche), con el fin de aumentar su producción para poder satisfacer la demanda de los productos y así tener mejores ingresos. 

Esto le permitirá seguir ayudando con las obligaciones económicas del hogar y además podrá seguir invirtiendo  en su negocio para obtener más vacas y, poco a poco ir mejorando las condiciones y la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Diego is 32 years old and he is married. He learned how to work in the agricultural field with his mother.

Thanks to these teachings, he engages in breeding dairy cattle, whose byproducts are used to prepare and then sell cheese and milk. Thanks to this activity he earns the money he needs to pay for his household expenses.

He is a determined, strong and active man: nothing stops him from keeping on fighting to progress, neither economic needs nor the lack of job opportunities.

He is currently requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of more cattle (milk cows) in order to increase his production to then comply with the requests for his products, consequently increasing hi income.

This will help him continue paying for his household's expenses; on top of this, he will be able to continue investing in his activity to buy more cows, little by little improving his family's living conditions and standard of living.

loans.use: buy more cows to increase his production.

loans.name: Marta Lucia

texts.es:
Marta es una campesina del oriente antioqueño que se caracteriza por su empuje y el esmero con el que trabaja diariamente para sacar adelante a su hijo de 17 años.
Actualmente se gana la vida trabajando como agricultora, pues es la actividad que aprendió de sus padres y que, hoy en día se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Esto la motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para hacerle frente a un gran desafío que se le presentó en la última cosecha, pues con los fuertes cambios climáticos se dañaron sus cultivos, ocasionando pérdidas económicas.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, semillas, pesticidas, fertilizantes, entre otro) y realizar una ampliación de  sus cultivos, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y estará en la capacidad para vender más productos, lo que le ayudará a recuperar su capital de trabajo para reinvertir en sus cultivos y solventar las necesidades básicas del hogar. 
Marta manifiesta que su único propósito es seguir luchando para que su hijo puedan disfrutar un mejor bienestar y educación para que sea una persona idónea, además quiere inculcarle, el amor por el campo y la agricultura, para que siga con su legado y nunca pase necesidades de ningún tipo.
texts.en:
Marta is a country woman from eastern Antioquia known for the drive and dedication with which she works daily to get her 17 year old son ahead.

Currently, she makes a living working as a farmer since it's the activity that she learned from her parents and which, today, has become her main source of income. This motivates her to request the support of the loan to face a large challenge which presented itself with the last harvest. With the strong climate changes, her crops were damaged, causing economic loss.

The loan requested will be invested in the purchase of agricultural inputs at wholesale (fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, among others) and to expand her crops. This will allow her to expand production and will enable her to sell more products which will help her to recuperate working capital to reinvest in her crops and cover the basic needs of her home.

Marta says that her only purpose is to keep fighting so that her son can enjoy a better well being and education so he becomes an ideal person. Additionally she wants to instill in him a love for the countryside and agriculture so that he continues the legacy and never wants for anything.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs at wholesale (fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, among others).

loans.name: María Iveth

texts.es:
María de 29 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, tiene dos hijos y lo dos están estudiando.

María trabaja vendiendo ropa, desde hace 10 años comenzó a trabajar en esta actividad, también destaza cerdos  y su horario es de 7:30 AM a 12:30 PM.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar blusas, camisetas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior, etc para continuar con su negocio.          

Ella sueña con que su negocio de ropa sea exitoso y así incrementará sus ingresos, ademas espera que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.
texts.en:
29-year old María has a grade 7 education. She has a husband who works in agriculture and two children both of whom attend school.

For ten years María has sold clothing; she also butchers pigs. She works from 7:30am to 12:30 pm.

María is seeking a loan to buy blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, underwear etc. for her business. Her dream is to own a successful business, increase her income, and have her children complete their education.
.

loans.use: buy blouses, shirts, pants, skirts, underwear etc.

loans.name: Jose Dario

texts.es:
Jose, es un campesino de 56 años de edad, padre de 3 hijos a los cuales ha sacado adelante junto con su esposa.

Durante toda su vida productiva se ha dedicado a realizar las labores del campo, aprendidas de sus padres quienes le enseñaron desde que era muy niño. Gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de caña de azúcar y además tiene ganado de levante, trabaja solo todos los días desde las primeras horas del día, cuenta con la ventaja de tener amplia experiencia y conocimiento en el manejo de las labores agropecuarias; pero su principal desafío es acarrear los altos costos de los insumos que requiere para el cuidado de sus cultivos y de sus animales, además debe luchar contra los bajos precios de venta de los productos en el mercado; sin embargo, con mucho empeño, empuje y perseverancia, ha logrado salir victorioso de todas estas dificultades. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea aumentar su producción y tener la posibilidad de incrementar sus ingresos familiares, el dinero será invertido en compra de insumos agropecuarios como abono y pesticidas.
texts.en:
Jose, 56, is a farmer, and father of three children who he raised with his wife.
For all of his working life he has worked in the fields, a labor his parents taught him from a very young age. Thanks to that background, now he grows sugar cane and also raises cattle. He works on his own every day starting at dawn, he has the advantage of ample experience and knowledge managing crops, but his main challenge is the high costs of the supplies required to tend his crops and his animals. Also he must overcome the low prices of his products at the market. Still, with a great deal of effort and perseverance, he has been able to emerge victorious over all of these difficulties. Now he is seeking a loan to improve his production and possibly increase his household income. He will invest the money in farming supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es: José tiene 68 años de edad y vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa a la que siempre busca la manera de brindar lo mejor. Él es un hombre trabajador que se apoya en su trabajo para salir adelante, por lo que desde hace 40 años se dedica a la venta de ganado bovino, lo cual le permite salir adelante con su esposa. José desea construir una galera en el corredor de su vivienda, ya que él cuenta con aves de corral, por lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para construir una galera para sus aves de corral.
texts.en:
José, aged 68, lives in his own home with his wife, for whom he has always tried to provide the best he can.

He is a hard-working man, who relies on his work in order to get ahead. He has sold cattle for the last 40 years, which has allowed him to provide for himself and his wife. José keeps poultry and wants to build a coop in his porch. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails and wire for the construction of the coop.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails and wire for building a shelter for his poultry.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Kossiwa est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge. Kossiwa est âgée de 36 ans et vit à Adidogomè où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice du haricot. Kossiwa s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un appartement à la devanture de son domicile. Kossiwa sollicite ce crédit pour commander des bols du haricot en vue de bien vendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de la famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Kossiwa is a married woman who has four children in her care. She is 36 years old and lives in Adidogomè where she carries out her activity preparing and selling beans. Kossiwa gets her supplies of the goods necessary to make her beans twice a month from the market and resells them under an apartment in front of her home.

She is requesting this loan to order bowls of beans, so that she can sell them at a good price and make more profit. She will thereby be able to help her husband to provide for the family's needs and improve their children's daily living conditions.

loans.use: to buy 70 bowls of beans.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi est une femme mariée qui vit à Adidogomè avec ses deux enfants à charge. Agée de 51 ans, Akouavi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois et de produits alimentaires qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Akouavi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon, des sacs de riz et des bidons d’huile en vue de mieux vendre puis de réaliser plus de bénéfice et pouvoir aider sa famille à subvenir à certains besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve.
texts.en:
Akouavi is a married woman who lives in Adidogomè with her two dependant children. She is 51 years old and sells charcoal as well as groceries, which she stocks up on twice a month at the market. She resells her goods in front of her home.

Akouavi needs this loan to finance the purchase of sacks of charcoal, sacks of rice and containers of oil, so that she can sell them on at a good price and make more profits. This will enable her to help to provide some of the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of charcoal, six sacks of rice and five containers of oil.

loans.name: Wemie

texts.en:
Wemie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wemie is 40 years old, and her children are still in school.

Wemie has a fishing business in the Philippines. Wemie requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Wemie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay for fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

loans.name: Gloria Estela

texts.es:
Gloria es una campesina de 51 años de edad, que desde que era muy niña ha estado involucrado en las tareas agropecuarias, pues sus padres le enseñaron todo lo relacionado con el cultivo de tierras y el cuidado de animales. 

Actualmente trabaja de manera independiente, se dedica a producir leche, ya que posee vacas lecheras, este líquido es vendido a un recolector que pasa día a día y de esta forma genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos de su familia, conformada por su esposo (Ver Foto) y 1 hijo. 

Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar un novillo, esto con el fin de incrementar la producción y poder vender más producto para mejorar los ingresos que percibe por su labor. 

Gloria sueña con darle continuidad a su actividad generadora de ingresos para poder brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is a 51-year old woman from the countryside. Ever since she was a young girl she has been involved in farming as her parents taught her everything about caring for the land and raising animals. Now she works independently in the milk production business. She owns dairy cows and sells the milk to a collector who comes by every day. This is how she earns money to pay for family expenses. Her family consists of her husband (see photo) and son.

Now Gloria is is seeking a loan to buy a new cow and increase production. Then she will be able to sell more milk and increase income for the work she does. Her dream is to continue with the job and earn more money so she can provide her family with a better life and standard of living.

loans.use: buy a new cow and increase milk production

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en: Ret’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Ret makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Hilsia Magdalena

texts.es:
Hilsia, de 29 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora que con mucho esfuerzo estudio hasta bachillerato opción secretariado; actualmente está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a trabajar como agricultor y juntos tienen una hija de 8 años de edad que está estudiando segundo grado.

Hilsia, se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, pero actualmente trabaja con una tía de ella, a quien ayuda a realizar las labores en su casa; ella se levanta a las 3:30 de la mañana para preparar el alimento que su esposo lleva a su trabajo y tiene que ir a dejar a su hija a la escuela. 

Hilsia, necesita el préstamo para colocar una pequeña tienda en donde venderá gaseosas, pan, golosinas, galletas, aceite, azúcar, entre otros.

Hilsia, sueña con tener una tienda grande y también desea que su hija pueda graduarse de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Hilsia is 29 years old, is a fighter who, with much effort, studied up to high school, with a secretarial option.  Currently, she lives common law and her partner works as a farmer and together they have a daughter who is 8 years old and who is studying in the second grade.

Hilsia has dedicated herself to household chores since she was a child, but currently works with her aunt, whom she helps with her work at home.  She gets up at 3:30 am to prepare the food that her husband takes to his job and then has to leave to take her daughter to school.

Hilsia needs the loan to set up a small shop where she will sell soft drinks, bread, candy, cookies, oil, sugar, among others.

Hilsia dreams of having a big store and she would also like her daughter to graduate with a university career.

loans.use: to set up a small shop where she will sell soda pop, bread, candy, cookies, oil, sugar, among others.

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sandra de 50 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, no continuó estudiando pues se casó, su esposo es maestro y han procreado 4 hijos, 2 de ellos trabajan y los 2 menores están estudiando.
 
Sandra tiene una tienda desde hace mas de 10 años, ella decidió poner una tienda para generar un poco mas de ingreso al hogar, a Sandra le ayudan sus hijos en horarios que no están  estudiando, y la tienda está abierta de 5:30 AM a 6:30 PM.

 Sandra necesita mucho de este crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, café, golosinas, huevos, jabones, etc para surtir su tienda. 

Su sueño es seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios para que puedan desembolverse en la vida laboral.
texts.en:
Sandra is 50 years old and graduated from high school. She didn't continue her education but got married instead. Her husband is a teacher and they have four children, two of whom work and the two younger ones attend school.

Sandra has run a store for over ten years, a decision she made in order to generate a little more money for the household. Her children help her in the store when they are not in school. The store is open from 5:30 am to 6:30 pm. She has a great need for this loan in order to buy rice, sugar, coffee, candy, eggs, soap etc. as stock for the store. Her dream is to continue supporting her children with their education so they can do well in the workplace.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, coffee, candy, eggs, soap etc. for her store.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 48 years old and widowed with three children. With one child in school, Evelyn works very hard to provide for her family.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

Evelyn has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Evelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like condiments, canned goods, junk food, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 55 years old and married with three children.  

Norma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business.

Norma has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 59 years old and married with four children.  

Patricia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Patricia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Patricia has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Patricia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Sok makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rahana is 45, the mother of five children and her son owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrics tube rods, bulb and energy saver bulbs of various brands. He provides services to his clients for electric goods also. For the growth of his business and desire for getting maximum profit for his family, he wants to buy more electrical goods.

Therefore, she requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her son become empower to buy bulb, tube and energy savers. In addition he wants to some extra electric switches, bulb, bulb holders, sockets etc to offer his customers.
This is fifth loan with BRAC; she describes her wish to take huge amount after this loan. She hopes that her son would be able to grow his business soon.

loans.use: to empower her son in purchasing electrical goods such as bulb, tube, energy savers, electric switches etc for sale.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is 35 years old with a husband and three children. After receiving entrepreneurship training from Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network, Judith has been successfully operating her grocery shop for over a year. Judith used the money from her first Kiva loan to increase stock, add additional commodities, and hire an employee. Judith is requesting a second Kiva loan to make bulk purchases of groceries in order to reduce costs and increase sales. She intends to expand her business and create employment opportunities in her community. Judith also serves as a Cama chairperson and will continue to repay her interest as “social-interest” through her weekly volunteer work as a Community Health Trainer.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of groceries in order to reduce costs and increase sales.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy works hard to support her family. Judy is married and has a welding shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase plain sheet, steel and other materials use for welding.

Judy has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Judy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase plain sheet, steel and other materials use for welding

loans.name: Diego Hernan

texts.es:
Diego  es un campesino de 34 años de edad, que durante toda su vida productiva se ha dedicado a realizar labores del campo como la agricultura y la ganadería, actividades que aprendió al lado de su familia, durante su infancia y adolescencia. 

Actualmente trabaja en una parcelación del municipio donde reside, allí realiza diversas labores y oficios varios y, de manera independiente, posee ganado de levante cuya producción es vendida para complementar los ingresos que recibe en su empleo actual. 

El cliente se caracteriza por ser pujante, activo y dinámico, su persistencia y actitud positiva lo llevan a buscar nuevas alternativas para seguir avanzando; por ello solicita el apoyo de un crédito con el que desea comprar más ganado de levante y lechero, con lo que podrá aumentar su producción y ampliar la oferta de productos, pues podrá complementar los ingresos que recibe y con los que lleva el sustento diario a su hogar. 

Diego  sueña con pagar la educación de sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de su vivenda.
texts.en:
Diego is a 34 year old farmer, who has worked in field labor like farming and raising livestock all his working life. He learned these activities alongside his family during his childhood and adolescence.

He currently works in the zoning department of the municipality in which he resides where he carries out a variety of work and positions. Independently he has beef cattle that are sold to complement the income he makes from his actual employment.

He is seen as being forceful, active and dynamic. His perseverance and positive attitude lead him to look for new alternatives to continue to advance. For this reason he is requesting the support of a loan to buy more beef and milk cows. Doing this he can increase his production and expand the products he offers as they can compliment his income that he receives which provides the daily sustenance for his household.

Diego dreams of paying for his children's education and improving the conditions of his house.

loans.use: to buy more beef and milk cattle to increase his production.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo se ha caracterizado entre sus clientes como un hombre amable y carismático, con 33 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, pues tiene una producción y venta de arepas que comenzó hace aproximadamente 1 año; allí tiene la ventaja de poder estar cerca a su familia.

Su experiencia la obtuvo trabajando con su madre, por lo que su conocimiento en el manejo de este tipo de alimentos es amplio. 

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar un fogón a gas y una motocicleta que utilizara para la distribución de su producto, así tendrá oportunidad de generar mejores ventas e ingresos para seguir luchando para cumplir su propósito a mediano plazo, que es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, en la que pueda compartir con su familia y que su negocio le genere mayor rentabilidad para dar a su hija una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is known amongst his customers as a friendly and charismatic man. At 33 years old he works taking care of his own business as he makes and sells arepas (a ground corn flat-bread), which he started about a year ago. This gives him the advantage of being able to be close to his family.

He gained his experience working with his mother, so he has ample knowledge in the handling of this type of food.

The loan that he is requesting is to help to buy a gas stove and a motorcycle which he will use to distribute his product. Doing this he will have the opportunity to generate greater sales and income to continue to strive to fulfill his medium term goal. It is to improve the conditions of his house to share with his family and for his business to generate greater profit to provide his daughter with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a gas stove and a motorcycle which he will use to distribute his product.

loans.name: Luz Arneda

texts.es:
Luz, a sus 57 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja. Desde joven aprendió las labores del campo, gracias a que es una tradición familiar que ha pasado de generación en generación. 

Actualmente se dedica a la cría de cerdos, pues tiene una  marranera donde tiene una cerda de cría y lechones; los ingresos que recibe son los que genera con la comercialización de los animales. 

La cliente ha pasado por muchas dificultades en los últimos años lo que generó una crisis económica en su hogar; sin embargo supo sobrellevar la situación y poco a poco ha ido superando estas adversidades. 

Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de lechones para cría y engorde, el concentrado para los animales, compra de materiales para mejora de cochera y así poder ir aumentando de esta forma su producción, pues se aproxima la temporada navideña en la que el precio de venta de estos animales se puede incrementar, mejorando notablemente el margen de ganancias. 

Luz desea seguir trabajando con esfuerzo, disciplina y dedicación para lograr que su negocio crezca y sea cada día más rentable, que le permita tener una estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su familia una excelente condición de vida.
texts.en:
Luz is 57 years old and lives in a common law relationship with her partner. Since she was a young person, she learned to work in the fields, thanks to a family tradition that has been passed down generation from generation.
Currently, she works raising pigs. She has a pigpen with a sow and piglets. She earns an income from selling the animals.
Luz has had many difficulties in the last few years, which has created an economic crisis in her home. Nevertheless, she knew that she would endure through the situation and little by little she has overcome these adversities.
She is currently requesting the loan in order to invest it in buying piglets to raise and fatten. It will be invested in the animals and in buying materials to improve their enclosure. In this way she will be able to increase her production in time for the Christmas season when the price for the sale of pigs can increase. This will significantly improve her margin of earnings.
Luz wants to continue working with effort, discipline and dedication to see her business grow and each day become more profitable. This will allow her to have good economic stability and to give her family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and fatten, the loan will be invested in the animals and in buying materials to improve their enclosure. In this way she will be able to increase her production.

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
Carmen, de 28 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella se desempeña como confeccionista y vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros.
Esta actividad la inicio con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios.

Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa deportiva y de este modo tener inventario disponible para vender a sus clientes.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables.
texts.en:
28-year-old Carmen has a clear idea of what she wants in life. She has decided to finish her studies to get ahead and have a good life.

She works as a clothing manufacturer and saleswoman of products such as clothing, accessories and cosmetics.

She started this activity with the aim of finding the necessary resources to support herself and pay for her studies. 

She is an entrepreneurial and disciplined woman. 

She is requesting a loan to buy a wide supply of sports clothing to add to the inventory that she has available for her customers.

She hopes to be able to advance as a businesswoman and to have a more stable income.

loans.use: to buy a wide supply of sports clothing for sale.

loans.name: Andon

texts.en:
Andon is 51 and so is his wife, Mrike, who is in the photograph. Mrike has been admitted to the hospital due to her health issues. They are parents of two who in their early twenties, and they live in a little town in the northern Albania.

Andon works in city landscaping for a little pay of $118 per month, pay that is not even the minimum; however, since he worked in the copper mining industry for 30 years, he receives a pension in the amount of $115 per month. Mrike has not been working these past ten years due to her illness and has been receiving a monthly disability income of $131. The oldest son who is 22 and has finished the university, is waiting to find a job, whereas the second one who is 20 is continuing his studies at a public university away from home.

This loan will be used for Mrike's hospital expenses.

loans.use: to cover medical/hospital expenses for his wife, who has been admitted to a hospital.

loans.name: Esteffani Abigail

texts.es:
Esteffani de 19 años de edad, estudió asta 8º grado octavo grado, es madre soltera  de un niño 4 años de edad que aun no asiste a la escuela,  ella vive con sus abuelos pues no tiene casa propia.
 

Esteffani tiene una venta de pupusas desde hace 1 año, aprendió el trabajo con la abuela pues ella antes tenia el negocio,   la pupusería está en su lugar de vivienda siendo así bastante accesible poder trabajar a diario.

El crédito lo solicita para comprar una cocina, aceite y maíz para elaborar las pupusas.


Ella sueña con darle el estudio a su hijo y enseñarle a practicar los valores.
texts.en:
Esteffani is 19 years old. She studied until the eighth grade and is the single mother of a 4-year-old child who does not attend school yet. She lives with her grandparents since she does not have her own home.

Esteffani has had a pupusa stall for one year. She learned the work from her grandmother, as she had the business before. The pupusa stand is in her home, making it accesible enough to be able to do her daily work.

She requests a loan in order to buy a stove, oil, and corn to make the pupusas.

She dreams of giving an education to her child and teaching him to practice values.

loans.use: to buy a stove, oil, and corn in order to make pupusas.

loans.name: Aslonboy

texts.ru: 60 летный житель города Исфара Аслонбой. Он семейный мужчина. У него трое детей. Аслонбой честный дедушка. Его жена занимается портнихой. Старший сын занимается таксистом в городе. Остальные дети находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Аслонбой трудолюбивый человек. Он занимается водителем такси более 20 лет. Аслонбой микроавтобус марки «Mercedes Sprinter».Он перевозить людей в городе. Аслонбой сейчас не выгодно арендовать автомашину, но он вынужден зарабатывать и кормить семью. Ему помогает дети обеспечить семью, но Аслонбой главарь семьи он обеспечить семью. Он не хочет сидеть дома без дел. Аслонбой обратился за кредитом, чтобы приобрести себе микроавтобус для перевоза людей. На своей автомашине ему будет выгодно зарабатывать. Аслонбой с большой надеждой обратился к Вам за кредитом. Он заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Aslonboy is 60 years old and a resident of Isfara. He is a family man, with three children as well as grandchildren. His wife works as a dressmaker. His oldest son is a taxi driver in the city, and his other children work abroad in Russia. Aslonboy is a hard worker. He has been a taxi driver for over 20 years. He uses a Mercedes Sprinter minibus to drive people around the city, but at this time renting the vehicle swallows all of his profit. His children help support the family, but as the head of the household he needs to earn money and feed his family. He also wouldn't want to sit at home unemployed. Aslonboy is requesting a loan to buy himself a minibus. Owning his own vehicle will make his taxi business profitable. Aslonboy has high hopes in requesting a loan from you. He thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy a Mercedes Sprinter minibus

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 35 years old and has seven children. Nelly is married and five of her children are in school.

Nelly is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nelly has been in this business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nelly would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and supplies to raise pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 42 years old and has three children. With two of her children in school, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and other groceries.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 52 years old and married with five children. Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

Myrna has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Myrna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store.

loans.name: Roeurn's Group

texts.en:
Roeurn, aged 58, is a widowed woman who lives in Banteay Meanchey province. She has eight children, one of whom still relies on her. Her family’s income is from raising pigs and working for others for a fee. She has been involved in her farming business for 38 years and she earns about USD 11 per day. She can manage to save about USD 6 each day for future needs. The challenges in the pig raising business are pig diseases and low price of pigs sold in the market.

Having been with VisionFund for eight loan cycles, Roeurn has been able to cover all expenses in her family. She, the group leader, will use her loan to buy feed to nourish her pigs. She hopes that her pigs will be healthier and fat enough to sell at good price so that she can expand her pig-raising business and improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Mercy Group

texts.en:
“Weaving is the best choice to earn my livelihood,” says Lamkhokim, a very talented and skillful weaver from a village in the hills. She is 50 years old and the featured borrower of ‘Mercy’ group. She is pictured with her hand raised. The featured borrower was selected by the group members based on their skills and personality. She lives with her children and grandchildren under one roof. She weaves traditional wraparound skirts to sell for profit. She learned weaving from her neighbour friend six years ago. She can weave one skirt per month if it is a complex design. She can weave two skirts if the design is a normal one.

The weaving business is special to her since it completes the family’s financial loopholes. The best part is when the skirts are ready for sale. She feels good and proud when customers buy her products and people give good comment about the extra finishing touch of her designs.

With the Kiva loan, she will buy yarn to weave traditional skirts. The profit will help her to pay their household requirements and expenses. She also aspires to buy a handloom in the future to help in her weaving business. She is very excited about the loan and thanks the lenders.

The other group members are self-reliant women who strive to succeed in their businesses. The loan will help them to achieve their business goals in great deal. They thank the lenders.

loans.use: to buy yarn to weave skirts for profit and provide for her family's requirements.

loans.name: Malam

texts.en:
Malam is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Malam is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Malam would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest time to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Malam will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Malam now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: with working capital for his farm.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
As a married parent of eleven children, Thelma works hard to support her family.

Thelma has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Thelma is borrowing PHP 7000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her tricycle transport business.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts or her transport business.

loans.name: Elsadai Group

texts.en:
“If I don’t work for a day, I don’t have to eat for a day,” is the primary belief of Lamchin, the featured borrower of the group ‘Elsadai.’ She is a very hardworking woman. She is pictured with her hand raised with the group members.

She is 38 years old and a mother to six children. “I send four children to school, the second youngest does not go to school since I cannot afford to do so while the youngest is still a toddler and I’m very concerned about the youngest two,” says Lamchin. Her husband is a daily labourer.

Lamchin is a weaver. She weaves traditional shawls at her home and sells them for profit. Her favourite part about being a weaver is that she can weave at home and at the same time look after her young ones and be there when her children come back from school. She usually buys her weaving supplies once a month from the nearest market. Her shawls go to one supplier in the town nearby. “Sales are better in the months of October till March,” she says. The profit from her weavings are used to pay for her children’s school fees and also buy rice (staple food) for the family.

With the Kiva loan, she will buy 15 kilograms of yarn to weave traditional shawls for profit. The profit will help her pay for her children’s school fees and buy rice for her family. She is very excited and happy to get the loan. This loan will help her improve her living conditions. If the business is successful, she wants to fulfill her dreams of sending all her children to school in the future. She says “thank you Kiva.”

loans.use: to buy yarn to weave for profit and pay for her children's school fees and family expenses.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 27-year-old single mother of two living in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. Violet is running a poultry business project and using her first Kiva loan she was able to build a big fowl run and purchase her chick feed in bulk.

Violet points out that the Kiva loan transformed her life from being just an ordinary person into a business woman with high hopes of venturing and opening up into bigger markets. Violet is now able to pay school fees for her children, and buy food and clothes for the family. She is now able to supply even big poultry orders in her community.

Violet is requesting for a second loan to further expand her poultry business. As a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, Violet continues to work to improve the well-being of students in the local community by teaching them valuable life skills.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, chick feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a 36-year-old married mother of three living in the Nyami-nyami District of Zimbabwe. Sheila started her business in 2006, and now supports her family by selling dried fish in nearby towns.

Sheila used the money from her first Kiva loan to purchase fish in bulk and boosted her profits. Through the success of her business, Sheila is able to pay her children’s school fees.

Sheila seeks a second Kiva loan to further expand her business and increase her stock in preparation for the festive season. Sheila encourages other young women in her community to be economically independent and will continue to repay her interest as “social-interest” through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions.

loans.use: to expand her fish selling business.

loans.name: Alh. Adamu

texts.en:
Alh. Adamu is maize farmer from Suddu village. As a member of Babban Gona, Alh. Adamu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Alh. Adamu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Adamu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Alh. Adamu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with it.

loans.use: with working capital for his farm.

loans.name: Bester

texts.en:
As a single woman, Bester works hard to run her business selling casual wear, formal wear, school uniforms, and blankets in the district of Chikomba East, Zimbabwe where she lives.

Using her first Kiva loan, Bester managed to expand her business. She is now able to buy large quantities of clothes and shoes.

Bester has managed to rent a shop from which she is conducting her business. She is in the process of building her mother a home using the profits from her business.

With a second Kiva loan Bester plans to expand her business to sell more clothing as well as a variety of additional products.

Bester spends her free time volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide teaching students life skills to prepare them for their transition from high school.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Arlet Rosana

texts.es:
Arlet es una campesina dedicada a la cría y comercialización de cerdos, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, pues nació en el seno de una familia humilde que siempre se dedicó a las actividades agropecuarias. 

Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo para complementar los ingresos familiares. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha sobrepasado diversos desafíos que se le presentan, especialmente por la lejanía de la vereda donde reside, lo que le aumenta los gastos de transporte. 

Sin embargo, sabe llevar la situación y siempre ha salido adelante, motivado por su esposo y sus hijos. Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que desea comprar una cerda para crías y concentrado para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción, especialmente para satisfacer la demanda que aumenta en la temporada de fin de año, donde el consumo de esta carne se incrementa notablemente, mejorando así sus ventas y los ingresos que recibe por ellas. 

De esta manera, Arlet desea continuar trabajando arduamente para hacer de su actividad, un negocio rentable y perdurable en el tiempo, que le genere buenos ingresos y en un futuro poder tener la posibilidad de adquirir su propia finca en la que tenga sus animales y sus cultivos, generando mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar para los que ama.
texts.en:
Arlet is a farmer who works raising and selling pigs. She learned this activity from her parents as she was born into a humble family who have always worked in agricultural activities.

She has the help of her husband to compliment the family income. Through her effort and dedication she has managed to overcome the challenges that have arisen especially given the isolation of the community she resides in, which has increased her transportation costs.

However she knows how to solve problems and has always gotten ahead, motivated by her husband and children. She is currently requesting the support of a loan as she wants to buy a pig to raise and concentrated feed for her animals. This will allow her to increase her production especially to fill the demand for the end of the year. The consumption of meat increases notably then, improving her sales and the income she receives from the sales.

In this way Arlet wants to continue to work hard to make her activity a profitable and sustainable business that generates good income. In the future she can have the possibility of acquiring her own farm to have her animals and crops, generating better living conditions and well-being for those she loves.

loans.use: to buy a pig to raise and feed for her animals, which will allow her to increase her production.

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.ru: Заррина родилась в 1985 году в городе Куляб. Она замужем и двоих детей. Детям 4 и 2 года. Ее муж работает учителем в школе. Сама Заррина работает учительницей в школе, и свободное время дома занимается шитьем женской одежды. В 2010 году Заррина начала швейную  деятельность. У нее хорошо получается и каждый день количество клиентов возрастает. Заррина гостеприимная и шустрая женщина. Заррина хочет улучшить жилищные условия семьи и  ускорить процесс своей работы. Она хочет купить стройматериалы для ремонта дома и за часть денег хочет приобрести швейную машинку. Заррина
texts.en: Zarrina was born in Kulyab in 1985. She is married and has two children, a two-year-old and a four-year-old. Both she and her husband are school teachers. Since 2010 Zarrina has been using her free time at home to sew women's clothing. She produces excellent products and her customer base is growing with each day. Zarrina is a warm and intelligent woman. She wants to improve her family's living conditions and speed up her work, so she is asking for a loan to buy construction materials for home repairs and a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy building materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mbayuwayu Group

texts.en:
Kamilius, who is in his mid-thirties, is single with two kids who are still in school. He has been running a tailoring business for seventeen years now. He works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to earn a good monthly profit.

This will be Kamilius's ninth credit from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his stock of sewing equipment and materials and has managed to repay his loans successfully. He is doing great with the loans and appreciates Kiva partner Tujijenge Tanzania for the support of their group. He used the profit to buy a television and a radio, to repay a loan, to pay school fees, to take care of his family and to save some in his bank account.

Kamilius will use this credit to buy sewing equipment and good materials for making good dresses and up-to-date men's suits. He dreams of opening more centers for tailoring.

Kamilius will share this loan with his loan group Mbayuwayu, which consists of seven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing equipment and good materials for making good dresses and up-to-date men's suits.

loans.name: Yeselys Tatiana

texts.es:
Yeselys, junto a su esposo ha podido formar una unidad familiar y productiva bastante fuerte, ya que no solo prima el amor si no también los deseos de salir adelante y progresar como familia.

Ella se dedica a la cría y venta de cerdos y pollos de levante, es una actividad aprendida de su esposo quien actualmente se dedica a esta actividad y ha sido la principal fuente de ingresos durante mucho tiempo.

Ella pide un auxilio económico para comprar algunos cerdos pequeños e irlos cuidando y criando para posteriormente venderlos.

Es una mujer soñadora y con gran voluntad, tanto así que ya piensa en grande y desea tener una marranera con gran capacidad.

Tiene gran ilusión y expectativa con este proyecto y confía en el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para crecer como empresaria.

En tus manos esta que el negocio de Yeselys prospere en el tiempo, Anímate!
texts.en:
Yeselys, together with her husband, has been able to form a family unit and has been very productive. Love is not the only bonus, but also the ability to work together to get ahead and progress as a family.
She works raising and selling pigs and chickens. She learned this activity from her husband who currently also works in this area. This has been their main source of income for a long time.
She is requesting financial assistance to buy some young pigs, to look after and raise, that she will later sell.
She is a visionary and strong-willed woman, she is thinking big and wants her business of selling pigs to have a large capacity.
She has great dreams and expectations for this project and trusts in the good hearts of those who contribute to the loan through Kiva to grow her business.
In your hands Yeselys's business will prosper in time. Be encouraged!

loans.use: to buy some young pigs to care for and raise, that she will later sell.

loans.name: Sahei Group

texts.en:
The featured member of ‘Sahei’ group is a 37-year-old mother of four. “I can maintain my family as long as I'm in good health,” says Niengneichong. She is pictured with her hand raised in the group photo.

Niengneichong is a traditional shawl weaver. Her husband is a cab driver and it is his source of income. They live in a small village with their children. Three of the children are in school while the youngest one is still preparing for school.

Niengneichong learned weaving by herself through watching her elders weave. Since childhood, she has had an interest in weaving. It was more of a hobby for her and now she weaves for income generation. She mostly uses her earnings for paying the school fees of her children. She says, “my business is popular since handloom products are high in demand by our society.”

Traditional shawls serve many purposes in the society. They are used for gifts in every function and occasion be it marriage functions, cultural functions or funeral services.

She will buy a stock of yarn to weave with the Kiva loan. The profit she makes by selling the shawls will help her to pay the medical fees of her family and her children's school fees. She is thankful to the lenders for lending help to her. She says “thank you Kiva.”

The rest of the group members will use the loan to help their businesses. They are all happy to get a loan.

loans.use: to buy yarn to weave for profit and pay for the medical fees of her family.

loans.name: Mrika

texts.en: Mrike's son who was 18 in the summer went to a river for diving and he came out of the water with severely damaged spine that left him quadriplegic. Since then, Mrike has remained depressed from what happened and so is her son, according to her. " I cannot find words to describe my pain seeing my son like that and knowing that he will never be the same. I'm hurting every minute, yet, I do my best to not show it in front of my son. We must continue to pay for physiotherapy and other expenses on a continues basis," said Mrike in the interview.

loans.use: to pay for her quadriplegic son's therapy.

loans.name: Chullou Group

texts.en:
“Being able to make the best design in my weaving is the best thing I can do to save myself,” says Hoishi. She is a traditional shawl weaver. Hoishi is pictured with her hand raised. She is the featured borrower of ‘Chullou’ group.

Hoishi is a 24-year-old mother of a boy. Her husband is a mason. They live in a small village in the hills. Their village is sloped land with a moderate climate. Water and cultivation land has been one of the limitations in their village. Most of the women in their village engage in weaving at their homes while the men are engaged as daily labourers in their village and nearby villages.

Hoishi weaves traditional shawls, namely ‘Saipikhup’, for livelihood. She has been weaving for five years now. She learned weaving techniques by watching the weavings’ of family and friends. It has been the most important thing that she ever learned in life. It has now become her means of livelihood. All the family members depend on her weavings.

With the Kiva loan, she will buy stock of yarn for weaving traditional shawls for profit. The profit will help her pay for the family requirements including medical fees. She also aspires to buy a handloom for weaving and employ one person in the future. She wishes for a bright and colourful future. She thanks Kiva for being part of making her dreams come true. She says, “Thank you.”

The rest of the group members are very hardworking. They all believe in achieving their financial goals through mutual help by getting a loan. They send their thank you to the lenders.

loans.use: to buy yarn to weave shawls to sell and pay for family requirements

loans.name: Solmery

texts.es:
Solmery, a sus 26 años de edad, es madre de 1 hijo. Siempre ha vivido en el campo, donde aprendió las labores agropecuarias, gracias a las enseñanzas de su familia. 

Actualmente se dedica a la cría y engorde de cerdos y pollos, los cuales vende en el mercado del municipio donde reside y de esta manera genera los recursos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 

Solmery ha pasado por una situación económica difícil, pero con mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y perseverancia ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. La cliente solicita el crédito con la intensión de invertirlo en la compra de insumos y concentrado para los cerdos, con lo que podrá engordarlos y luego venderlos a un mejor precio, aumentado su producción y los ingresos que recibe por cada venta, esto se verá reflejado en el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida de su familia a mediano plazo, también podrá avanzar un poco más hacia el cumplimiento de sus principal sueño que es tener una producción escalonada que le garantice la entrada de recursos de manera más constante y estable, con lo que dará a su hijo la oportunidad de tener una mejor educación y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
26-year-old Soldiery is the mother of one child. She has always lived in the countryside, where she learned farm work, thanks to education from her family.

She currently earns a living from breeding and fattening pigs and chickens, which she sells in the market in the town where she lives. In this way, she generates resources for the support of her household.

Solmery has gone through a difficult economic situation, but with a lot of effort, dedication, and perseverance, she has managed to get her family ahead. She requests a loan with the intention of investing it in buying pig products and feed, with which she can fatten them and then sell them at a better price--increasing her production and the income she receives with every sale. This will be seen reflected in the improvement of her family's living conditions to the middle class. In addition, she will be able to make a little more progress towards fulfilling her main dream, which is to have staggered production, which will guarantee her access to more constant and stable resources, which which she will give her child the opportunity to have a better education and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products and feed for pigs, with which she can fatten them and sell them for a better price.

loans.name: Mateo Andres

texts.es:
Mateo, en su incansable búsqueda de una mejor vida y una mejor estabilidad económica, inicio con un negocio de barbería prestando su servicio en su casas o a domicilio en el municipio de Don Matías, un municipio donde el empuje es un referente muy importante de los habitantes de esta zona.

El trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupado en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitado por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de lavacabezas, silla de barbería, cuchillas, gel, e instrumentos de trabajo que le hacen falta para poder montar su propio local.

Hoy en día se siente feliz por el buen trabajo que hasta ahora ha realizado y que le ha permitido gozar de un trabajo más estable.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Mateo a continuar con su proyecto de vida!¡
texts.en:
Mateo, looking to improve his life and to obtain financial stability, started his own barber business at home in the town of Don Matias, where entrepreneurship is a common trait.

He works every day at different times and is usually busy, as people like his work.

He is requesting an economic breather to purchase a hair-washing sink, a salon chair, razors, gel and other items that he needs to open his own barber shop.

He is happy because of the good work that he has done so far, which has allowed him to have more stability.

By contributing to this loan, you could help Mateo continue with his life project!

loans.use: to buy a hair-washing sink, salon chair, razors, gel and other items that he needs to open his own barber shop.

loans.name: Garba

texts.en:
Garba is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Garba has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Garba would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Garba can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Garba will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Garba is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: to purchase food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 55 years old and widowed with three children.

Violeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,500 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

She has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Violeta aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Joyful Group

texts.en:
Chinneikim is 39 years old, married and a mother to children (two sons and two daughters). She is the representative of the group “JOYFUL”. Her family resides in Churachandpur, which is situated in the northeastern part of India. Her husband passed away recently, so she is now the only source of income for her family. She is also the featured member with her hand raised in the picture.

Chinneikim is engaged in the weaving of traditional shawls using a handloom for earning income for her family. But the income she gets from handloom weaving is not at all sufficient for meeting her family's needs. She wants to work hard to support her family.

Chinneikim applied for a WSDS loan with a hope of buying a stock of threads for weaving and also to pay for her children's educational fees. She hopes that with the income she gets from selling traditional shawls, she will support her family and meet their daily needs.

She is looking forward to the loan, carrying the hope of supporting her family through the loans. She is indeed very happy to WSDS and the funders. Likewise, the rest of the members are very much in need of the loans to start their income-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads for weaving and pay for her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Margret Group

texts.en:
Lalam, a 31-year-old married woman, is the representative of the group ”MARGRET”. She has three children (two sons and a daughter) who are still pursuing their studies. She is also the featured borrower with her hand raised in the picture. Her husband is engaged in cultivation and they all reside in Churachandpur, Manipur.

As Margret has a family to support, it was not possible for her to manage the family expenses only using her husband's income, as it is meagre. She also wants to help by doing what she can.
Having the ability to weave, she started weaving, but since she doesn’t have much income, she can't buy stock of threads and weave much, which leads to less income

Margret applied for a WSDS loan with the hope of buying stocks of threads so that she can weave more traditional shawls for more income and hence support her children's educational fees and also meet her family needs.

She is very happy with the funders and WSDS and is looking forward to the loan. Likewise, the rest of the members too are in need and are looking forward to the loan to start their respective income-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy more stock of thread for weaving in order to get more income.

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María de 50 años de edad, no pudo estudiar pues sus padres eran muy pobres, ellos tenían que trabajar para poder llevar el sustento al hogar, está acompañada y su compañero de vida es agricultor, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 3 viven con ella.
 

María tiene una venta de pupusas y frutas en su casa, tiene un año en esta actividad la cual decidió realizar para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, además le ayuda a su esposo en los trabajos agrícolas. 

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar pollos de engorde para comercializar. 


Ella sueña con seguir trabajando para ayudarle a su esposo y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old. She was unable to study because her parents were very poor. They had to work to be able to support the home. She is in a common law relationship and her life partner is a farmer. She has 4 children, 3 of whom live with her.
María has a store selling stuffed tortillas and fruit from her home. She has been doing this for one year, since she decided to start the business to help her partner with the expenses of the home. She also helps her partner with his agricultural work.
She is requesting this loan to buy chickens to fatten in order to sell.
Her dream is to continue working to help her partner and to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens to fatten in order to sell.

loans.name: Irhsad

texts.en:
Irhsad is a 40-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She belongs to a poor family, with her family passing their lives from hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies' and gents' cloths. He has been running this business for many years and cherishing his whole family. It is his misfortune that he could not build up a good relationship among his customers, which is the reason he could not establish his enterprise. 

Now with the increase in their needs, they consider it necessary to grow the business also. But the lack of capital is the major problem for her husband.  
Therefore, Irhsad took a loan for her husband’s business. With the help of this loan her husband will purchase more clothes to sell. 

Irhsad thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes for resale purposes

loans.name: Francy Milena

texts.es:
Francy de 28 años, tiene claro que su prioridad es el bienestar de su familia y que por ella cualquier sacrificio es pequeño. Por esta razón desde hace 10 meses decidió retirarse de la empresa en donde laboraba con el propósito de velar por su hijo. Al mismo tiempo optó por montar en un colegio una pequeña tienda escolar para solventar los gastos de su hogar y garantizarle a su hijo mejores condiciones de vida. 

Hoy se siente feliz en su negocio y considera que ha sido la mejor decisión, ya que su trabajo le permite estar al cuidado de familia. 

Su mayor sueño es poder pagar la educación de su progenitor.

En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de golosinas, frituras, entre otros, para ofrecer en su tienda.

Espera seguir creciendo como microempresaria y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Francy is 28 years old and she is sure that her priority is the welfare of her family and that for them any sacrifice is small. 

Thus, 10 months ago she decided to leave the company where she worked for the purpose of taking care of her son.  At the same time, she chose to set up a small store at a school to cover the costs of living and ensure a better quality of life for her child.

Today she is happy with her business and she considers this to have been the best decision because her work allows her to care for her family.

Her biggest dream is to pay for the education of her child.

Today, she is requesting a loan to purchase candy, chips, among others, to offer in her store.

She expects to continue growing as small business entrepreneur and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase candy, chips, among others, to offer in her store.

loans.name: Omary

texts.en:
Omary is in his early 20s and is single with no kids. He has been running two projects, selling newspaper and selling soft drinks for two years now. He works from 6:00am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Omary's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to increase the newspaper stock and to increase the soft drink stock. He dreams of expanding his business.

Omary will be accountable for paying back his loan.

loans.use: to increase newspaper and soft drink stock.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa, de 36 años de edad, es una persona muy reconocida en su comunidad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica la albañilería y al trabajo agrícola, juntos tienen 3 hijos que van a la escuela.

Rosa, tiene unas vaquitas que ordeña para alimentarse con la leche y junto a su esposo e hijos las cuidaban, pero luego las vendió para cubrir gastos de su hogar, ella se levanta temprano para preparar el desayuno de su esposo para que vaya a  trabajar en una cooperativa cafetera de la zona. 

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla y empezar otra vez la actividad ganadera poco a poco, para que sus hijos se involucren en esta actividad. 

Rosa, desea que sus hijos se superen y obtengan mejores ingresos económicos con un titulo universitario.
texts.en:
Rosa is 36 years old and is very well known person in her community. She studied until grade three. She is married and her husband works in construction and farming. Together they have 3 children, who attend school.
Rosa had some cows that she milked to feed her family with the milk, and together with her husband and her children, they cared for the cows. However, she later sold them to cover the expenses of the home. She wakes up early to prepare breakfast for her husband who goes to work in a cooperative cafe in the area.
Rosa needs a loan to buy a heifer and to begin again the activity of breeding cattle, little by little, so that her children can get involved in this activity.
Rosa wants her children to succeed and to earn better incomes with university degrees.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Farisai

texts.en:
Farisai is married with three children and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She takes great pride in running a small, local grocery shop where she sells sugar, soap, flour and other commodities needed in her community.

Her first Kiva loan enabled Farisai to increase her profits by ordering groceries in bulk and selling additional profitable items. She managed to buy a refrigerator so as to sell cold beverages.

All the women in her community are now praising her and are learning a lot from her. Farisai is very happy and grateful for the change to create a thriving business so that she is now able to look after her parents by providing them with basic needs. She is also currently buying building materials to build her own house.

She is requesting a second loan to further expand her grocery shop. She intends to purchase more groceries for resale.

She continues her work as a Camfed Volunteer Learner Guide working with schools to improve the young people’s well-being.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like sugar, salt, cooking oil, and milk.

loans.name: Oyniso

texts.ru: Ойнисо благодарна за поддержку, которую ей оказали. Она смогла купить несколько голов баран. Теперь ее стада баран больше. Ойнисо не останавливается на достигнутом, и приняла решения развить свою животноводческую деятельность и дальше. Ойнисо планирует купить еще барана, и уверена, что на этот раз тоже получит поддержку.
texts.en: Oyniso is thankful for the support you have given her. She was able to buy a few sheep to expand her herd. Oyniso wants to keep moving forward with expansion of her livestock business. She plans to buy another sheep, and is sure that you will support her again.

loans.use: buy a sheep.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is the age of 38, a mother of five children living with her family in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Her husband provides local rural transport to the people of his society. For the last three years he has been running a horse cart for rural transport services.

Now he wants to provide transport services by running an auto rickshaw. He hopes that by running an auto rickshaw he will be able to get more income to financially support his family. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new auto rickshaw.

Therefore, Shabana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of a new auto rickshaw. Shabana is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a rickshaw for her husband

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.ru: У Мухаммад все идет отлично. Он рад, что у него все получается. Мухаммад благодарить Вас на поддержку, который Вы помогли ему финансовым трудностям. Мухаммад кроме растениеводство занимается животноводством. Он выращивает крупнорогатого скота. Мухаммад просит кредит, потому что у него осталось малое количество скотов, чтобы сохранить деятельность и увеличить поголовье скота Мухаммаду необходимо определенная сумма денег. Он за счет кредита купить скота и сохранить деятельность. Мухаммад заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en:
Everything is going great for Muhammad, and he is happy that it is. He is grateful for your support in overcoming his financial obstacles.

Muhammad raises cattle as well as crops. He is asking for a loan because he has few animals remaining. To expand his herd and keep the business going he needs a certain amount of money. This loan will go towards buying animals and maintaining his business. He thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to expand his livestock herd and maintain his business

loans.name: Bazarbu

texts.ru: Базарбу, 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 3 детей. У Базарбу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 0,90 Га земли, где Базарбу выращивает арбузы и кукурузу, также у нее есть 6 коров, 50 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 23,000 сом (KGS). Базарбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) в целях дальнейшего развития ее бизнеса за счет покупки телят и овец. Доходы Базарбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и условий содержания скота.
texts.en: Bazarbu is 51 years old, married, and raised three children with her husband. She has a secondary education, and earns her family's primary income through farming. Her property consists of 0.90 hectares of land where she raises watermelon and corn, as well as six cows and fifty sheep. Her monthly income in 23,000 som (KGS). Bazarbu requested a 120,000 som (KGS) loan from Bai-Tushum Bank to further develop her business by buying calves and sheep. She plans to invest income from use of the loan into further developing her business and improving her animals' living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves and sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Mélida Gladis

texts.es:
Mélida de 63 años de edad, estudió hasta  6º grado en la escuela de comunidad, actualmente su estado civil es soltera, su ocupación es costurera  su especialidad es  confeccionar prendas para dama.
Tiene más de 30 años  de experiencia en la actividad pues este da sido su oficio, lo aprendió desde muy joven, el taller donde confecciona  estas prendas lo tiene en su casa de habitación, antes ella se dedicaba a la elaboración de pan artesanal para posteriormente hacer a venta de este mismo.	 
El crédito lo invertirá para comprar telas, hilos y otros materiales de sastrería, quiere estar preparada para cualquier encargo.
En un futuro ella  tiene la visión de que su taller de costura crezca y se vuelva más estable, esto pretende lograrlo con  los financiamientos y con su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Mélida is 63 years old and she studied until the sixth grade at a school in the community. She is currently single and her occupation is as a seamstress. Her specialty is making women's clothing.
She has more than 30 years experience in this activity and it has been her trade. She learned the trade when she was very young. The workshop where she makes the clothing is in her home. Previously, she worked making artisanal bread and afterwards selling it.
The loan will be invested in buying fabric, thread and other sewing materials. She wants to be prepared for whatever she is given.
In the future she has the vision of having her sewing workshop grow and to become more stable. She hopes that she can accomplish this with the financing and her own effort.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim is in the photograph with his younger twin children. The reason he is requesting this loan is to buy feed for the 700 chickens he currently has.

loans.use: To buy feed for the 700 chickens he has; this is his main activity

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en:
Tendai is 25 years old and lives in the Nyami-nyami District of Zimbabwe with her husband and son. She has been operating a successful poultry business for over two years, and is assisted by her husband.

Tendai used her first Kiva loan to expand her business, and is now a viable supplier of poultry in her community. Through expanding her business, Tendai intends to create employment opportunities within her community, and to provide a better quality of life for her son.

Tendai seeks a second Kiva loan to purchase more chicks, feed, and vaccines in order to increase her poultry production during the holiday season. The interest on Tendai’s “social-interest” loan will continue to be repaid through her weekly volunteer work at the local high school as a Camfed Learner Guide.

loans.use: To increase her poultry production during the holiday season.

loans.name: Marash

texts.en:
