Marash is in the photograph with his wife, Esmerina, and they are seeking your compassion to help them financially with fertility treatments.

"We have tried some fertility treatments in the past, yet in vain. And I'm growing older and chances of becoming pregnant are getting thinner too. However, we thought of giving another shot now and let's see," said Esmerina to the branch assistant.

loans.use: to pay for fertility treatments; they don't have a child

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, he would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Abubakar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, he will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare.

Abubakar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en: Noreen is 23 years old and lives in the rural Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. Noreen is currently operating her own poultry business, which is thriving, thanks to her first Kiva loan.  With her profits, Noreen started a second business selling floor polish. Noreen’s businesses have brought a great improvement on her standard of living. What is more, she was able to complete her secondary education by paying the fees necessary to take the required national examinations. Noreen is requesting a second loan to further expand her poultry business. She hopes to continue to strengthen her community as a businesswoman.  Noreen is also a committed volunteer in her community, actively helping to keep children in school as a Camfed Learner Guide.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, chick feeds and medicine

loans.name: Chhoeum's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Banteay Meanchey province, Chhoeum is 39 years old and is married with five dependent children, three of whom are in school and the other one is under the age of school.

The main source of income for this family is growing rice while additional income comes from growing vegetables and raising pigs. Chhoeume earns about USD 13 per day and can save about USD 4 each day. A drop in the price of the rice crop is the main challenge for her.

She decided to form a group which comprises six members to apply for loans from VisionFund. As the group leader, she will use her loan to buy a wardrobe. She hopes to earn more income to expand her current business and to uplift her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a wardrobe.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Memory

texts.en:
35-year-old Memory is a business woman living in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is a single mother with two children as well as being an entrepreneur, striving to be economically independent.

With her many achievements, Memory inspires young women in her community to be entrepreneurs. She started her poultry business in 2013 after noticing an increase in demand for broiler chickens.

Memory used her first Kiva loan to expand her poultry project. With her profits she has also managed to put food on the table for her family and has built a Blair (pit) toilet at her parents’ house.

With a second Kiva loan, Memory plans to scale her poultry business to a larger size. She also wishes to train as a teacher and hopes that when she gets a place at teachers’ college she will be able to finance herself using profits from the project.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, chick feeds, and medicine.

loans.name: Milton Ariel

texts.es:
Milton es un joven de treinta y dos años de edad, trabajador, enérgico y padre de tres niños varones, por los cuales trabaja día a día muy fuerte como albañil y asistente de soldador, trabajo en el que tiene más de diez años de experiencia y con el que ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante. El lamenta no haber estudiado más que segundo grado, por eso hace todo lo posible para que sus hijos tengan una educación integral.
Él ha recurrido a un préstamo de saneamiento de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, con este planea construir un servicio higiénico en su casa de habitación, dado que todavía utiliza letrina y esto se está convirtiendo en un peligro para la salud de él y la de su familia.  En futuro luego de cancelar este crédito desea optar a otro que le permita incursionar en un negocio propio que vaya vinculado a la albañilería.
texts.en:
Milton is a young man of thirty-two. He is a hard worker, energetic, and the father of three boys who are the reason he works hard each day in construction as well as being an assistant welder. He has more than ten years of experience in this work and it is the way he has gotten his family ahead. He regrets not having studied beyond the second grade, which is why he wants to do everything possible so that his children have a complete education.

He has appealed for a sanitation loan from Kiva along with MiCrédito. With it he plans to build a bathroom in his home. They still use a latrine and it's becoming a health risk for him and family. In the future, after repaying the loan, he wants to get another one that would allow him to start his own business that would be related to construction.

loans.use: to build a bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 32-year-old married mother of three who resides in the Nyami-nyami District of Zimbabwe. She sells dried fish in her shop at the local market.

Agnes used her first Kiva loan to purchase more supplies and fish to sell. She uses her profits to look after her three siblings and her family.

She seeks a second Kiva loan to continue expanding her business and increasing stock. The interest on Agnes’s “social-interest” loan will continue to be repaid through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local high school.

loans.use: to continue expanding her business and increasing stock.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 41 and lives with her husband in Embu, northeast of Nairobi. They have one young son.

Tabitha has been involved in horticulture for a number of years, growing tomatoes and French beans. But to help provide for her son, she is keen to expand the business, increasing the quantity of vegetables she produces. She would also like to extend into dairy farming, to diversify the family’s income and reduce the risks from poor weather. She intends to use her Kiva loan to purchase seeds and seedlings for the horticulture business.

Tabitha’s long-term dream is to be able to buy a "shamba" (her own plot of land for growing vegetables). This will ensure she can send her son to school and help support the family.

Please help Tabitha and her family by contributing to her loan today.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings for her horticulture business.

loans.name: Taingsim

texts.en:
Taingsim is 43 years old and a widowed mother of a dependent son. She lives in Kampong Cham province, where she has been growing rice for her main source of income for 25 years.

Working for others for a fee and working as carpenter earn her additional income to make a better living.

Pests are the challenge to her rice-growing business.

She is now requesting a loan from VisionFund to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop yields. She hopes she can earn more income to improve living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve crop yields to improve living conditions for her family.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Gold Group

texts.en:
Nengneichong, a 26-year-old married woman, is a mother to two children (a son and a daughter). She is the representative of the group “Gold,” which comprises five members, and she is also the featured member with her hand raised in the picture.

Her husband is engaged in a private company and they reside in Tonglal Veng, Chuachandpur, Manipur, where there are no proper schools, scarce water, and no medical facilities.

Nengneichong is a weaver and she weaves traditional shawls (Thangnang) using a handloom, has been weaving for the past two years. But the income she and her husband get is not sufficient for her family expenses and for paying her children's educational fees. As a result of the low income, she was not able to purchase yarn for weaving.

Nengneichong applies for a WSDS loan with the hope of buying 12 kilograms of yarn for weaving as well as rice and vegetables for household consumption. She is very thankful to the funders and WSDS for their work of providing loans to the needy people.

She is looking forward to the loan with a hope of earning more income for her family by weaving more traditional shawls. Likewise, the rest of the members too are requesting and are in need of the loan to start their respective income-generating activities.

loans.use: to buy 12 kilograms of yarn for weaving as well as rice and vegetables for household consumption.

loans.name: Canan Group

texts.en:
“Children’s education is my first priority,” says Lalremmawi. a 52-year-old mother of two. She is very supportive when it comes to her children’s education and will do anything to show her support. Lalremmawi is the featured borrower of the group ‘Canan.’ She is pictured with her hand raised.

Lalremmawi lives in a village with her husband and two children who are in college. She is a skillful weaver who weaves traditional wraparound skirts at home to support her family and also employs three people in her weaving business. “It has been around 30 years since I started weaving and it was the best choice I ever made,” she says. She sells her products to customers who place orders. Her business is very popular and she gets many orders from customers day by day.

With the Kiva loan, she will buy yarn to use in her weaving business. The profit will be used to pay for her children's educational costs and to support her family's expenses. She is very happy and excited to get the loan. She also thanks the lenders for their support and says ‘Thank you.’ She aspires to employ one more person in the near future if her business grows bigger.

The rest of the group members are all very hardworking and happy to get loan. They will use the loan to support their own businesses.

loans.use: to buy yarn to weave for profit and pay for school fees of her children

loans.name: Yudy Liliana

texts.es:
Yudy, inicio con un negocio de arreglo de uñas y cepillado de cabello prestando su servicio a domicilio en el municipio de San Carlos.

Ella trabaja todos los días en horarios muy variados y siempre está ocupada en algún servicio ya que es muy solicitada por su buen trabajo.

Solicita un aliento económico para realizar la compra de una moto que le permita desplazarse hasta los distintos lugares en los que requieran de su trabajo.

Hoy en día se siente muy entusiasmada con la posibilidad de poder mejorar su negocio y su servicio.

Con un crédito podrás apoyar a Yudy a continuar con su proyecto de vida!¡
texts.en:
Yudy started a hair and nails business in which she visits clients at their place of residence throughout the municipality of San Carlos. She works various hours everyday and is always busy. Her services are frequently requested because she does such a good job.

She is asking for financial assistance to buy a motorbike that will allow her to travel to the different places that she needs to go for work. These days she feels very enthusiastic about the possibility of being able to improve her business and her services.

With a loan, you can help Yudy to travel further along her path in life!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike that will allow her to travel to the different places that she needs to go for work.

loans.name: José Ines

texts.es:
José de 61 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado ya que por motivos económicos no pudo continuar, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.


José se dedica a realizar viajes con su pick up, ya tiene alrededor de 20 años realizando esta actividad que le ha servido para llevar el sustento al hogar, él no tiene un horario fijo ya que trabaja a toda hora cuando alguien solicita sus servicios.


Él necesita este crédito para comprar un repuesto para su vehículo, pues es su principal medio de trabajo.

Él sueña con dejarles una buena herencia a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is sixty-one years old. He studied up to the sixth grade because due to financial reasons, he was unable to continue. He is married and his wife runs the household. He makes his living making trips with his pickup. He has been in this business for around twenty years and it has enabled him to maintain his household. He doesn't have a fixed schedule as he works whenever anyone requests his services.

José needs a loan to buy a replacement part for his vehicle as it is his livelihood. He dreams of giving his children a good inheritance.

loans.use: to buy a replacement part for his vehicle as it is his livelihood.

loans.name: Omega

texts.en: Omega is a 26-year-old widow with one child living in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. As a single parent, she works hard to support her child and dreams of improving their quality of life in the rural village. To provide financial support, Omega operates a small grocery store selling sugar, flour, rice and cooking oil. With her first Kiva loan, Omega grew her business and used the additional profits to provide for her child and her younger sister, as well as to buy a goat. Having managed the first loan so successfully, she is seeking a new loan to expand her grocery business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like sugar, salt, flour, cooking oil and soap.

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en: Jackielyn is 30 years old, married with one child, and has been operating a general retail store in her village while her husband earns from his military work. Jackielyn always finds ways to meet their daily needs. Her previous loan used for buying goods had been repaid successfully. With her income, she took a new loan recently to purchase additional goods to sell in the village. She is hopeful of seeing her business progress and her child succeed.

loans.use: To purchase goods to sell.

loans.name: Rokiah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Rokiah,, who is a 58-year-old married with seven childs. Rokiah has small shop which selling food for three years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Rokiah will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: this loan will be used to build sanitation at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Melter

texts.en: Melter lives in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a poultry business at the local business center. Using the money from her first Kiva loan, Melter bought chicks, vaccines, and feed to boost production and increase profits. Building on her business success, Melter is requesting a second Kiva loan to grow her production to even higher levels. She intends to use her profits to build a house for her parents, provide food for her family, and to pay her siblings’ school fees. The interest on Melter’s “social-interest” loan will continue to be repaid through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, through which she leads life skills sessions for students in the nearby secondary school.

loans.use: to grow her production to even higher levels.

loans.name: Mazin

texts.en: Mazin is a 55-year-old man from Jabalia City.  He is married and is the father to 5 children.Mazin was living with his family in a small humble house, but during the latest war on Gaza, his house was completely destroyed.   He had to rent a small apartment in the same area.Recently Mazin took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild his house. This loan will allow Mazin to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life.Mazin appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild his house.

loans.name: Savriniso

texts.en:
Savriniso comes from Tajikistan. She was born in 1962. She is widowed and has two adult children.

For more than 11 yeas, Savriniso has owned her own business. She has been busy buying and selling clothes. Savriniso sells in a local market. She periodically renews the assortment of her goods.

Savriniso is going to renew the assortment of goods for the new autumn season and with this aim she is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni to buy clothes.

From profit she will improve the education of her grandchildren. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy clothes for increasing her working capital.

loans.name: Bearn

texts.en: Living in Battambang province’s Sangkae district, Bearn is now 59 years old and widowed. She has three children, two of whom are dependents. Bearn is a rice farmer to earn the main income to support her two dependent children, and she also works as a paid worker to supplements the income. Having been in the business for ten years, she able to make daily earnings of USD 8 and manages to save about USD 3 each day. This is the sixth loan for Bearn with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The past loans have helped her to better support on her living condition. Now she is applying for this new loan to buy a proper motorbike to commute to work. She hopes this loan will enable her to commute to work in a timely manner and reduce expenses on motor-taxi.

loans.use: To buy a proper motorbike which enable her to commute to work on time and reduce expenses on motor-taxi.

loans.name: Yushau

texts.en:
Yushau is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yushau has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yushau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yushau can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yushau will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yushau is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Alhaji Haruna

texts.en: Alhaji Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Alhaji Haruna has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Alhaji Haruna can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Alhaji Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Alhaji Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Tanyaradzwa

texts.en: Tanyaradzwa is married with one child and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She takes great pride in her business where she sells skirts, baby blankets, and shoes in bulk to meet the high demand of her customers. Thanks to a loan from Kiva, Tanyaradzwa was able to increase her stock and is now able to be financially independent, support herself and provide for her family’s needs. Having been so successful using the first loan, Tanyaradzwa is looking forward to receiving another Kiva loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a young man who has a barber shop. His barber shop has been open for the past seven years. He now has good experience and he is well known in his city, Gaza City. He loves his job and always thinks about how to improve it. Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools and materials for his barber shop. This will improve his business and make his barber shop more attractive. Ahmad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy new tools and materials for his barber shop.

loans.name: Alymkan

texts.ru: Алымкан, 62 года, вдова, живет с сыном, снохой и 2 внуками. Образование у Алымкан средне-специальное, на протяжении 26 лет она работала медицинской сестрой, сейчас на заслуженной пенсии и занимается сельским хозяйством. У Алымкан есть 2 коровы, 15 овец, на 2,04 Га земли она выращивает люцерну, картофель и ячмень, на ежедневной основе продает экологически чистое молоко. Ежемесячная прибыль - 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алымкан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для увеличения удоя экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Алымкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на увеличение поголовья породистых коров.
texts.en: Alymkan is 62 years old, a widow, and lives with her son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Alymkan has a secondary vocational education. She worked as a nurse for 26 years, and now she is in well-deserved retirement and farms. Alymkan has two cows and 15 sheep, and she grows alfalfa, potatoes and barley on 2.04 hectares of land. She sells organic milk on a daily basis. Her monthly profit is 22,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Alymkan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy some dairy cows to increase her yield of organic milk. Alymkan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business in order to save up to increase her herd of purebred cows.

loans.use: to purchase some dairy cows in order to increase her organic milk sales.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Tha is a rice farmer residing in Kampong Cham province. She is married and has seven children, six of whom depend on her. There is a child in school. Tha earns a living through growing rice and fishing. Both businesses earn her about USD 15 per day. The rice crop suffers from pests, and consequently returns lower than expected outputs.

Tha is a second-cycle borrower with VisionFund. Her past loan has enabled her to send her child to school and support a living.

In a group of three members, Tha is the leader. She is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland. She dreams of getting more yields to keep sending her children to school and to upgrade their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland so as to earn more income.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ilhama

texts.en:
Ilhama is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the region of Fuzuli, but she is now settled in Baku city with her husband and children. Ilhama is 45 years old. She has a lovely family with two sons. Her husband is a driver. Their salary is not enough to cover their increasing expenses. 

Today, she needs her first loan in the amount of 2,200 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Ilhama has been in the sales business for three years. With this amount she is planning to buy more products (glass, kettle, plate, spoon, etc.) to sell. Ilhama is thankful for help from Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Nomsa

texts.en:
Nomsa is 23 years old and living in the Guruve District in Zimbabwe, where she runs a poultry business that she started in 2013 after completing school. Nomsa used her first Kiva loan to purchase chick feed and broiler chicks to increase production and boost sales. She was able to use her profits to pay her siblings’ school fees and to build a house for herself and her three children. 

In light of her business success, Nomsa is seeking a second Kiva loan to further expand her poultry business. Nomsa will continue to pay “social-interest” on her loan through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions with students at her local high school. Nomsa is committed to keeping children in school and believes that children have a chance in life when they are able to make informed decisions.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feeds

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar, 51, is a married woman who lives with her child and husband in Jenin. Sahar has created her own business for the past 32 years with good experience; her business is a beauty salon. Her husband is a tailor and they are working hard to have a good standard of living. Sahar has thought to improve her beauty salon to attract more customers, both local and non-local. As such, she is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase hair conditioners, hair colors, makeup, etc. in order to increase her earnings.

Sahar is very thankful to all of the team at Kiva and ALIBDAA.

loans.use: to purchase hair conditioner, hair color, makeup, and shampoo in order to attract more customers

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is 24 years old and lives in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe with her husband and child. Agatha runs a clothing stall at the local market and has seen success with her business for over two years now. She used the money from her first Kiva loan to purchase additional clothing to increase sales, and was able to support her family with the profits from her business. Agatha also used the proceeds from her clothing stall to start a poultry business, leading to a 25% increase in her income.

Building on her business success, Agatha is seeking a second Kiva loan to expand her poultry business. The interest on Agatha’s “social-interest” loan will continue to be repaid through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions with students at her local high school and enhancing the learning environment.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Gemmarlyn

texts.en:
Gemmarlyn is 27 years old and has three children. She is a woman with two children who are in school.

Gemmarlyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gemmarlyn has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gemmarlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Bakilana Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her late 30s, is single with one schooling child. She has been running a genge business (grocery stall) for five years now. She works from 8 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salma's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her genge stock and has paid back her loan successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees for her kid, to repay the loan and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy the fast moving fruits and vegetables to meet her customers' demand. She dreams of expanding her genge business.

Salma will share this loan with her loan group Bakilana, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving fruits and vegetables to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 41 years old and has eight children. She is married and has seven children who are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gina has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Murtala has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Murtala would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Murtala can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Murtala will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Murtala is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Dauda has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Dauda would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dauda can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Dauda will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Dauda is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Shumirai

texts.en:
Shumirai is 30 years old and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is married with one child. She has a business selling both new and secondhand clothes. She used her first Kiva loan to expand her inventory and that increased both her sales and profits. Her shop is near a hospital and she has found that it is a great location from which to sell baby clothes!

Now her business is a family effort, including the work of her husband who had been unemployed. Their increase in income has improved the family’s standard of living and enabled them to purchase two cows and some furniture. Now Shumirai is requesting a second loan to further expand her business. She intends to purchase more clothing stock and use the profits to send her children to a better school. Shumirai also volunteers as a Cama Community Health Trainer, working with schools in her community to improve children’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock and baby clothes.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a maize farmer from Sarkin Fada village. As a member of Babban Gona Farmers Organization, Sani is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sani would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sani can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest.

Sani is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to provide employment through his farm to members of his community.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ma. Liezel

texts.en:
Ma. Liezel is 39 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Liezel is in the agricultural business, farming corn in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Ma. Liezel has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Liezel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 34 years old and has four children who are in school.

Julie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as ice, sugar, etc.

Julie has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as ice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Ibrahim has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Ibrahim will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Ibrahim is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 65 years old and has one child in school.

Leoncia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, fish, spices, etc.

Leoncia has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida manages a small store for income. She is selling grocery items for income. She has been in her business for over five years now. Lida is already 28 years old and has young children to sustain.

With this, she hopes to improve her sales and profits. That is why she is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to invest in her store. She will buy additional stocks of goods such as softdrinks, canned goods, noodles and vegetables to sell.

In the future, she hopes to continue improving her services and keep gaining profitable sales for her family.

loans.use: to buy softdrinks, canned goods, noodles and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Humilde y trabajadora, así es Ana, una mujer guerrera que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de su hijo, vive en el municipio de Tierra Alta, donde se gana la vida con la preparación de alimentos variados como almuerzos y desayunos en una pequeña cafeteria ubicada cerca a su casa.
Trabaja sola todos los días durante 10 horas.

Sus alimentos son conocidos por los vecinos del sector, quienes visitan su negocio porque saben que podrá comer de una manera deliciosa.

Ana ha decidido mejorar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas, por esta razón acude a un préstamo para comprar frituras y golosina.
Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia y su negocio.

Apoya a esta mujer con un préstamo y haz realidad sus sueños!
texts.en:
Humble and hard-working - that is how to describe Ana, a warrior who has dedicated a large part of her life to caring for her son. She lives in the town of Tierra Alta where she earns a living by preparing various lunch and breakfast foods in a small eatery located near her house.

She works alone every day for 10 hours, and the food she prepares is known by the residents of the neighborhood who patronize her business because they know that everything is delicious.

Ana has decided to improve her business and increase her sales, so she is applying for a loan so she can buy fried foods and snacks. This loan will allow her to move her business forward and earn the income she needs to continue to support her family and her business.

Support this woman with a loan and maker her dreams a reality!

loans.use: to buy fried foods and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Sardar

texts.en:
Sardar is 42 years old. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of one child.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For a long time, his rickshaw has not been working properly. Consequently, he has been unable to generate any income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, her husband finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

Therefore Sardar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business.

Sardar is so very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Sarancam

texts.en:
Sarancam is 19 years old. She is a very young and a passionate person. Sarancam is an IDP from Bilasuvar refugee settlement. She is living with her family and takes cares of her parents and also her younger siblings. At this young age she knows that she has great responsibilities.

Sarancam is a farmer and people in her neighborhood know her as a young farmer. She is very diligent. She grows some wheat. She knows that success requires dedication. Sarancam likes to provide more natural products to people. Being a refugee and from a region where people are more familiar with farming gives her an advantage in the local market. She is more familiar with the local people and knows the peoples' needs and demands.

In Azerbaijan people consume a lot of wheat. Sarancam has an advantage, because people know her as an honest person who sells natural wheat. Currently she is planning to buy more fertilizers and she needs 2,000 AZN. Hopefully Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers

loans.name: Diego Fernando

texts.es:
Con su gran empuje y perseverancia, Diego ha salido adelante y ha podido educar y sostener a su hija y su esposa.
Siempre ha buscado la manera de obtener ingresos para su familia, tanto así que ha pasado por numerosos trabajos en el municipio de Guarne.
Hoy en día, después de haber decidido por su independencia, trabaja en la fabricación de artículos y objetos artesanales en hierro.

Por esta y muchas más razones solicita un préstamo para compra materia prima como hierro y acero.

Con este préstamo podrá asegurar la sostenibilidad de su negocio y por ende de su familia.

Si prestas a este crédito estarás aportando al progreso y empuje Colombiano!
texts.en:
Thanks to his great dedication and perseverance, Diego has been able to get ahead and to educate and support his daughter and his wife.

He has always looked for ways to obtain income for his family, and thus he has passed through numerous jobs in the municipality of Guarne.

Today, after deciding to become independent, he works creating items and handicrafts made from iron.

For this and many more reasons, he is requesting a loan to buy raw materials such as iron and steel.

With this loan, he will be able to ensure the sustainability of his business and ultimately of his family.

If you participate in thls loan, you will be contributing to progress and advancement in Colombia!

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as iron and steel.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 42 and a married father of two, 11 and 7 years old. Their family lives in the city of Korca.

Leonard started up his own activity about a year ago after adequate experience he gained working for some major construction company in his city: He does tin gutters. Simultaneously, he is a business associate with two companies in the same field, construction. His wife's profession is seamstress, and she works for a clothing manufacturer in the city of residence.

Leonard is seen in the photograph with some type of machinery used in his profession.

He wants this loan to stock up on tin that is used in this particular case to make gutters. Construction and house developments have been booming, so is Leonard's activity.

loans.use: to buy tin for his construction (tin gutters) activity.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a 37-year-old single mother and businesswoman from Chikomba East, Zimbabwe. Her clothing business is thriving. Using her first Kiva loan, she purchased blankets, jackets, shoes, clothes, and cosmetics such as perfumes and hair relaxers from Mozambique. She also diversified into buying and selling cell phone airtime in bulk.

With the profits from her business, Dorothy is providing food and clothing for her two children. Using her profits, she has also bought two goats, built a fowl run, and now has acquired a passport. Dorothy says: “I am now a recognized person, and thus for every decision made in the family, I’m involved. This is because of the business l am operating.”

Her hope is now to provide her community with a variety of quality clothes. She is requesting a second Kiva loan to further boost her clothing business. She is continuing her work as a Camfed volunteer Learner Guide who mentors students at her local secondary school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en:
Usaini is maize farmer from Kwankwarmi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Usaini is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Usaini would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Usaini can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Usaini is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sanito

texts.en:
Sanito is 50 years old and married. He resides in Canicapan, Clarin with his family.

Sanito owns and operates a transportation service and has done so for many years to earn a living. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, used for buying spare parts and tires.

Recently, he took a new loan to cover the cost of repainting and motor repair for the motorcycle used for the transportation business. He plans to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle for expansion of his business in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repainting and motor repair for the motorcycle used in his transportation business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Marilyn works hard to support her family. She has a jewelry "buy-and-sell" business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store.

Marilyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy jewelry to sell via her buy-and-sell business.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to realize her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es:
Daniela, mayor de edad, soltera y sin hijos, originaria del municipio de Medellín, es una microempresaria, administradora y propietaria de su propio negocio el cual consiste en la compra y venta de ropa nueva el cual lo realiza ambulante y también en su casa, 

Se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, también con muchos deseos de superación personal, tiene clientes tanto al crédito como al contado que recupera quincenal o mensualmente.

Inicio este negocio con fondos propios debido a la necesidad de trabajar y el deseo de mejorar los ingresos en su hogar, tuvo el compromiso de salir adelante con el esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo que ha realizado durante 4 años en el cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma, uno de sus sueños es poder llegar a tener un gran negocio. 

Desde muy temprano ella se levanta a abrir su venta para empezar a vender y poder salir adelante. 

El objetivo de este crédito es para poder comprar más mercadería como; zapatos, ropa interior, cosméticos, entre otros etc. 

Daniela se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo económico que Kiva le brinda a las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Daniela is an adult woman who is single with no children. She comes from the municipality of Medellín, and she is a microentrepreneur, owner and administrator of her own business. Her business is buying and selling new clothing, as a mobile vendor and also from her home.

She is known for being a very hard-working and responsible woman who also has a great desire for self-improvement. She has customers on both a cash and credit basis, and she collects payments every two weeks or monthly.

She started this business with her own funds, due to her need to work and her desire to improve her household income. She made a commitment to get ahead through her efforts and has worked continuously for the past four years. During this time, she has demonstrated her responsibility in making payments on time and in the proper manner. One of her dreams is eventually having a large business.

She gets up very earlier to open her business and start selling, so she can get ahead.

The aim of this loan is to buy more merchandise such as shoes, underwear, cosmetics and other items.

Daniela is very grateful for the economic support provided by Kiva to the people who need it most.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as shoes, underwear, cosmetics, and other items.

loans.name: Nguvu Moja Group

texts.en:
Peter, who is in his late 20s, is married with one small child. He has been selling charcoal for four years now. He works from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Peter's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell, to meet his customers demand. He dreams of opening another store selling charcoal.

Peter will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule of time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell, to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Thouch's Group

texts.en: Thouch’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Thouch makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en:
Chipo is a 26-year-old single mother of one, living in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. Using her first Kiva loan, Chipo expanded her poultry business. Now Chipo boasts a very big fowl run and has been able to buy bulk stock feed for her project. Being an innovative entrepreneur, Chipo also diversified her business by purchasing a sewing machine to make clothes to sell.

Poultry production remains a thriving business in her community and with a second Kiva loan, Chipo will expand her poultry business even further. Chipo employs two people who were previously struggling to find work. As a Camfed Learner Guide, Chipo also works with schools in her community and helps students gain life and study skills.

loans.use: to purchase more chick feed, vaccines, and chicks.

loans.name: Fungisai

texts.en:
Fungisai is 36 years old, living in the Nyami-nyami District of Zimbabwe with her husband and two children. She runs a successful booth at a local market, selling eggs, dried fish, fruits, and vegetables. Fungisai used the money from her first Kiva loan to expand her products and now offers children's and adult clothing as well.

Fungisai seeks a second Kiva loan to expand her business and purchase more stock. The proceeds from her business will send her children to school and improve their living standards. Fungisai will continue to repay her interest as “social-interest” through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Community Health Trainer.

loans.use: to expand her business and purchase more stock.

loans.name: Romisa

texts.en: Romisa is 29-year old married woman living with her spouse and one children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns an artificial jewellery shop which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to purchase variety of jewellery for the shop that includes bangles, necklace, rings, braclets . Therefore she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase artificial jewellery for her husband's shop. Romisa is hopeful that the loan will be productive one for the business.

loans.use: to buy artificial jewellery such as bangles, necklace, rings, braclets etc for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet was able to buy daily ingredients for her food business through her previous loan application granted by Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She wants to send her gratitude to all the lenders and others who provided financial help.

The business is her bread and butter, that’s why rain or shine, Janet still operates the food business. She’s able to support her children and pay for their education and other expenses. As a mother, her dream is to make sure her children finish college and find good jobs someday. That’s why she perseveres to make the business succeed.

Janet is starting to save money for her children's future and also to buy their own house and lot. She applied for a loan of PHP 50,000 which will be used to buy fresh bananas daily and other ingredients.

Janet regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fresh bananas and other ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Vaidah

texts.en: Vaidah is a 30-year-old woman who lives in Nyanga District, Zimbabwe. She is married and has  three children (one boy and two girls). Vaidah runs a small gardening business, farming potatoes and onions. She has been operating her business successfully and is very proud of the progress she has made so far. She also has volunteered as a program trainer in Camfed’s alumni network since 2003.  Vaidar`s business is doing well, thanks to the KIVA loan. With the loan she got, she was able to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her potato business, which are currently on demand at the moment. She diversified the business by growing tomatoes, which again gives her a big advantage if potatoes fail to do well in the wake of unpredictable weather conditions these days. To date it seems both businesses are doing well.

loans.use: To purchase more seeds.

loans.name: Sallau

texts.en:
Sallau is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Sallau has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sallau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Sallau can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Sallau will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. Sallau is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy improved machinery and hire skilled labor.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 27 years old and lives in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe with her two siblings whom she looks after. Angeline began her poultry business in 2011 and used the money from her first Kiva loan to expand her production to about 120 chickens every six weeks. Angeline’s expansion allows her to employ one person, and she hopes to hire more in the future.

In light of her business success, Angeline is seeking a second Kiva loan to continue to grow her business by purchasing more broiler chicks and feed. Angeline intends to use the profits from her expansion to support her family and keep her siblings in school. The interest on Angeline’s “social-interest” loan will continue to be repaid through her weekly volunteer work as a Camfed Learner Guide, leading life skills sessions with students at her local high school.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feeds.

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Safiya is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, she has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Safiya would have had to sell her maize for low prices at harvest to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Safiya will store the maize she harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when she can obtain a significantly higher price for her maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Safiya now has the opportunity to actualize her dream to grow her agriculture business for herself and family members and would like to use this additional income to provide employment to members of her community through her farm.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Bvumai

texts.en:
Bvumai is a 30-year-old widow living in the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe. She looks after her two children and her sister’s two children who were orphaned.

Bvumai started her clothing business in 2011, and with her first Kiva loan, she expanded to a second booth at the local flea market. Bvumai has been able to significantly increase her profits by buying her stock in bulk. In light of her business success, Bvumai seeks a third Kiva loan to expand to a larger shop and increase the diversity of her inventory.

The interest on Bvumai’s “social-interest” loan will continue to be repaid through her weekly volunteer work as a Cama Community Health Trainer. Bvumai is devoted to helping her community fight against HIV and AIDS as well as poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nyarkudor Group

texts.en:
From the area of Chorkor in the Greater Accra region of Ghana is an outstanding hard-working man named Eric. He is in his 22nd year selling of lubricants in an industrial area of Chorkor.

Eric is married to a teacher and they have two children, both in elementary school. Eric and his family currently live in their own residence.

He is a representative of the Nyarkudor Group of two members including himself..Eric and his counterpart wish to take out a loan of 1,700 GHS to buy more items due to the rapid sales increase.
He will be very grateful if his needs are met with the help of Kiva through ID-Ghana. Eric is willing to repay faithfully according to the terms agreed to.

loans.use: to buy more items due to the rapid sales increase.

loans.name: Dalhatu

texts.en:
Dalhatu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Dalhatu is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Dalhatu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Dalhatu will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.
With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Dalhatu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 59-year-old widowed mother of three. She started selling clothes 22 years ago to cover the needs and expenses of her beloved children. She is their sole support and she works hard to satisfy all their needs.

She is well-known throughout her region and has a good reputation for her professional communication skills.

Zainab is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' requests.

Zainab hopes to expand her business in the future to increase her income and continue providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' requests.

loans.name: Shoira

texts.ru:
Эту женщину зовут Шоира. Она дома занимается шитьем национальной  женской одежды на заказ. Ей удобно шить на дому. Шоира добрая и шустрая женщина, которая хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она научилась шить и кроить женскую одежду 2 года назад и по сей день продолжает свое любимое дело.
 Шоира в этом году исполнилось 37 лет. Она проживает на районе Шахритус  с 18 и 20 летними сыновьями и матерью. К сожалению, её муж в настоящее время находится вдали от семьи – он на заработках в Российской Федерации, и каждый месяц отправляет им деньги. 
В швейном деле Шоире нравится ежедневный доход и общение с новыми людьми. Она берет кредит, чтобы купить новую вышивальную и профессиональную швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить процесс работы и приобрести много клиентов. Ее мечта - в будущем открыть свое ателье по шитью национальной женской одежды.
texts.en:
This woman is called Shoira. She works at home sewing traditional women's dresses to order. Sewing at home is convenient for her. She is a kind and intelligent woman who manages her work well. She started cutting and sewing women's clothing two years ago and to this day continues her favourite task.

This year, Shoira turned 37. She lives in the Shahrituz region with her 18- and 20-year-old sons and her mother. Unfortunately, her husband is currently far from his family, working in Russia, and he sends them money every month.

Shoira likes her daily income from the business and the process of working and bringing in many customers. Her dream for the future is to open her own atelier sewing traditional women's clothing.

loans.use: to buy a professional sewing and embroidery machine

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel wants to send her deepest gratitude to lenders who extended their financial help and to Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for the approval of her previous loan. Without the loan, it might take a long time before she can refill bulk quantities of grocery products for her variety store business. The loan enabled her to attract more patrons and increase revenue. She’s thankful to God first and foremost for providing instruments to improve the business.

The profits earned is what she uses to pay bills and other home expenses. Christmas season is fast approaching, and to refill grocery items for this coming season is her goal. So Marifel applied again for a loan of PHP 50,000, with which she will buy additional grocery items for her variety store and likewise increase the revolving fund used in the business.

Despite being busy managing the business, Marifel spares time to attend her CCT group fellowship that consists of 10-15 individuals, where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hears testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and repay micro finance loans

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Celyn

texts.en:
Celyn is blessed for knowing Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and she’s thankful for the PHP 20,000 loan. She was able to buy pairs of different footwear designs for her business. She can’t thank lenders enough for the monetary support since this enabled her business to earn more.

Celyn is determined to succeed in the business so she can continually support her children and their education. She also wants to save money to invest in a house and lot. With the help of the Lord, she and her family are able to survive every day.

However, Celyn still needs additional capital for her business as there are customers who make late payments which affects the business. She applied for a loan of PHP 30,000 so she can buy more designs of footwear. And since Christmas season is fast approaching, she will need to add more products to stock.

Celyn is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy more designs of footwear for her business.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is able to gain new patrons and increase her monthly sales since her previous loan has paved the way for her business to improve. Aside from the daily earnings of her husband, being involved in a Direct Selling business really helped them with their daily expenses. She’s grateful that she’s able to help her husband through this business.

Managing the business at home where her neighbors and friends are mostly her patrons, she can’t avoid receiving delayed payments affecting the business’ revenue. To compensate for this, she’s using spare capital to buy new products. Now, she’s requesting approval of her new loan of PHP 30,000 which she’ll use to stock products like lotion, face creams and other cosmetics to add to her buy and sell business.

Michelle has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her to become strong spiritually and dependent to God on every occasion.

loans.use: To stock products like lotion, face creams and other cosmetics to add to her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is continually able to operate her business through the help of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and lenders who joined the Kiva program. She’s grateful that there are people willing to share God’s blessings without expecting anything in return.

Through the loans she has received, she’s now able to earn about PHP 7,000 every month. With much appreciation for lenders' support, she was able to purchase grocery products for her store.

Maria started with a very little capital. Because of her perseverance, she’s able to support her family’s daily needs and pay their household bills. Maria has many dreams for her family. She desires to have a closer family relationship and also good health for them. She dreams that her business will become visible and viable in the years to come.

She wants to have more grocery items in stock so she would like to apply again for a new loan of PHP 25,000. She believes that this amount will make a great impact on her business and she hopes that lenders would once again consider her loan request.

Maria believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to have more grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
With her first Kiva loan Marine hoped that this investment would allow her to sell more dairy products, thereby providing the family with more income. Her partnership realized all her plans and justified her expectations. In Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region, Marine is still busy with her farming and at the same time is employed at a private packing company. Marine is married and she lives with her husband and two sons in this cute and nice village. On her farm she has cows, calves, a heifer, a piglet, sheep, and chickens and she manages to sell her farm’s milk, cheese, meat, and eggs to a number of regular customers. Marine also farms potatoes, cucumbers and tomatoes, part of which she takes for her family and the greater part of it she sells. As she mentions, she is happy with her farming, with her lovely family in her beloved native village.

This time with her second Kiva loan of 200,000 Armenian drams, Marine plans to buy fodder for all her cattle getting prepared for coming cold winter months.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her all farm cattle getting prepared for coming cold winter months

loans.name: Ofelia Isabel

texts.es:
Ofelia de 37 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos, está casada, madre de tres hijos los cuales están estudiando y todos dependen económicamente de ella.


Ofelia se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 10 años, también se dedica a la elaboración de productos artesanales, en esta actividad lleva mas de 20 años y disfruta mucho llevándola a cabo.



El crédito será utilizado para comprar 4 quintales de maíz, leña y carbón para la elaboración y venta de tortillas.



El sueño de Ofelia es seguir trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios, mejorar el negocio y crecer económicamente para construir una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Ofelia, 37, wasn't able to go to school because her parents were poor. She is married and the mother of three children who are studying, and they all depend financially on her. Ofelia has been selling tortillas for 10 years, and she also has been selling artisanal goods for more than 20 years, an activity that she really enjoys. 

This loan will be used to buy 400 lbs of corn, firewood and charcoal for making and selling tortillas. Ofelia's dream is to keep working to help her children get ahead in their studies, make improvements to her business, and to be able to afford to build a better home.

loans.use: to buy 400 lbs of corn, firewood and charcoal to make and sell tortillas.

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es:
Dora, de 41 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales estudian en la escuela y el mas pequeño va al kinder, su pareja trabaja como empleado en una tienda como cargador y contribuye con los gastos del hogar. 

Dora, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 5 años, ya es muy conocida y tiene varios clientes, ella vende desayunos, almuerzos y refrigerios por encargo como sándwiches, panes con pollo y pupusas, acompañados de bebidas frías; ella se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. para preparase para trabajar y arreglar a los niños para que su esposo los lleve a la escuela. 

Dora, necesita el préstamo para abastecer su negocio de materia prima para la elaboración de la comida y para hacerle algunas reparaciones a su local que también es su casa; ella desea darle un retoque a las instalaciones y comprar algunas cosas que le hacen falta para brindar una mejor atención. 

Los sueños de Dora, son poder hacer más grande su negocio y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos para que estudien.
texts.en:
Dora, 41, is a hardworking and responsible woman. She is married and has 3 children who are in school, the youngest in kindergarten. Her husband works as a loader in a store and contributes to the household expenses.

Dora has been selling food for 5 years and is now very well known and has lots of customers. She sells breakfast, lunches and to-go snacks like sandwiches, chicken sandwiches, and pupusas, along with cold drinks. She gets up at 4am to prepare for work and get the kids ready for her husband to take them to school.

Dora needs this loan to stock her business with ingredients for making meals and to make some repairs to her business location, which is also her home. She wants to retouch the facilities and buy some things that she lacks so that she can provide better service to her customers.

Dora's dreams are to grow her business and to be able to help her children in their studies.

loans.use: to stock her business with basic ingredients for making meals, and to make some repairs to her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a Babban Gona Farmers Association farmer. Mohammad is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Mohammad would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Mohammad can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date, for up to 37% more than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Mohammad has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to USD 2,000 per hectare.

Mohammad is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to pay for his children's school fees and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Zulfiyya

texts.en:
Zulfiyya is 37 years old. She is a refugee from the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. She has a large family. Her family consists of 3 children, her husband and the parents-in-law.

Zulfiyya is a farmer and her children are supporting her. She knows that she must work hard for her family's needs. Because of this, she wakes up very early in the morning and takes care of the animals in her yard, like cattle and sheep. She fattens them and then sells their meat in the market. Zulfiyya has 15 years' experience and that has made her a great expert in this field.

Meat is in great demand in Azerbaijan. People like meat for traditional food like kufta, bozbash and kebabs. Zulfiyya sells her animals' natural meat in the local bazaar. Her kids and husband also support her in her daily activities. Currently she is planning to buy 4 calves and needs a 2000 AZN loan.

Hopefully Kiva lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Jessica Johanna

texts.es:
Jessica, de 34 años de edad, es una señora muy trabajadora, está acompañada, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos que estudian y su pareja trabaja para poder ayudarle con los gastos del hogar.

Jessica, se ha dedicado a la venta de productos de primera necesidad desde hace varios años y gracias a su negocio ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y a su familia.

Ella necesita el préstamo para surtir su tienda con más productos y para comprar cosméticos y productos de belleza tales como cremas, maquillaje y delineadores de ojos. 

Jessica, sueña con casarse con su pareja y darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, para que en el futuro tengan mejores oportunidades y sean personas de éxito.
texts.en:
Jessica, 34, is a very hardworking woman. She lives with her partner and their two school-aged children. Her partner works and helps out with the household expenses.

Jessica has had a general store for several years, and thanks to her business she has been able to help out her children and her family. She needs a loan to stock her store with more products, and to buy cosmetics and beauty products like creams, makeup and eyeliner.

Jessica dreams of marrying her partner and giving her children a better quality of life, so that in the future they have more opportunities and can be successful.

loans.use: to stock her general store and buy cosmetics and beauty products like creams, makeup and eyeliner.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is married with five children and lives in three room apartment house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She remembers the sad death of her parents and that of her child, ill health and a general poverty line. She still stands strong and knows that his business will succeed because she started long ago and so has gained more experience and steady customers with a good site for her business.

With the loan, she intends to rent a piece of land, buy potatoes seedlings, yam tuber, fertilizer, pay for temporal manual labor, pay for weeding and harvesting, also pay for transportation of the produce from the farm to the market. This activity will actively help the community in that people around will not need to travel far distances again to buy food stuff elsewhere. She will sell at moderate prices to small traders in the community, transportation will be reduced to buy directly in the public market. Also her will used part of the loan to buy fuel wood for sale.

The profit from the activity will be used to increase the size of her farm, give proper education for her children; provide medication for the family in any case of ill health. She rather prefers a loan from GHAPE because the interest rate is low, the method of repayment is very simple and the rules are easy to follow,

loans.use: to buy yam seedlings, fertilizer, pay clearing, pay tilling and transportation of yields to the market.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Sonia is 44 years old and has four children who are in school.

Sonia has a ice cream vending business in the Philippines. Sonia requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, ice, etc..

Sonia has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Sonia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, ice, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra de 30 años de edad, estudió hasta 7º grado, está acompañada y su pareja tiene un negocio de cielos falsos y ventanas, tiene tres hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de la comunidad.


Sandra se dedica a trabajar junto a su esposo en su negocio que tienen de cielos falsos y  ventanas ya por varios años, 
ella le apoya en su negocio, lo tienen en el centro de la ciudad y el horario de trabajo es de 7:00 AM a 3:00 PM, además ha decidido emprender otro negocio de venta de tortillas con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

 
Sandra solicita este préstamo para comprar maíz, leña y otros materiales que necesita para la elaboración y venta de tortillas.

El sueño de Sandra tener un negocio mas grande y mejor establecido y darle lo mejor a sus hijos para que ellos estudien y tengan todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Sandra, 30, studied until 7th grade. She is married and her partner has a business putting in drop ceilings and windows. She has 3 children who are in the local school. Sandra helps her husband with his business, which he has been running for several years. The business is located in the city center and they work from 7am to 3pm.

They have decided to open another business selling tortillas, with the goal of improving their living conditions. Sandra is asking for a loan to buy corn, firewood and other materials needed to make and sell tortillas. Her dream is to have a bigger and better-established business and to give her children the best so that they can study and have everything they need.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and other materials needed for making and selling tortillas.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is a woman and 29 year old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Florinda has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Florinda requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Florinda has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Florinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
