Blanca, de 53 años de edad, está soltera, pero tuvo 3 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y tienen sus propias familias, ella estudio hasta primer grado, pero aprendió a leer y a escribir y vive sola en su casa. 

Blanca, tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, en donde vende productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, arroz, aceite, café, lejía y otros productos que se necesitan en el hogar; ella tiene varios años de tener su negocio, porque es el medio por el cual ella sobrevive. 

Blanca, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos para su tienda, porque se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y en esa época se vende bastante. 

Blanca, sueña con poder seguir trabajando y vivir tranquila como siempre lo ha hecho en su casa.
texts.en:
Blanca is 53 years old. She is single, but she had three children who are now older and have their own families. She went to school up until the first grade, but she learned to read and write. Blanca lives alone in her house.

Blanca has a small store in her house in which she sells basic necessities like sugar, rice, oil, coffee, bleach, and other products that are needed in the home. She has had her business for many years because it is the means by which she survives.

Blanca needs the loan to buy more products for her store because the end of the year holidays are approaching, and quite a lot is sold during that time.

Blanca dreams of being able to continue working, and to live peacefully like she has always done in her house.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store.

loans.name: José Santiago

texts.es:
José de 46 años de edad, estudió hasta 9º grado, está casado y su pareja se dedica a oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos uno mayor de edad y el otro menor de edad.


José ya tiene seis años de poseer una panadería, sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar en este rubro, ahora su esposa e hijos le apoyan a la elaboración del pan, elaboran pan de lunes a viernes y el fin de semana lo dedican a la iglesia.


José solicita este préstamo para comprar harina, huevos, sal, azúcar, manteca, entre otros insumos para la elaboración de pan.

El sueño de José es tener mejor la panadería y que cada día mejoren sus ingresos y su familia pueda tener todo lo necesario para la vida.
texts.en:
José, age 46, went to school through the ninth grade. He is married, and his life partner devotes herself to the household chores. He has two children. One is an adult, and the other is a minor. José has had a bakery for six years. His parents taght him to work in this field. Now, his wife and children help him make the bread. They make bread from Monday through Friday, and on the week-end they devote themselves to the church.

José is requesting a loan to buy flour, eggs, salt, sugar, shortening, and other supplies to make bread. José's dream is to have a better bakery and for his income to improve each day. He also dreams of his family being able to have everything they need in life.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, salt, sugar, shortening, and other supplies to make bread.

loans.name: Hamam

texts.en:
Hamam is a young man living in Rafah Gaza strip. He works in the public sector, where the salary is very low and unstable. As a result of the high cost of living, he decided to open new business. His business idea is to transport the goods and inventory between traders in his rickshaw. A few years ago Hamam bought a new rickshaw and become well known and also has loyal customers.

Hamam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to make do maintenance on his rickshaw. By taking this loan Hamam can working more efficiently and increase his sales also his profit.


. Rickshaw (Tuk-Tuk)

Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to do some maintenance for his rickshaw,.

loans.name: Mwanamgeni

texts.en:
Mwanamgeni is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees for the family.

Mwanamgeni operates a grocery vegetables selling stall for the past five years, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of competition in her business.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Atieno

texts.en:
Atieno is a single woman who has no children. She lives at a rental  house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of competition in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Liliam Maribel

texts.es:
Liliam, de 36 años de edad, está casada, vive con su esposo y tienen dos hijos, su esposo trabaja junto a ella en un puesto en el mercado. 

Liliam, se dedica a la reparación de celulares y su esposo trabaja con ella dando mantenimiento y reparando celulares descompuestos, ellos tienen un pequeño taller ubicado en en puesto en el mercado municipal de su pueblo y tiene 5 años de tener este negocio.

Liliam, necesita el préstamo para comprar ciertos aparatos y herramientas que les facilitan el trabajo de la reparación de celulares, ella quiere comprarlos al contado a su proveedor para no comprarlo caro. 

Los sueños de Liliam, son poder continuar con su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Liliam is 36 years old and married. She lives with her husband, and they have two children. Her husband works with her in a stall at the market. Liliam works repairing cell phones, and her husband works with her providing maintenance to and repairing broken cell phones. They have a small workshop located in a stall at the municipal market in their town, and have 5 years in this business.

Liliam needs the loan to buy certain devices and tools that will help them in their job repairing cell phones. She wants to buy them in cash from the supplier, to avoid paying too much. Liliam's dreams are to continue with her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy certain devices and tools that will help in her work repairing cell phones.

loans.name: Juana Salvadora

texts.es:
Juana de 52 años de edad, no tiene un nivel de estudio pues debido a la pobreza sus padres no la pusieron a estudiar, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos quienes por si mismos se ganan la vida.

Juana desde que tenia sus hijos pequeños empezó a trabajar y se dedicó a vender pan dulce en canasta en el centro de 
la ciudad, sigue realizando la misma actividad todos los días de la semana.

 
El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar mas  pan para vender y quien le apoyará a vender es su hija de esa manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida.

Juana espera seguir trabajando con esta institución  y espera esforzarse para lograr sus metas.
texts.en:
Juana is 52 years old. She had no schooling because due to the poverty of her parents, they didn't send her to school. She is a single mother. She has three children who are self sufficient. Since her children were young, Juana began to work selling sweet bread in a basket in the downtown area. She continues in this work every day of the week.

She will use the loan to buy more bread to sell. Her daughter helps her sell. In this way she will be improving her quality of life. Juana hopes to continue working with this institution and hopes to strive to meet her goals.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a single mother of six. She lives with her children in a six-room apartment house in Bamenda Mezam division in the northwest region of Cameroon. Recently she faced many challenges in life; the death of her father and her cousin, limited finance to carry out her business, persistent sickness in her family, and limited finance for her children school needs.

Lydia requested this loan to buy food stuff such as bananas, yams, beans, vegetable oil, plantains corn, yam, as well as small provision items such as soaps, sweets, detergents, and biscuits to sell. She is positive that this business will be successful because she has being doing it for a long time and have a good clientele. She sells these items from their family house, so she doesn't have to pay store rents which is an added advantage to her.

From the business profit of this loan, she will buy more food stuff, pay her children’s school fees, and expand her business. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of its low interest and how the loan will be paid in installments. The interest rate is low and the repayment duration is not stressful.

loans.use: to buy food stuff such as bananas, yams , beans, vegetable oil, plantains, and corn to sell

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of five children; she lives with her children in a five room apartment house in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many difficulties in life among which are; the death of her father, inadequate finance to carry out her business, persistent sickness in her family and inadequate finance to cater for her children school needs.

With the new loan request, she will buy food stuff such as beans, vegetable oil, bananas, yams, beans, vegetable oil, plantains corn, yam, Also part of the loan will be used to buy same provision items such as sweets, detergents Maggi, biscuits and soap. She is positive that this business wills success because she has being doing it for long and had a good market site, And have steady customers.

With the profit from this loan she will buy more food stuff, pay the children’s school fees and expand her business. She preferred a loan from GHAPE because of its low interest, the loan will be paid small amounts per seating, low interest rates and the repayment duration is unstressful.

loans.use: to buy food stuff such as bananas, yams, beans, vegetable oil, plantains, corn.

loans.name: Kakhaber

texts.en: Kakhaber is 41 years old. He is married and lives in Ozurgeti district with his wife Miranda, who is unemployed, Kakhaber works as an artisan. He works on stone and gets order to manufacture different styles of stones. As his income is not stable, Kakhaber decided to start an additional business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 1100 USD. With the received he will start trading seasonal fruits and vegetables and will increase family income. Kakhaber is very motivated and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
Rossana de 36 años de edad, estudió hasta 9º grado, está casada  y su esposo tiene un taller de bicicletas, tienen dos hijos adolescentes, actualmente viven en casa alquilada desde hace cinco años.

Rossana, desde hace años se ha dedicado a trabajar con el propósito de ayudarle a su esposo para aportar un poco para 
los gastos de la casa, ella lava y plancha en varios lugares, en la mañana hace limpieza y lava las sábanas de un hotel 
del centro de su domicilio y  en la tarde va a varios hogares a planchar, todo esto lo hace de lunes a domingo.


El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar maíz al por mayor y vender por libras en su casa, de esa forma obtendrá otros ingresos  y mejorará sus condiciones de vida.

El sueño de Rossana es tener una mini-tienda en su hogar y así cuidar mas de sus hijos siempre con el propósito de mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rossana is 36 years old. She went to school until the 9th grade. She is married, and her husband has a bicycle repair shop. They have two adolescent children. They currently live in a home they have rented for the last five years. Rossana for some years has worked in order to help her husband a little with the household expenses. She washes and irons in various places. In the morning she cleans and washes sheets at a hotel in the downtown area from her home. In the afternoons she goes to various homes to iron. She does all this from Monday to Sunday.

The loan will be used to buy corn wholesale to sell by the pound from her house. In this manner she will obtain additional income and will improve the conditions of her life. Rossana's dream is to have a small store in her home, in order to better care for her children, always with the goal of improving the conditions of their life.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and to sell it by the pound from her house.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a maize farmer from Kunda village. As a Babban Gona member, Aminu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Aminu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Aminu can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Aminu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Aminu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Restituto

texts.en:
Restituto has a variety retail store. With a previous loan he had with Center for Community Transformation (CCT), he was able to buy stocks of grocery needed and displayed at his store to attract more patrons. He wants to send his gratitude for your untiring support to every entrepreneurs lacking financial capability to run a business.

With his business Restituto is able to support the education of his children and pay for his home expenses. He wishes continuing good health for his whole family. He also wishes to be successful in his business so he can save and invest for the future.

Now, he requests a PHP 10,000 loan to step up his business. The amount will be used as an added to capital to buy additional grocery items to stock his variety store.

* On a weekly basis, Restituto meets with his co-fellowship members to share his life’s testimony, experience on the business, and to draw strength and inspiration from each other and the Word of God. His fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups also gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for his variety store.

loans.name: Paola Sara

texts.es:
Paola, es una mujer muy perseverante de cincuenta y dos años de edad, dedicada a su negocio; con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado hacer de su pulpería su principal fuente de ingreso, sustento importante para su familia. Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y sus dos hijas, además ha hecho de MiCrédito su principal aliado en su crecimiento como comercianta. 
En estos momentos, ella ha encontrado en un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito una oportunidad grandiosa para surtirse en productos y comprar arroz, maíz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, embutidos, entre otros. Paola es una mujer decida que aún tiene muchas metas por cumplir, en un futuro desea que su pulpería se vuelva una distribuidora importante de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Paola is a very persevering 52 year old woman, who is dedicated to her business. With great effort she has managed to make her corner store her primary source of income, important sustenance for her family. She has the unconditional support of her husband and her two daughters. In addition she has made MiCrédito her principal ally in her growth as a businesswoman.

Currently she as found, through a Kiva loan together with MiCrédito, a great opportunity to stock up on products and buy rice, corn, sugar, beans, oil, and cold cuts, among other things. Paola is a decisive woman who still has many goals to accomplish. In the future she hopes that her corner store becomes an important distributor in her community.

loans.use: to buy rice, corn, sugar, beans, oil, and cold cuts, among other things.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of one child, who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition in her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000 she wants to purchase a stock of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es:
Ana, de 53 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora y muy emprendedora, está soltera y tuvo 3 hijos, pero su esposo la abandono y ella tuvo que asumir la responsabilidad de sus 3 hijos; ahora dos de ellos estudian y uno ya está casado.

Ana, se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad, ella es dueña de una tienda que está en su casa y tiene más de 15 años de haberla puesto, porque cuando era joven trabajaba pero no había quien cuidara de sus hijos, fue por eso que decidió trasladar su trabajo a su casa para poder estar pendiente de sus hijos.

Ana, necesita el préstamo para abastecer su tienda de jabón, pan, café, detergente, arroz, azúcar, entre otros productos para vender.

Los sueños de Ana son, poder ver a sus hijos graduados y con un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Ana, age 53, is a tenacious and very enterprising woman. She is single. She had three children, but her husband abandoned her. She had to take on the responsibility of their three children. Two of them now go to school, and one is married. Ana sells basic needs products. She has a store that is at her house, and she set it up over 15 years ago. When she was young she worked, but there was no one to take care of her children. Therefore, she decided to move her work to her house in order to be able to keep an eye on her children.

Ana needs the loan to stock her store with soap, bread, coffee, detergent, rice, sugar, and other products to sell.

Ana's dream is to be able to see her children graduate with a good job.

loans.use: to stock her store with soap, bread, coffee, detergent, rice, and sugar, among other products to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a young man living in the Rafah Gaza strip. He works in the public sector where the salary is very low and unstable. Due to the high cost of living, he decided to start his own business. His business is transporting goods and inventory between traders in the area in his motor rickshaw.

A few years ago Ali bought his new rickshaw and he had become famous with his business and has loyal customers. Ali requested a loan from FATEN to help him do some maintenance on his rickshaw. With the needed maintenance, Ali can work more efficiently and increase his sales and profits.

* Rickshaws (also called “tuk-tuks”) are a common mode of transportation for goods and people in the Gaza Strip, due to efficient use of fuel, which can be scarce and expensive due to the economic blockade. Further, they became even more appealing following the Summer 2014 assault and the resulting destruction of buildings, homes, and infrastructure, as they are able to navigate narrow roads and difficult to reach places.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his motor rickshaw

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 20-year-old single man and a Palestinian refugee living in a refugee camp. Due to the limited work access for Palestinians in Lebanon, he left school at an early age and opened an entertainment shop inside the camp a year ago.

Mohammad is a hard worker and motivated. He's trying to develop his business further and today he is requesting a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy several computers and play stations to attract more customers.

Mohammad hopes to expand his business further in the future through opening a games hall for his community to increase his income and invest for his own future and family.

loans.use: to buy computers and play stations to attract more customers.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married mother of one child, who is still too young to attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, Josephine has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. Seasonality and theft are major challenges to her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 30,000, Josephine wants to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman with three kids, two of whom attend school. She lives in a rented house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Jackline operates a grocery vegetable stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, está acompañada, tiene 2 hijos de los cuales se encuentran culminando el año escolar.

Rosa, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y plátano, esta labor la realiza con la ayuda de sus dos hijos, mientras su esposo se dedica a trabajar en otro lugar.

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar plantas de plátano para comercializarlas y así mismo poder tener un ingreso extra para su familia.

Rosa, sueña con poder tener una unión más grande con su familia y también tener un negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 26 years old, studied up until second grade. She is in a relationship and has two children who are about to finish their school year. Rosa cultivates corn, beans and bananas. Her two children are helping her with this work, while her husband is working somewhere else.

Rosa needs the loan to buy banana plants to market them so that she can have some extra income for her family. Rosa dreams of having a greater connection with her family and also have a business.

loans.use: to buy banana plants to market them.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos con 66 años de edad,de estado civil casada,vive junto a su esposo y nieto, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona urbana. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Santos se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarrotes, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 13 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el mercado de Cayaltí. Solicita préstamo para la compra de mercadería como son arroz,azúcar y otros.De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, obteniendo más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Santos a tenido préstamos en Edpyme Alternativa, el último fué de S/.2,000.00 y lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
66-year-old Santos is married and lives with her husband and her grandson in an urban area of the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department of Peru. Her neighbors can give good personal and professional references of her. Most locals work in agriculture, commerce, and animal farming.

Santos works selling groceries, and has done it for more than thirteen years. Her store is located in the Cayaltí market.

She is requesting a loan to buy groceries, such as rice and sugar. This will help her to expand her business by increasing her income. It will also help her to improve her living conditions.

Santos has received loans before from Edpyme Alternativa. The last time she received PEN 2,000, and repaid the loan according to plan.

loans.use: to buy groceries, such as rice and sugar.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: A sus 22 años de edad Luis cuenta con una pequeña panadería que se especializa en postres y cake, además para acompañar venden bebidas frías y calientes, lo cual le permite salir adelante con su familia. Luis vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 1 año de edad al que siempre busca brindarle lo mejor. Él desea invertir en su negocio y de esta manera aumentar sus ventas, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: harina, azúcar, huevos, leche y bebidas para aumentar su producción de cake y postres además de bebidas.
texts.en:
Luis is 22 years old and already owns a small bakery which specializes in desserts and cake. In addition, to accompany the cake, he sells both cold and warm drinks. This business helps him get his family ahead.
Luis lives in a home which he owns, along with his wife and their son who is 1 year old. Luis hopes to give him the best. He wants to invest in his business and increase his sales. For these reasons he requests a loan from FUSAI, which he will invest in flour, sugar, eggs, milk and beverages to increase his production of cake and desserts and beverages as well.

loans.use: to invest in cake ingredients and beverages.

loans.name: Senaira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Senayra es una mujer audaz y emprendedora, ella empezó vendiendo un poco de cosméticos de forma ambulante, con el pasar del tiempo gracias a la buena inversión de sus ganancias y captación de fieles clientes,  ha logrado diversificar su negocio, y crecer notablemente como comercianta, por eso ella confía y está muy agradecida. 
Senayra desea seguir creciendo como comercianta es por esta razon que ha recurrido un financiamiento, con el cual planea comprar pacas de ropa para niños y niñas, zapatos, cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, dado que en esta temporada del año la demanda sube y ella necesita estar lista para suplir las necesidades de sus clientes. En un futuro desea poner una tienda en su casa, también comprar un vehículo para poder ofertar de forma más segura, su mercadería.
texts.en:
Senaira is a bold and entrepreneurial woman. She began selling a small amount of cosmetics as a street vendor. Over time, thanks to careful investing of her earnings and the acquisition of loyal customers, she has diversified her business, and has grown noticeably as a businesswoman. This gives her confidence, and she is very grateful.

Senaira wants to continue growing as a businesswoman. For that reason she seeks financing, with which she plans to buy bales of clothes for boys and girls, shoes, cosmetics, perfumes, and creams, since in this season of the year demand increases, and she needs to be ready to fill the needs of her customers. In the future she want to put a store in her house, and wants to buy a vehicle, in order to be able to offer her merchandise in the safest way.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for boys and girls, shoes, cosmetics, perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Abanabumwi Womens Group

texts.en:
Christine is 45 years old and married, with three children. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. Two of her children attend school and she also takes care of her parents who are of advanced age.

Christine deals in the buying and selling of cocoa as her major source of income. Twenty-five years ago, she started by growing cocoa on her small piece of land in order to raise school fees, in spite of the challenges, like competition and weather, which affect her sales and profitability.

As a family goal, she would like to educate her children to university level. Her business hope for the future is to become a prominent cocoa trader in the area.

Christine is a member of Abanabumwi Womens Group where members guarantee each other for loans. She is requesting a loan to enable her to expand her business by buying more cocoa to sell.

The extra person in the photo is a group member who saves with the others, has guaranteed them, but has not taken a loan.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando,  de cincuenta años de edad, es un hombre honesto y trabajador. Desde pequeño creció en medio del campo y su padre se encargó en enseñarle distintas formas de trabajar, el incursiono en la venta de ganado y cerdos, de semillas de cacao, granos básicos y encontró su vocación en la elaboración de aliños para caballos, mulas y bueyes 
Desde hace muchos años se ha dedicado a esto, su clientela cada vez crece más, por eso él ha decidido a crecer como comerciante y la mejor forma de hacerlo es optando a un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, que le permita surtirse de materiales que utiliza como materia prima, por eso solicita el credito para comprar mecate, alambre, bisagras, entre otros. En un futuro Orlando desea poner un taller, para dejar de ofertar su producto de manera ambulante.
texts.en: Orlando, 50, is an honest and hardworking man. He grew up in a rural area and his father taught him various ways to support himself. He has sold cattle and pigs, cacao seeds, and basic grains, and he found his vocation in making reins for horses, mules and oxen. He has been doing this for many years now and his clientele continues to grow, which is why he has decided to grow his business using a Kiva loan with MiCredito, which lets him stock up on the materials that he needs. He asks for a loan to buy rope, wire, hinges and other things. In the future, Orlando wants to put in a workshop so that he can stop offering his products door-to-door.

loans.use: to buy rope, wire, and hinges, among other things.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Markus is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Markus would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Markus will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Markus now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Grupo Cumes Group

texts.es:
Antonia es una mujer de 34 años de edad, es soltera con una hija de 17 años que se encuentra estudiando aun, esta familia vive en una comunidad de la aldea Santa Catarina Palopó.
Antonia (la que se ubica en medio de los tres integrantes) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, con este negocio lleva ella 5 años de realizarlo, le gusta esta actividad pues lo realiza desde la comodidad de su hogar, permitiéndole así realizar otras actividades en otras casas que también le genera ingresos.
Antonia ha pensado en preparar mucho producto para este fin de año que se está acercando para lograr aprovechar mejor esta época, pero una de sus mayores dificultades es no contar con suficiente dinero, por esa razón solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de hilos de tipo, seda, alemán y lustrina.
Antonia espera poder contar con su propio local de negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonia is a 34-year-old woman. She is single with a 17-year-old daughter, who is still studying. This family lives in a community in the village of Santa Catarina Palopó.

Antonia (the one located in the middle of the three members), with the ambition to gain income and get her family ahead, earns a living making traditional clothing. She has been in this business for 5 years. She likes this business since she carries it out from the comfort of her home, thus allowing her to do other things in other homes that also earn her an income.

Antonia has thought about preparing a lot of product for the end of the year, which is approaching, in order to take better advantage of this time. But one of her major difficulties is not having enough money. For that reason, she is requesting a new loan in order to buy silk, embroidery, alpaca, and other kinds of threads.

Antonia hopes to be able to have her own shop for her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy silk, embroidery, alpaca, and other kinds of threads for making traditional clothing.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.ru: Молодой таксист района Шахритус Фируз. Он не женат и не имеет детей. Фируз идет по стопам отца. Его отец раньше занимался таксистом, и научил Фируза как правильно водить машину и соблюдать правило дорожного движения. Фируз занимается таксистом Душанбе - Шахритус.  У него имеется постоянные клиенты. Фируз не только перевозить людей, он еще перевозить товар клиентов. Фируз самостоятельный и заботливый парень в семье. Он просит кредит для купли автозапчастей для восстановления автомашин. Фируз хочет продвигать деятельность и не потерять источник дохода. Вы можете поддержать его!
texts.en: Firuz is a young taxi driver from the Shahrituz district. He is not married and does not have children. Firuz is following in his father's footsteps. His father had previously worked as a taxi driver and taught Firuz how to drive a car and follow driving rules. Firuz drives along the Dushanbe-Shahrituz route. He has regular customers. Firuz does not only transport passengers, but also their merchandise. Firuz is an independent and caring young man in his family. He is requesting this loan to buy auto parts to repair his car. Firuz wants to advance his business and retain his source of income. You can support him!

loans.use: to buy auto parts in order to repair his car

loans.name: Sreyneak

texts.en: Sreyneak is a 22-year-old single teacher. She lives in Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. She has been a teacher since 2013, earing around USD 4 per day. Now, Sreyneak would like to request a loan to pay her tuition fees for the third year. With this loan, she will have enough money for earning a bachelor’s degree and achieve her future dreams. This is her second loan cycle. After graduation, she wants a proper job with reasonable salary so she will be able to save money to have a new house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for third year

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Ruth works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from beauty parlor. Ruth is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy materials for her business for her tailoring shop business.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business.

loans.name: Verna

texts.en:
Verna is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Verna is 36 years old and has five children who are in school.

Verna has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Verna requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

Verna has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Verna would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of one child, Cecilia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Cecilia is borrowing PHP 40000 through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business.

Cecilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jenny works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fish. Jenny is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy additional net, gasoline, rope, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.

Jenny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional net, gasoline, rope, bamboo, etc

loans.name: Phon's Group

texts.en: Phon’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Phon makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Gulumkan

texts.ru: Гулумкан, 30 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. Гулумкан в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2011 году. Благодаря упорному труду Гулумкан в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 2 овцы, 3 лошади, также есть земельный надел мерою 1,0 ГА, где Гулумкан выращивает ячмень для реализации. Гулумкан в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма и разведения. Доходы от кредита она вложит в расширение бизнеса и постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en:
Gulumkan is 30, married, and the mother of four children.  Since 2011, she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, Gulumkan now has two cows, two sheep and three horses on her farm.  She also grows barley for resale on one hectare of land.

Eager to further develop her farming business, Gulumkan has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep for fattening and breeding.  She will use the earnings from her loan to expand her activity and build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy some sheep for fattening and breeding.

loans.name: Maria Silvia

texts.es:
María Silvia con 32 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos hijos, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura y ganadería.

María Silvia se dedica a prestar servicio como jornalera agrícola, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 02 años. Actualmente se encuentra laborando en el despanque de maíz. Solicita préstamo para la compra de herramientas de jornalería para sus labores diarias.

María Silvia cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socia nueva para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María Silvia is 32 years old and lives in common-law with her live-in partner and their two children, in the district of Zaña, province of Chiclayo, region of Lambayeque, in Peru. The residents of this area work mainly in agriculture and cattle farming. 

María Silvia works as a farm day laborer with more than 2 years of experience in the business. She is currently working in corn husking. She is requesting a loan for the purchase of day laborer tools for her daily jobs.

María Silvia has credit history. She is a new member for Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase day laborer tools for her daily jobs.

loans.name: Habu

texts.en:
Habu is maize farmer from Kyasge village. As a member of Babban Gona, he is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With our support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tons per hectare of land, five-and-a-half times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Habu had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest, so that he could meet his immediate needs for food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Habu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to thirty-seven percent more.

Habu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell his maize crop for low prices right at harvest.

loans.name: Astkhik

texts.en: Astkhik is 23 years old, married and lives with her husband, three-year-old son and parents-in-law. She is unemployed and decided to start her own business in order to generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, allows her to get a loan of 4,000 GEL. With this credit, she will be able to buy clothes at wholesale prices and resell them for a higher price. This will give her a chance to generate stable income and improve her son's living conditions.

loans.use: to go into the business of selling clothing.

loans.name: Batma

texts.ru: Батма, 45 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей, самому младшему 20 лет. В поиске источника доходов для своей семьи, Батма стала заниматься животноводством. Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе, Батма стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на содержание семьи и воспитание детей. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Батмы имеется 4 коровы, 10 овец. Батма обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку коровы. Доходы от кредита Батма планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Batma is a 45-year-old widow and the mother of three children.  Her youngest child is 20.  In order to provide a source of income for her family, Batma became involved in animal husbandry.  Thanks to her very hard labor and tireless work, she began to make a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS).  However, this amount of money is not enough to support her family and educate her children.  Batma currently has four cows and 10 sheep on her farm.  She has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) which she will use to buy a cow.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further develop her farming business and to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and boost her income.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
A 51-year-old Palestinian Refugee, this is Khalil, a hardworking married father of six children. Khalil is his family's sole earner and is working hard to provide them with the necessary living needs. He is working hard to provide them with the best education, and wants to make sure they can benefit from a brighter future.

To cover his family's increasing living needs, Khalil works at two different businesses. He works in a construction business as a builder, and at the same time in an agriculture business as a farmer with 25 years of experience in this domain.

Farming needs a lot of care and hard work, and since we are in the best farming season, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary seeds in addition to requested agricultural fertilizers.

This is his third loan benefited from Al Majmoua. Through his previously acquired loan, he did the necessary maintenance to his land's irrigating system.

He hopes to stay capable of developing his family's life as much as he can.

loans.use: to buy necessary seeds in addition to requested agricultural fertilizers.

loans.name: G.s La Estrella Group

texts.es:
La Señora  Ester con 40 años de edad,  vive con su esposo, y tiene 3 hijos que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace 5 años, al negocio de cría y engorde de cerdos, la mayoría de sus clientes son de Choluteca, su negocio es  administrado por ella y su esposo. 
Doña Ester con el crédito que está solicitando lo necesita para la compra de Cerdos. espera que con esta inversión su negocio crezca y asi tener más producto para ofrecer a sus clientes. Esta solicitando el préstamo de forma grupal.

Doña Lucidalia se dedica a la venta de cerdos desde hace varios años.
Doña Tirsia se dedica a la venta de tortillas  desde hace varios años.
Doña Oneyda  se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos y también tiene siembra de palos de papaya.    
 
Choluteca, Honduras  –  Septiembre  del 2015
texts.en:
Ester is 40 years old, lives with her husband, and has three dependent children.

For the past five years Ester's occupation has been raising and fattening pigs. She runs her business with her husbandand most of their customers are from Choluteca.
Esther plans to buy pigs with the loan she is requesting. She hopes that her business will grow and that she will be able to offer more product to her customers. She is asking for the loan as part of a group.

The members are: Lucidalia, who sells pigs since some years ago; Tirsia, who has been selling tortillas for several years; and Oneyda, who buys and sells pigs and also grows papaya.

Choluteca, Honduras - September 2015

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys con 28 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Nueva Arica,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú,en una zona rural.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Gladys se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como gallos, pollos, gallinas, pavos, patos, cerdos, etc; con más de 05 años de experiencia en el negocio,su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales como pollos,pavos,cerdos,etc, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio.De esta manera piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los habitantes de la zona.

Gladys es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Gladys is 28 years old, she lives with her life partner and her children in a rural area of Nueva Arica, a district of the Chiclayo province in the Peruvian department of Lambayeque. The people living in this area mainly engage in agriculture, retail and cattle raising.

Gladys engages in breeding animals such as chickens, hens, turkeys, ducks and pigs, and she has been engaging in this activity for more than 5 years. She works in her own house. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals: this investment will allow her to stock a wider variety of animals and will help her reach a higher productivity rate, thus greatly improving her activity. She wants to increase her STOCK of animals in order to comply with the different tastes and necessities of those living in her area.

Gladys is a regular member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more animals like chickens, turkeys, pigs, etc.

loans.name: Aizhamal

texts.ru: Айжамал, 58 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она уже 35 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Айжамал, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 коровы, 20 овец и лошадь. Также есть земельный надел мерою 4,8 ГА, где Айжамал выращивает перец, пшеницу, ячмень и клевер. Ежемесячный совокупный доход Айжамал и ее семьи составляет около 24,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 дойных коров для увеличения объемов реализации молока и одной лошади. Айжамал намерена увеличить поголовье скота, что позволит ей накопить средства на развитие ее бизнеса и покупку бытовой техники.
texts.en: Aizhamal is 58 years old, married and a mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 35 years. Thanks to Aizhamal's persistence, drive and hard work, today she has 2 cows, 20 sheep and a horse. She also has 4.8 hectares of land, where she grows peppers, wheat, barley and clover. Aizhamal's and her family's combined monthly income amounts to about 24,000 som (KGS). She requested a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy 2 dairy cows and one horse in order to increase milk volumes. Aizhamal intends to increase her livestock headcount, which will allow her to save money for business development and purchase of consumer electronics.

loans.use: to buy 2 dairy cows and one horse in order to increase milk volumes

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es:
Agustín con 37 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia, junto a su cónyuge y sus hijos, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,país Perú. Agustín cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería..

Agustín se dedica a la venta de alfalfa en esta misma zona de Cayaltí, con una experiencia desde hace más de 15 años en el negocio. Así mismo cuenta con su propio terreno agrícola que el mismo siembra. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de alfalfa, para que de esta manera el volumen de sus ventas aumente, y esto le generará mayores ingresos.

Agustín no cuenta con experiencia crediticia, para Edpyme Alternativa es su primer crédito.
texts.en:
Agustín is 37 years old and lives in common-law in his own house, with his live-in partner and their children, in the district of Cayalti, province of Chiclayo, Peru. 

Agustín has very good personal and business references from the residents in the area. The people in this region work mainly in agriculture, commerce and cattle farming. 

Agustín sells alfalfa in this same area of Cayalti, with more than 15 years of experience in the business. Likewise, he possesses his own farmland, which he sows himself. 

He is requesting a loan to buy a bigger amount of alfalfa, thus will increase sells, and therefore generate more income. 

Agustín has not requested a loan before and it is his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of alfalfa.

loans.name: Rysbu

texts.ru: Рысбу, 34 года, мать 4 детей. У Рысбу среднее образование, на протяжении 6 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством, у нее развитое хозяйство. У Рысбу есть корова, 4 лошади. На 0,36 Га собственной и 0,64 Га арендованной земли Рысбу выращивает клевер. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет около 9,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рысбу обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку двух бычков для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы Рысбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение ее бизнеса и постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en:
Rysbu is the 34-year-old mother of four children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture and animal husbandry for the past six years.  She has a well developed farming business which comprises one cow and four horses.  She also grows clover on 0.36 hectares of her own land and 0.64 hectares of leased land.  She makes a monthly income of about 9,000 som (KGS).

Eager to further develop her farming business, Rysbu has turned to Kiva's partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two young bulls for fattening and resale.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her farming business and to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy two calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a married man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Ahmad has a stall in the city where he sells fruit and vegetables . It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of the latest conflict. Ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new inventory (fruit and vegetables) to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales and customers, and eventually save enough income to cover school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy a new inventory (fruit and vegetables) to sell at his stall.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL SAGRADO CORAZÓN DE JESUS ESTA CONFORMADA POR DOCE INTEGRANTES MADRES SOLTERAS ORIGINARIAS DE TELICA CON VEINTE HIJOS MENORES DE EDAD, LOS CUALES ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO, SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORAS, RESPONSABLES CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL EN LA ACTUALIDAD LUCHAN DIA A DIA PARA SACARA ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS, Y SUS DIFERENTES ACTIVIDADES ECONÓMICAS, Y BRINDARLES A SUS HIJOS LA ESTABILIDAD ECONÓMICA Y EMOCIONAL QUE NECESITAN.

GRACIA A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA COORDINADORA, ES MARÍA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONÓMICA UNA PULPERIA ES UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA QUE VENDE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES COMO: ARROZ, FRIJOLES, AZÚCAR, LECHE, PAN, HUEVOS, FRIJOLES, DETERGENTES, HUEVOS, QUESO, FÓSFOROS, JUGOS, GALLETAS, GASEOSAS ETC. EL NEGOCIO LO TIENE UBICADO EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y EL TIEMPO QUE DEDICA A SU NEGOCIOS ES DE UNAS DOCE HORAS DIARIAS PARA SATISFACER LA CLIENTELA Y QUE UN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS. EL OBJETIVO DEL CRÉDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO EN LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES. LA ASOCIACIÓN COMUNAL SAGRADO CORAZÓN DE JESUS AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAÍSES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The “Sagrado Corazón de Jésus” communal bank has twelve members. They are single mothers from Telica with twenty children between them. Their children are not yet of age and they are studying. The members are known for being hard-working and responsible, with the desire to get ahead in life. They currently struggle each day to support their children, get ahead with their work, and give their children the economic and emotional stability that they need.

The coordinator’s name is Maria and she has a grocery store. It is a small store that sells various products, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, beans, detergent, cheese, matches, juice, cookies, and soft drinks. The business is located in her home and she spends around twelve hours a day working in her business in order to meet the needs of her customers. By doing this, she hopes that she will be able to obtain greater earnings in the not-too-distant future. She will use the loan for working capital to buy food products.

The “Sagrado Corazón de Jésus” communal bank is grateful for the help that Kiva investors offer to people with limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have decent work.

loans.use: to restock her grocery store with products, such as rice, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juice, cheese, matches, and beans

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with four children, one of whom attends school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past six years, selling goat meat to the neighbours. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business from other operators.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale.

loans.name: Maria Cecilia

texts.es:
MARIA TIENE 30 AÑOS, SOLTERA, TIENE UN HIJITO DE 9 AÑOS, VIVE CON LA MAMA, VIVE EN LA COMUNIDAD DE LARCALOMA, CANTON GUARANDA, PROVINCIA BOLIVAR. MARIA SE DEDICA A LA AGRICULTURA Y A LA SIEMBRA DE PAPAS, HABAS, ARBEJA, OCAS Y MAIZ, ADEMAS A LA CRIANZA DE CUYES Y VACAS.MEDIANTE ESTE CREDITO PRETENDE COMPRAR GANADO, Y OPTIMIZAR SU NIVEL DE ECONOMIA.

EL SEÑO DE MARIA ES DE CONSTRUIR SU CASA.

EN EL TIEMPO LIBRE SE DEDICA A TEJER PRENDAS DE VESTIR PARA SU FRAMILIA.
texts.en:
Maria is a 30 year old single mother who has a 9 year old little boy and lives with her mother in Larcaloma community of the Guaranda canton in the state of Bolivar.

Maria earns a living in agriculture by growing, potatoes, beans, peas, ocas (type of root vegetable), corn and she also rears guinea pigs and cattle. With this loan she hopes buy cattle and improve her economic situation.

Maria's dream is to build her own home and in her spare time she likes to make clothing for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Restus

texts.en: Restus is 46 years old, married and the father of six children. For the last four years, he has supported his family by running a bakery. After successfully repaying his first loan, he is requesting a new one from VisionFund Kenya. He will use this loan to buy more equipment such as baking trays so that he can bake more bread and cakes to sell. This will increase his income and allow him to educate his children. His goal for the future is to to own a big bakery and make more income to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: increase his income by buying equipment to bake more bread and cakes to sell.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman with seven kids, two of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mbeyu operates a grocery and vegetables-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of competition and transportation in her place of operation.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a maize farmer from Kyasge village. As a member of Babban Gona, Anthony is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Anthony would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Anthony can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Anthony is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and, in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to buy maize-grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell his maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mubarak

texts.ru: Мубарак, 50 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, по характеру, ответственная, доброжелательная, любезная, вежливая. Мубарак занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду, ее деятельность приносит около 27,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 7 овец. Все накопленные средства стараются вкладывать в развитие бизнеса, в этом году Мубарак решила отремонтировать свой дом, поэтому она и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов: печи, досок, двери и прочего. Доходы Мубарак планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Mubarak is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a secondary education and is responsible, kind, and polite person. Mubarak is involved in agriculture. Thanks to her hard work, her business yields about 27,000 som (KGS) per month. Her farm contains 4 cows and 7 sheep. She tries to invest all of her savings into developing the business. This year, Mubarak decided to repair her house and requested a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) from the Bai Tushum Bank to buy construction materials, such as wood, doors, oven and the like. Mubarak plans to invest her earnings into further growing her business and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as wood, doors, oven and the like, in order to repair her house

loans.name: Nelie

texts.fr: Nelie a 31 ans. Elle vit avec son compagnon et leur enfant à Léogane, une commune située à quelques kilomètres de la capitale Port-au-Prince. Pour générer des revenus et répondre aux besoins de la famille, elle a ouvert une boutique de produits alimentaires. Elle souhaite ajouter un rayon de produits cosmétiques dans sa boutique et elle demande un microcrédit pour réaliser ce projet.
texts.en: Nelie is 31.  She lives with her partner and her child in Léogane, a commune located a few kilometers away from Port-au-Prince, the capital city.  In order to have an income and to meet the needs of her family, she has opened a small grocery store.  She would like to expand and add cosmetic products to her shop, so she's taking a micro-loan to achieve this project.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 35-year-old married man from Hebron city, located in the West Bank. He lives with his family in a small house. Because it’s difficult to find a job in the West Bank, he wanted to open his own business, which is a mobile phone store, as he has experience from his previous job selling mobiles and providing maintenance, and he has an entrepreneurial spirit.

In order to get started, Bilal took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy mobile phones and accessories to resell in his new store. This will make him independent.

Bilal appears in the photo in his new store.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories to resell in his new store

loans.name: Silvia Noemy

texts.es:
Silvia de 41 años de edad, estudió secretariado, es madre soltera de tres hijos que se encuentran estudiando.


Silvia ya tiene nueve años de trabajar en un laboratorio clínico, ella se decidió a trabajar debido a que es madre soltera y sus hijos van creciendo y necesitan educación.


El préstamo lo utilizará para cubrir gastos universitario de uno de sus hijos y comprará productos de belleza para vender.

El sueño de Silvia es siempre darles lo mejor a sus hijos, que estudien y siempre mantener su empleo.
texts.en:
Silvia is 41 years old. She studied to be a secretary. She is the single mother of three children who are studying.

Silvia has been working in a clinical laboratory for nine years. She decided to work being a single mother with her children growing and needing education.

She will use the loan to cover university expenses for one of her children and buy beauty products to sell.

Silvia's dream is to always provide the best for her children, that they study and that she keeps working.

loans.use: to cover university expenses for one of her children and buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees .

For over seven years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is 44 years old, married and blessed with four children. She earns a living by raising poultry to sell. Her business has been profitable and she is now requesting her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to increase her income by buying more chickens to raise and sell. She will use money she expects to earn to educate her children and expand her business. Her goals for the future are to own a larger business and earn more money provide her family with a good life.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel feels that the cost of cooking gas has gone up and this has made him go for a renewable source of energy, which will help him save some money and also reduce the number of trees he used to cut down in search of firewood.

loans.use: To buy a bio-digester for clean renewable cooking

loans.name: Kwa Kakinya S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Janet. She is a member of Kwa Kakinya SHG. She is thirty-seven years old and married with three children.

Janet practices mixed farming: maize, beans, and poultry farming. She has greatly benefited from the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa's enterprise development training, and is hence able to commercialize her farming activities.

Janet is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizers and pesticides, to boost her farming business for increased income. This will enable her to cater for her family's needs, such as clothing and food.

Janet is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and pesticides, and hence boost her farming business for increased income.

loans.name: Vololonirina

texts.fr:
Vololonirina a 43 ans. Elle est mère célibataire et a deux enfants (19-12 ans)  dont  l’aîné suit ses études  à l’université, le cadet en classe de cinquième dans une école privée. 
Vololonirina a travaillé dans une entreprise franche. Elle exerce l’activité de vente de friperies depuis 2010.  Le développement d’une telle activité nécessite de l'expérience : connaissance des besoins des clients , choix de la qualité des produits, diversification des produits (tendances) . Les revenus tirés de l’activité lui ont permis d’éduquer les enfants.
L’un de ses enfants vit avec sa grand-mère. Elle vit dans une maison louée avec son enfant. Son projet est  d’accumuler des fonds et de devenir grossiste et construire une maison.
texts.en:
Vololonirina is 43.  She is a single mother with two children (19 and 12 years old).  The oldest is a university student while the youngest is currently in 7th grade in a private school.

Vololonirina used to work for a free zone company.  She has now been selling second-hand clothes since 2010.  It takes experience to develop such a business:  Vololonirina had to familiarize herself with her customers' needs, she had to learn how to select the right merchandise, diversify her goods (depending on the current fashion...).  Thanks to the income she makes from this activity, she has been able to send her children to school.

One of Vololonirina's children lives with his grandmother.  Vololonirina herself lives in a rented house with her other child.  Her goal is to accumulate funds, become a wholesaler and build a house.

loans.use: to buy second-hand pants.

loans.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 55-year-old divorced mother of six children and a Palestinian refugee. Twenty one years ago, she started tailoring to cover the needs and expenses of her beloved children. She is their only breadwinner. She is well-known in her region for her professional skills in this domain.

Huda is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business and buy threads which are very essential for her business.

Huda hopes to keep on expanding her business to increase her income and improve her children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy threads, which are very essential for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with eight children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She wants to see all her children go to school and this makes her work hard on her cocoa plantation for eight hours a day. Having adventured in this business for three years, she has realized that farming is doing better for her family's standard of living and she decided to embark on cocoa growing and selling. This business is the major economic activity in this area and out of it, parents have gotten the freedom to educate their children. She dreams of expanding her cocoa selling to big cocoa agents, though unpredictable weather changes limit her plans. She is asking for a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Manessa Group

texts.en:
Rima is the featured borrower in the Manessa Group. She is standing at the far right of the picture. Nahed is at the far left side, and Majeda is in the middle.

Rima and her fellow members decided to request this Al Majmoua group loan because they have always been neighbours and friends and they are working hard to develop their businesses and manage their living expenses at the same time.

Rima, 43, is a married mother of two who started working as a tutor from her house six years ago to support her beloved husband, who works abroad to cover the family's increasing living expenses. Rima works hard to provide her family with better living conditions, especially with an education for her children. Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva's field Partner Al Majmoua to pay the tuition fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her children.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
Pedro works as a driver, He is a divorced man. He got divorced two years ago. Pedro is the father of two daughters. Pedro is living alone and he pays rent, although he supports his daughters.

Pedro needs a loan to pay the rent of a new place, where he will live with his daughters. Pedro hopes you can help him because he loves his family a lot.

loans.use: to pay the rent of a new place, where he will live with his daughters.

loans.name: Valerio

texts.en:
Valerio is 55 years old and married, with four children, all of whom attend school. She is currently dealing in both cocoa farming and getting additional income from selling locally manufactured bread and cassava. She lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda with her family, whose dependency rests on the proceeds from Valerio's business.

Valerio is encouraged to educate her children with high hopes of attaining a minimum qualification and she believes that, in the future, they will be able to take care of her after her retirement. She also is providing for their basic needs, but faces a challenge of limited capital and the fact that the business is seasonal.

Valerio has requested a loan to add capital to her business, which will enable her to pay school fees for her children. Valerio will use the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Lun's Group

texts.en: Lun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Lun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as tailor to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is married and has four children, none of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nyamvula operates a charcoal selling business from home. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a challenge of transportation in her business.

With this loan for 10,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Muthike

texts.en:
Muthike is 43 years old. She is married and blessed with 5 children. 

Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 12 years. She earns a monthly income of KES. 25,000

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds to improve her crop production. 

She will use the profits from expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to a better business and a happy family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs of fertilizer and seeds to improve her crop production.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
As a parent of six children, Esther works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Esther is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Esther has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a mother of five children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in buying and selling of general merchandise. Esther also gets additional income from selling cocoa from her garden.

She started the business to raise school fees for her children, being a loving parent who would love to see her children graduate. She works hard and has plans to expand the retail business, but lacks enough capital to do so.

She hopes to expand both cocoa and retail business, and is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, such as sweets, bread and cakes among others, to resell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, such as sweets, bread and cakes among others, to resell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell coconut wine.  Lorna is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, meat, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as, meat, spices, etc.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 49 years old and has six children. Amy is married and has three children are currently in school.

Amy is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Amy requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Amy has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Amy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Buntheoun's Group

texts.en: Buntheoun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Buntheoun makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Jose Leonidas

texts.es:
José de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta 7º grado, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja de enfermera en un hospital nacional, tienen una hija de siete años y viven en casa familiar.

José se dedica a ayudante de albañil, pero actualmente se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa, lo inició debido a que no 
hay mucho trabajo de albañilería,su esposa le apoya los fines de semana de modo que salen adelante juntos.

 
José solicita este préstamo para comprar  blusas, toallas, calzonetas, etc. para vender de esa manera siempre tendrá buenos ingresos económicos y podrá  ayudarle a su esposa para los gastos de la casa.

El sueño de José es que su hija viva en mejores condiciones de vida y que estudie, y algún día poder comprar un terreno para construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old and studied up to Grade 7. He is in a relationship and his partner works as a nurse in a National hospital. He has a 7 year old daughter and they live in the family house.

José works as an assistant bricklayer. Currently he is working selling clothing which he started as there wasn't much work in bricklaying. His wife helps him on the weekends so they get ahead together.

José is requesting this loan to buy blouses, towels, bathing suits, etc to sell. Doing this he will always have good economic income and be able to help his wife with the household expenses.

José's dream is for his daughter to live in better living conditions and studies. One day he wants to buy land to build his own house.

loans.use: to buy blouses, towels. bathing suits, etc.

loans.name: Blessing Group

texts.en:
The above women make up the Blessing group. These ladies believe in the motto: “Do not think that someone else is more blessed than you are.
