It’s just that we are blessed in different ways.” It is with this realization that these women are grateful for the little businesses they are doing, and are willing to work hard to make themselves more successful.
 
In this group we have Idah, who is in her early 60s. Idah is a very dedicated business woman who has been the center of motivation to all her group members despite her age. Idah, far left in the photo, started a business in 1993 as a cross-border trader, but she changed the business due to the double tragedy of losing her husband in early 2000s and her daughter. 

She was left to be her family’s breadwinner and guardian to the children left behind by her late daughter. Despite these unfortunate events, Idah was looking for the blessing in every situation; she could not give up. As she progressed in age, Idah could not keep up with the cross-border trading, instead, she began going to different places, selling and doing barter trade. She has become a master at this. 

Over the years, she has build relationships with many Harare downtown traders. Once a week, she buys a lot of Chinese merchandise and travels to rural and remote areas for resale. She and her other group members joined Thrive seeking financial assistance and training so that they can grow their businesses.

Idah wants a loan from Thrive to buy clothes and many groceries to resell in rural areas, so that she can help her grandchild to sail through the university life, especially these last years of his academic life.

loans.use: to buy clothes and many groceries to resell in rural areas.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a maize farmer from Chiroma village. As a member of Babban Gona, Daniel is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. Before joining Babban Gona, Daniel would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Daniel can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Daniel is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sumomei Group

texts.en:
Flora is a member of the Sumomei group and lives in Chorkor. She is a single parent with two children, both go to school.

Flora has been selling firewood and pure water for eight years on wholesale basis. This is her third loan cycle with ID-Ghana, and she will use the funds to increase and boost her capital. She plans to buy a large supply of firewood and pure water to resell, which will bolster her revenue.

In the coming years, she would like to buy some land and continue to support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a large supply of firewood and pure water to resell.

loans.name: Markus

texts.en:
Markus is a maize farmer from Kunda village. As a Babban Gona member, Markus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Markus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Markus can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Markus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Markus hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 55 years old and makes money by selling personal products, such as shampoos, lotions, perfumes, and soaps. 

She needs a loan to buy more personal products for her business. Barbara has two kids to feed and pays rent. She has to go to many places to sell the products, so she hopes you can help her.

loans.use: to buy more personal products for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 28-year-old married father of two, and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low financial situation of Palestinians in Lebanon, he left school at an early age, and started working in the construction field ten years ago to cover the needs and expenses of his children.

Mohammad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua, to improve his family's living conditions inside the camp through building an additional room.

Mohammad hopes to expand his business more in the future, to increase his income and stay capable of providing his family descent living conditions.

loans.use: to improve his family's living conditions inside the camp through building an additional room.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a 40-year-old married mother of two. Two years ago, she got employed to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady whose family is her priority. Sonia's limited salary is not providing her with enough to meet any additional expenses, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. Sonia hopes to open her own business in the future to increase her income and to be  capable of providing her family with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Flora Elsa

texts.es:
Flora es una mujer de sesenta y un años de edad, que se ha dedicado a trabajar duro toda su vida, es honesta y carismática, después de retirarse laboralmente, para ella fue difícil no hacer nada por eso recordó su habilidad para vender mercadería, con la ayuda de sus hijas comenzó a ofertar en su vecindario, iglesia y entre sus conocidos productos como ropa, sandalias y prendas de plata, convirtiéndose en una comerciante en crecimiento. 
En estos momentos, esta emprendedora mujer, ha recurrido a un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito para comprar nuevas prendas, sandalias, blusas, accesorios, perfumes, maquillaje entre otros productos, dado que su clientela ha crecido y en esta temporada del año sus ventas se vuelven muy pronunciadas. En un futuro planea montar en su casa de habitación una tienda con maniquís, espejos y armarios.
texts.en:
Flora is a 71-year-old woman who has dedicated herself to working hard all her life. She is honest and charismatic. After she retired from the workforce, it was difficult for her to do nothing, and thus she remembered her skill for selling merchandise. With the help of her daughters, she started to offer products in her neighborhood, at church and among her friends, such as clothing, sandals, and silver items, and her business started to grow.

At present, this enterprising woman has applied for a Kiva loan through MiCrédito to buy new garments, sandals, blouses, accessories, perfumes, and makeup, among other products, since her customer base has grown, and at this time of year her sales become very strong. In the future, she wants to set up a shop in her home with mannequins, mirrors and display racks.

loans.use: to buy new garments, sandals, blouses, accessories, perfumes, and makeup, among other products.

loans.name: Cremora Group

texts.en:
The above ladies make up the Cremora Group, a group that has seen growth in their businesses as a result of the mutual friendship they have formed. The group has 2 youthful ladies and one mother figure who is the center of guidance to all members. The ladies have been friends for 7 years encouraging each other in their different businesses. Maideyi, the group’s chairperson, notes that their friendship has indeed been a pillar of strength for her.

Maideyi is a cross-border trader and she started her business in 2013. She goes to South Africa and sometimes to Zambia. Back then, however, Maideyi was not a consistent business woman. She relied mostly on her husband, but her reliance soon faded after he left her for another woman. This is when reality struck. Suddenly she was all alone with 3 children to fend for.

Maideyi is grateful to her group members who helped her to pick herself up. She resumed crossing the border to South Africa more frequently. She also opened a small flea market stall to sell her products, so she is steadily growing. She sells jewellery, cosmetics, household accessories and other small items. These are low margin products meaning that her profits are small unless she moves volumes.

Maideyi started facing problems when she was unable to restock as much as she wanted due to lack of capital. This is because her low profits mean, over time, she drains her capital when she makes withdrawals. This is when her friends invited her to join Thrive to receive business and financial literacy training.

Maideyi had this to say about her fellow members, “Just one great partnership with the right person can have an incredible impact on your business success.”

Maideyi wants to take a loan from Thrive to increase the range of household products she has for sale. She is thankful for the training from Thrive which has left her a changed business woman.

loans.use: to increase the range of household products she offers for sale.

loans.name: Vashandi Group

texts.en:
Vashandi means “Hardworkers.” These women believe that all the roads that lead to success have to pass through the hard-work highway at some point.

One member of the group, Tambudzai, is a 40-year-old multi-business lady who is very ambitious. She breeds and sells chickens at the back of her yard, makes soap detergents, and also has a garden in which she grows vegetables that she sells to earn a living. Although she has a certificate in marketing, due to economic constraints in Zimbabwe, she has struggled to find formal work, so she has decided to earn a living from working on her own using her skills that she acquired from marketing classes.

Tambudzai’s husband has been unemployed for ten years; this has forced her to become the family’s breadwinner. She has three school-going children who heavily depend on her. Although her husband gets small jobs here and there, the remuneration is not sustainable. This is the reason why Tambudzai and her other three friends joined Thrive Microfinance in September 2015. With a loan from Thrive, the hardworking women can further grow their businesses and improve their financial literacy through Thrive trainings.

Tambudzai is planning to use her loan to boost her business through restocking a larger batch of chickens, as well as extending her fowl run and producing detergents in larger volumes.

loans.use: to boost her business through restocking a larger batch of chickens, as well as extending her fowl run and producing detergents in larger volumes.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a resident of Ruhaama in Ntungamo. He practices banana plantation farming which helps him to pay for the school fees for his 3 children.

Julius has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 from UGAFODE to buy mulches so he can improve his plantation and continue supporting his family. He is requesting support from Kiva funders since this will increase his output and sales in the long-run.

Julius looks towrad a point when he will be the biggest supplier of bananas in the area.

loans.use: to buy mulch to improve his plantation.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
Unity Group, as it is called, is a hardworking group that works so hard to achieve their purposeful goals. They can be found in the locality of Chorkor in the Greater Accra region of Ghana.

Susana is the group's representative, a highly industrious woman who works so hard to sustain her business. She is not yet married and has no kids.

Susana is in her 6th year of selling of food stuffs; her hardworking attitude has earned her many customers. Due to an increase in buyers, she is seeking a loan to renovate her business by enlarging her tent so she can accommodate her customers.

Susana expresses her gratitude to ID Ghana for the improvement of her business and is very willing to repay her loan as planed.

loans.use: to renovate her business by enlarging her tent so she can accommodate customers.

loans.name: María Noemy

texts.es:
María estudió licenciatura en ciencias de la educación, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la alcaldía municipal, tienen tres hijos, dos residen en Estados Unidos y el otro está estudiando en la universidad.

María trabaja en una escuela de maestra, ya tiene once años de dedicarse a este trabajo trabaja de lunes a viernes y 
los fines de semana se dedica a costurar vestidos y faldas sábado y domingo.


El préstamo lo utilizará para cubrir gastos universitarios de su hijo y para comprar materiales de confección, de esa manera logrará mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

María tiene como objetivo que su hijo termine el estudio y que consiga trabajo luego y tener las fuerzas necesarias para seguir trabajando y seguir apoyando a su hijo.
texts.en:
María studied for her education sciences degree. She is married and her husband works in the town mayor´s office. They have 3 children, 2 live in the United States and the other is studying in university.

María works in a teachers´ school. She has already been earning a living in this work for 11 years, working Monday to Friday.

On weekends (Saturdays and Sundays), she dedicates herself to sewing dresses and skirts.

She will use this loan to cover her son´s university expenses and to buy dressmaking materials. In this way, she will manage to improve her family´s quality of life.

María has a goal that her son may finish his education and that then he may get work. And that she may have the necessary strength to continue working and supporting her child.

loans.use: to cover her child's university expenses and to buy dressmaking materials.

loans.name: Bridgeview Group

texts.en:
Dorica is a 35-year-oldwoman (wearing a yellow top in the picture). She is a member of the Bridgeview Group which comprises of five ladies who are striving for the best in their business. Amongst these five members of the group, three of them are into dressmaking business at a local shopping centre whilst the other member is in the same trade with Dorica of procuring clothes and footwear from South Africa, which she resells at her flea markets.

Dorica travels on a monthly basis to South Africa for procurement. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She is a mother of five with two other dependents; this business is enabling her to take care of her family, coupled with the help from her husband who is also self-employed.

They got their first loan from Thrive in June with a four month term and repaid superbly. She is confident that the financial literacy training she received from Thrive Microfinance will help her to improve her business. Her business has been generally performing well but she was failing to sell some profitable products at her flea market because of lack of capital. Now the group is applying for a second loan of $2150 to stock for the festive season, which is a period of great opportunities. She plans to open another table in that period with a wider range of stock and will take on an employee.

loans.use: to open another table in the run-up to Christmas with a wider range of stock

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thanking Kiva and its supporters and CCT for their tireless support for small business men like her. The loans which were granted to her were a great help to grow and sustain her ornamental business. She trusts for your continuous help on her livelihood.

Once again she would like to request for a loan in the amount of Php 19000 loan to buy fertilizer, garden soil, pots, nets, various seedlings to grow a variety of ornamental. Erlinda puts her whole heart to protect her farm from various insects that could damage her plants as this is her source of income to cover their personal and household needs.

Erlinda prays for her plants to grow big and healthy and that God would bless her children and their families abundantly. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ana Joy

texts.en:
Ana Joy previously took a loan which financed her beauty salon through the purchase of beauty supplies. She thanks God for Kiva and CCT for using them as instruments to assist small businesses like hers. She is thankful that she was able to also start a small general store to augment her income and better meet their daily needs.

Ana Joy trusts she can now request a 20,000 PHP loan to buy instant noodles, canned goods, bread, biscuits, cooking oil, eggs, beverages to sell at her store, as well as some beauty supplies for her salon. Her charming and positive personality makes people come to her store and salon.

Ana Joy dreams of having a bigger salon and store so she can send her child to college. She hopes to own a house someday as well. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and some beauty supplies.

loans.name: Brenda Yamyna

texts.es:
Brenda es una mujer luchadora que desde los veinticinco años de edad, dejo la casa de sus padres y comenzó a trabajar duro, luego se casó y tuvo tres hijos, los cuales son su principal fuente de motivación. Ella actualmente labora en una empresa privada como conserje, además hace trabajos extras, todo para poder ofrecerle a su familia una buena calidad de vida. 
En busca de darle a sus seres queridos lo mejor, ella ha recurrido a un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, para la construcción y conexión de un servicio higiénico completo, dado que hasta ahora sigue usando letrina, lo que atenta grandemente contra la salud de todos los miembros de su hogar. En un futuro y con mucho trabajo ella planea ir mejorando toda la infraestructura de su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Brenda is a determined woman who left her parents' home at the age of 25 and began working hard. Later she got married and had three children, who are her main source of motivation. Currently, she works for a private company as a custodian, and she also does extra work. She does all of this in order to offer her family a good quality of life.

In an effort to provide the best for her loved ones, she has applied for a Kiva loan through MiCrédito, to build and connect a complete water and sewer system. Up to now, they have been using a latrine, which poses serious health risks to all members of her household. In the future, with much work, she plans to continue improving all of the infrastructure of the house where she lives.

loans.use: to build and connect a complete water and sewer system for her home.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
Esperanza, es una mujer que se dedica al comercio y producción de alimentos a base de maíz. Mucho esfuerzo y perseverancia a lo largo de 20 años, ha hecho que el negocio de Esperanza crezca. Actualmente, Esperanza posee un puesto en el mercado municipal, el cual, con ayuda de préstamos pasados ha logrado abastecer poco a poco.
Este nuevo préstamo, que Esperanza solicita planea invertirlo en su negocio, mediante la compra de granos básicos, detergente, papel sanitario, jabones y otros productos más, los que le ayudaran a la diversificación de sus productos y al crecimiento del negocio, al que planea seguirle invirtiendo todo su tiempo y dinero.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a woman who works selling and producing corn-based foods. Through much effort and perseverance over 20 years, Esperanza has made her business grow. Esperanza currently has a stall in the municipal market, and little by little, through the help of past loans, she has been able to stock it.

Esperanza plans to invest this new loan in her business by buying staple grains, detergent, toilet paper, soap, and other products. This will help her to diversify her products and grow her business. She plans to continue investing all her time and money in her business.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, detergent, toilet paper, soap, and other products.

loans.name: Sale

texts.en:
Sale is a maize farmer from Dogon Juri village. As a Babban Gona member, Sale is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Sale would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Sale can to store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Sale no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Sale hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Awurade Beye Group

texts.en:
This group was created in Aggege within the locality of Chorkor in the greater Accra region of Ghana. It is composed of three women from the same neighborhood who are united by good social and professional ties.

Grace is the group’s representative. She is a married mother of four children (a girl and three boys).

She is active in the sales of powder and shea-butter. With her new loan, she is going to purchase more items, which she is going to sell at the market in her town. She has good experience in this domain for having worked at it for 14 years now. The profits earned will enable her to meet food needs and to bolster her capital.

Due to her loyal attitude of repayment loans,Grace will be very glad if her need are met.

loans.use: to purchase more items, which she is going to sell at the market in her town.

loans.name: Juan Rosa

texts.es: Juan es un hombre de 53 años que vive junto a su pareja y su hijo en la localidad rural de Lancaroya, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él trabaja como obrero y también se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para comprar abonos orgánicos y pagar a los trabajadores para realizar la preparación de su terreno agrícola para sembrar alfalfa orgánica, y también para poder comprar cuatro reses orgánicas, espera que su carne sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y  brindarles estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Juan is a 53-year-old man who lives with his spouse and son in the rural settlement of Lancaroya, which is located in Arequipa. He works as a laborer, and he also dedicates himself to farming and raising cattle organically. He always pays close attention to the care and feed he provides, which consists of the organic alfalfa he grows.

He is requesting this microloan to buy organic soil amendments and to pay for laborers to prepare his plot of land to plant organic alfalfa, and also so that he can buy four organically raised cows. He hopes that he will be able to sell their meat at a better price because they are organic. In the future, he hopes to be able to improve his family's living conditions and provide them with economic stability.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments to prepare the field where he will grow organic alfalfa, and to buy four organically raised cows.

loans.name: Sreynich

texts.en:
Sreynich is a 19-year-old, single freshman who is from Kampot Province in Cambodia. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Accounting at a university in the city. Her father is a construction foreman and her mother is a homemaker.

Due to the fact that Sreynich is short of the finances needed to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and successfully earn her bachelor’s degree.

Sreynich dreams of finding a proper job with a decent salary, and she also wants to save money to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from the first to the fourth year.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Her name is Adelfa, aged 48, from the province of General Trias, Cavite, Philippines. She has three children: one attends college, one is in high school and one is an elementary student. Being a single parent is her biggest challenge, but with her faith in God and hard work, she is doing a good job of raising her children.

Adelfa has been running her general store for twelve years already which helps a lot with their daily needs. Her positive outlook and pleasant personality make people want to patronize her store.

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan to fill her small store with essential food items such as rice, biscuits, canned goods, chips, instant noodles, eggs, oil and toiletries.

Adelfa's precious dream is to see all her children become professionals. She aims to look for more means of income to better provide for her children. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Rosaria

texts.es: Rosaria es una mujer trabajadora de 30 años que vive en la localidad rural de Callalli, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Ella trabaja como obrera agrícola y además se dedica al pastoreo de ganado y a la cría de alpacas orgánicas, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar cinco alpacas orgánicas para recría. En el futuro espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Rosaria is a hardworking 30-year-old woman who lives in the rural area of Callalli, which is in Arequipa. She is an agricultural laborer and she also works as a shepherd and raises organic alpacas. She always pays close attention to the care and nourishment she gives them.

She is requesting this microloan to be able to buy five organic alpacas to raise. In the future, she hopes to be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy five organic alpacas to raise.

loans.name: Sokeng

texts.en:
Sokeng is 19 years old, a student freshman, studying Chemistry. She is from the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Due to a lack of finances, Sokeng would like to request a loan to pay for her tuition fees for four years. This loan will help her graduate and achieve her dreams.

In the future, Sokeng wants to be a chemistry teacher at a high school, build a new proper house and if she has children, she wants her children to study to pursue bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition fees for four years, for a BSc. in Chemistry

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a native from Barili, Cebu. She earns a living by selling rtw(ready-to-wear), like shorts, foot wear and ladies apparel.
She also runs a sari-sari(variety) store, selling basic house hold commodities like noodles, sugar, edible oil, salt, shampoo, tooth paste, powdered milk, and beverages.
She is 37-year old married woman and has four children. Her husband's occupation is a driver.

Gina would like to improve her livelihood by acquiring additional funds to finance her current source of living.
She has requested a loan to purchase rtw (ready-to-wear), stocks for the store and to purchase goats. These could help boost her income and continue improve to become productive. Thus, she could able to finance the schooling of her children and provide them with nutritious diets.

Gina is thankful for the funds and she is looking forward to continue seek ways to become more efficient in handling livelihood to become more sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase rtw (ready-to-wear), stocks for the store and purchase livestock (goat)

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto is 55 years old married with 8 children, Roberto  owns and operates an agriculture business  planting and harvesting corn for sale. Roberto has been engaged in his business for many years and earns well from these activities. He had successfully repaid his previous loan used for farming supplies. His farm is still doing well and yet, he needs financial assistance to improve it. Recently, he took a new loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase good variety of seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Mern's Group

texts.en: Mern’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Mern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Chamreoun's Group

texts.en: Chamreoun’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Chamreoun makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer construction worker and security to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women​​ and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en: Pov ’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Pov  makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Esteban Narciso

texts.es: Esteban es un hombre trabajador de 60 años de edad que vive junto a su pareja en la localidad rural de Coporaque, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él trabaja como obrero agrícola y también se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo mucha atención en el cuidado y en su alimentación. Esteban actualmente gusta de cultivar papa orgánica, así pues, solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar semilla orgánica de papa y abonos orgánicos para poder preparar el terreno donde planea cultivar papa orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Esteban is a hardworking 60-year-old man who lives with his partner in the rural area of Coporaque, which is in Arequipa. He works as an agricultural laborer and he also works in agriculture and raises organic cows, paying close attention to their care and feeding.

Esteban currently enjoys growing organic potatoes, so he is requesting this microloan to be able to buy organic potato seed and organic fertilizers to prepare the soil where he plans to grow organic potatoes.

In the future, he hopes to be able to improve his family's living conditions and continue to enjoy good health. This is why he has gone organic.

loans.use: to buy organic potato seed and organic fertilizers to grow organic potatoes.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a widow with five children living in a three bedroom apartment with her five children in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some challenges in life, among which are the death of her husband, sickness, embarrassments from her in-laws and the misery of a polygamous marriage.

With the new loan, she will buy three trucks of fire wood and also pay for the splitting of the wood, because she has been doing it for a very long time now. Also she will buy piglets and feed for her pigs. She has a good site for her fire wood sales and also she has steady customers. More so, the villagers are very impressed, because their time will be saved by not having to go and find fire wood in the forest and can now buy it from the market.

With the profit from this loan, she will buy more fire wood, build her house, pay the children’s bills, and expand her business.

She prefer a loan from GHAPE because of its low interest, the loan will be paid in installments, low interest rates and the repayment duration is unstressful and also because of the non-financial services offer by the organization such as training and its social network.

loans.use: to buy firewood, piglets, feeds, .

loans.name: Julio Maximiliano

texts.es: Julio es un hombre de 62 años que vive junto a su esposa en la localidad rural de Piscopampa, que está ubicada en Arequipa. Él se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar dos vacas orgánicas, espera que su leche sea vendida a un mejor precio al ser orgánica. En el futuro espera poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.
texts.en:
Julio is a 62-year-old man who lives together with his wife in the rural town of Piscopampa, which is located in Arequipa. He earns a living in agriculture and breeding organic cattle. He always pays a lot of attention to the care and feed he provides them, made of organic alfalfa he grows.

He is requesting a micro loan to be able to buy 2 organic cows. He hopes that their milk may be sold at a better price for being organic.

In the future, he hopes to be able to improve his family's living conditions and to continue to have good health--the reason why he switched to organic.

loans.use: to buy 2 organic cows in order to sell the milk they produce and to increase his income.

loans.name: Karamat

texts.ru: Карамат, 56 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. Карамат имеет среднее образование, по характеру она спокойный и общительный человек, очень трудолюбивая. В поисках дополнительного источника дохода, 30 лет назад она начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Карамат приложила все усилия для развития своего бизнеса, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 6 овец. Также есть надел мерою 0,57 ГА орошаемой земли, где Карамат выращивает кукурузу. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма и увеличения поголовья скота. В будущем, Карамат планирует и дальше расширять свою деятельность и построить новый дом.
texts.en:
Karamat is 56, married, and she has three children.  She has a secondary education and by nature she is a quiet, sociable, and very hardworking woman.  As she was looking for a way to make an income, she started raising livestock and growing crops 30 years ago.  Karamat has put all her efforts into growing her farming business.  Today, she has three cows and six sheep on her farm.  She also grows corn on 0.57 hectares of arable land.

In order to further develop her business, Karamat has turned to Kiva's Partner, Bai Tushum Bank, and requested a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy a few cows for fattening, which will allow her to increase her livestock headcount.  In the future, she is planning to further expand her activity and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase a few cows in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en: Marieta is 51 years old and married with three children. Marieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a pig-fattening business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. Marieta has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the pig-fattening business for three years and also earns an income from food vending. Marieta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Lav's Group

texts.en: Lav’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Lav makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nhan's Group

texts.en: Nhan’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nhan makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. She has one young child in her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.
