In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nhuk's Group

texts.en: Nhuk’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Nhuk makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Melalona

texts.en:
Melalona is 35 years old and married with three children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Melalona is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Melalona has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Houn's Group

texts.en: Houn’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Houn makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Kuña Guapa  está en su ciclo número 1º  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo unido y las capacitaciones que van recibiendo de la fundación paraguaya.
Zully es una de las que integra este grupo, tiene una humilde despensa que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha podido sacar adelante, comenta que con su negocio ayuda a su familia y les da una vida digna y sin privaciones. Zully es muy trabajadora y luchadora, su trabajo lo hace día a día desde muy tempranas horas, tienes muchos clientes y es por ello que le va muy bien.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos variados y surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, pollo, frutas, lácteos y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y esforzarse por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group named Kuña Guapa is in its first cycle in the women's committee program. They meet in order to be able to help their families through united work and the trainings they receive from the Paraguayan foundation.

Zully is one of this group's members. She has a modest grocery store which she has improved with a lot of sacrifice and effort. She explains that with her business, she helps her family and gives them a decent life without loss. Zully is very hard working and persistent. She does her work every day from very early hours. She has many clients and because of this she is doing very well.

She requests this loan to be able to buy various products and stock up her shop with items such as: vegetables, meat, chicken, fruit, dairy products, and other things. In this way, she is able to continue her sales and make an effort to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy grocery products such as: vegetables, meat, chicken, fruit, dairy products, and others.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
For the past three years, Linda has raised hogs to cater to the needs of her family. She has also sold frozen goods like ham, hot dogs and longaniza (cured ham) to have an additional source of income. Her income goes for food and school expenses. She is married and has four children. Her oldest child is 16 while the youngest is 1. Her husband also has an income that could support the needs of the entire family.

Linda decided to join CEVI to access loans. With these, she could be able to boost her existing business and continue to handle it so that it would become more sustainable. She wants to purchase piglets, frozen goods and pay for school fees. With this, she could continue to raise more hogs and continue to cater to her respective customers in her retailing business of frozen foods.

In the future, Linda is looking forward to having a stable source of income. She extends thanks for the support.

loans.use: to purchase  piglets, frozen goods and pay for school fees

loans.name: Rosemyr

texts.en:
Rosemyr is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosemyr is 32 years old and has three children who are presently in school.

Rosemyr has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. Rosemyr requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, a sack of salt, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business.

Rosemyr has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, a sack of salt, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Ney's Group

texts.en: Ney’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Ney makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: Heng’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Heng makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lorena is 32 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Lorena has a business making dried fish in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, a sack of salt, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business.

Lorena has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, a sack of salt, bamboo, fish net and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Yim's Group

texts.en: Yim’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Yim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and this man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Samueline

texts.fr:
Samueline a 42 ans. Son mari s’adonne également à l’activité de petit commerce. Le couple a 3 enfants: 19-17-10 ans l’ainé est déjà marié, le second travaille, le dernier suit ses études dans une école privée. 
Elle a comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de friperies et d’ustensiles de cuisine. C’est une femme qui possède une culture de crédit et d’entreprise. Elle n’hésite pas à saisir les opportunités qui lui sont offertes pour développer une activité. Elle a déjà crée une petite unité de confection avant son mariage. Les bénéfices tirés des activités antérieures lui ont permis de construire une maison et d’éduquer ses enfants. 
Le ménage projette l’extension de l’activité, l’épargne constituée permettra de préparer l’avenir des enfants: enseignement général et formation professionnelle.
texts.en:
Samueline is 42 years old.  She and her husband are involved in small retail business.  The couple has three children, ages 19, 17 and 10.  Their oldest child is already married, the second is working and the third is still attending a private school.

Samueline makes a living selling second-hand clothes and kitchen utensils.  She is very familiar with business and credit in general.  She never hesitates to seize an opportunity to develop her activity.  Before she got married she had already created a small clothing business.  Thanks to the profits she made from her past activities, she has been able to build a house and to send her children to school.

Samueline and her husband want to expand their activity.  With their savings, they plan to give a good future to their children, as they will be able to pay for their education and professional training.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes, kitchen utensils and other knick-knack.

loans.name: 15 De Septiembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 15 de septiembre está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comités, es un grupo nuevo que se formó con la unión de varias gas y vecinas de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Dominga, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, comenta que aunque ha tenido que atravesar por muchos obstáculos, se esfuerza de todas maneras para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Dominga es una persona muy trabajadora que sueña con tener un gran local de ventas, y de esa manera seguir luchando por su familia.
La Sra. Dominga pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como jeans, camisas, remeras, pantalones, blusas, y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The group "15th of September" is in its first loan cycle in the committee program. It is a new group that was formed by the union of various friends and neighbors from the city of San Lorenzo. They are in the program for eliminating poverty, striving to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

One of the members is Señora Dominga, who sells clothing of all types. She comments that although she has had to experience many obstacles, she makes an effort in every way to be able to help her loved ones. Dominga is a very hard-working person who dreams of having a large sales location and in this way continuing to work for her family.

Señora Dominga is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy a variety of articles of clothing to sell, such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, pants, blouses, and other items, and in this way be able to continue with her sales and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of articles of clothing to sell, such as jeans, shirts, t-shirts, pants, blouses, and other items.

loans.name: Corsican

texts.en:
Corsican is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Corsican is 34 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Corsican has a fishing business in the Philippines. Corsican requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and other materials for her fishing.

Corsican has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and other materials for her fishing

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en: Sherlita is 54 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. Sherlita is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens. Sherlita has been in this business for six years and also earns additional income from pig fattening. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Rebecca works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling coconut wine in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rebecca is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell for her business buying and selling coconut wine.

Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 47 years old and has eight children. Lucia is married and has three children who are currently in school. Lucia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. Lucia has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Joylyn

texts.en:
Joylyn is 25 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Joylyn works very hard to provide for them.

Joylyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Joylyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, junk foods, dishwashing soap, candies and other groceries.

In the future, Joylyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kandal province, Phally is a 37-year-old farmer. She is divorced and has two dependent children who are not yet school aged. Her family’s income comes from rice growing and working for a garment factory for a fee. Phally earns about USD 8 per day and can save about USD 4 each day for future needs. A small piece of farmland, which enables her to earn low rice outputs to make a living, is her main challenge.

She has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles already. Previous loans have helped her to better meet her family's basic needs and upgrade their standard of living. As the leader of a three-member group, she is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields. She hopes that this purchase will let her get abundant rice yields so that she can make a better living and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to boost crop yields, which will enable her to earn more income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Ma. Sonora

texts.en:
Ma. Sonora hails from the town of Barili, Cebu. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store business. She sells basic merchandise like rice, corn grits, candies, chips, soft drinks, liquor, canned goods and toiletries. She is a 40-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest is 19 and the youngest is 3. Aside from running a sari-sari (variety) store, she also sells bottled mineral water.

She decided to request a loan to purchase a new refrigerator and make a payment for a motorcycle fee. With these, she could maximize her resources, enabling her to maintain their quality of life. She could now continue to serve cold drinks and frozen goods to the neighbors in her place. These could also improve ease of travel when transporting her goods from the market to her home.

In that way, Ma. Sonora could continue to manage her sources of income to become sustainable. She also hopes she can open up an eatery.

loans.use: to  purchase a new refrigerator and make a payment for a motorcycle fee.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion is a 68-year-old widow and a resident of Kinuman Sur, Ozamiz City Mis. Occ. She supports and provides for her children's needs from the little amount of 10,000 PHP she gains from corn plantation business, as an aid to the income gained from her farm. In 2007 she became a member of GDMPC and she successfully repaid her previous loan. Recently she applied for a new loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizer. She wants to expand her farmland someday.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a parent of one child, Myrna works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Myrna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy a variety of spices to sell for her business buying and selling spices.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of spices to sell.

loans.name: Félicie

texts.fr:
Félicie a 42 ans. Son mari s’adonne à la production de briques et s’occupe de la riziculture. Le couple a 2 enfants de 1 et 13 ans) dont un scolarisé dans une école publique. 
Elle confectionne des articles pour garder chaud les repas . Elle a toujours cherché les moyens de développer la confection d’articles en tissus, activité héritée de ses parents. Elle a 8 années d’expérience dans ce métier. Le marché de l’activité est très porteur. Le premier prêt obtenu a servi à l’acquisition d’une machine à coudre. Le développement de l’activité dépend de plusieurs facteurs : qualité, quantité et diversification des produits. L’acquisition d’une place au marché lui permet  d’assurer la vente des produits toute la journée. 
La famille vit encore  avec ses beaux parents. Le couple a comme projet la construction de leur propre maison pour  être autonome et indépendant.
texts.en:
Félicie is 42 years old.  Her husband is involved in brick production and rice farming.  The couple has two children, ages 1 and 13.  The oldest goes to a public school.

Félicie makes food warmer pouches.  She has always looked for ways to develop a sewing business, an activity which she took over from her parents.  She now has eight years of experience in this field of work.  There is a lot of growth potential for this particular market.  Félicie took a first loan to buy a sewing machine.  Whether she can grow her activity depends on several factors: quality, quantity and diversification of her products.  Having her own retail outlet at the market would also allow her to sell her products all day.

Félicie and her family still live with their in-laws.  For this reason, she and her husband are planning to build their own house, so that they can be independent and self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, sewing threads, and to find a retail outlet.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling beverages in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more soft drinks and other beverages to sell.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and other beverage to sell

loans.name: Von's Group

texts.en: Von, aged 59, is a resident in Kandal province. She makes a living by growing rice and selling grocery items. Lack of working capital is the challenge to her selling business.  She is leading a group of two to get loans from VisionFund. This will be her sixth loan. The past loans have helped her to improve her living conditions. As the group leader of this new loan, she will use her portion of the loan to buy more grocery items to replenish the store to attract customers. She believes that she will get good profits to better support her living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to replenish the store to attract customers.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en: Consorcia is a 49-year-old woman. Consorcia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries. Consorcia has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, coffee, junk foods, biscuits, candies and other groceries. In the future, Consorcia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is a 49-year-old married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Violeta has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy papayas, bananas, cabbages, carrots, beans, etc. to sell in her stall.

Violeta has been in this business for three years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy papayas, bananas, cabbages, carrots, beans, etc to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is a 25-year-old woman. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lerma has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. Lerma requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Lerma has been in this business for two years. In the future, Lerma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to sell for her business

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 45 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are presently in school, Deborah works very hard to provide for them.

Deborah runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, eggs, sugar, coffee, drinks, shampoo and snack foods.

Deborah has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Deborah would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, eggs, sugar, coffee, drinks, shampoo and snack foods

loans.name: Las Divas Group

texts.es:
15 son las integrantes que forman este grupo, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchan y se esfuerzan para poder dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien a  través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, y la venta de prendas que hace, se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Maria es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante y es por eso que participa siempre de una manera activa en las capacitaciones.
La Señora solicita de este préstamo para la compra de ropas para damas y caballeros todas las edades en cantidad y así a tener más variedad que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Fifteen are the members who form this group. They are in the program for the elimination of poverty. They strive and exert themselves to be able to give their loved ones a dignified life without privation.

One of the members is Señora Maria, who through sacrifice, continuous work, application of the vital behaviors of a successful woman, and the clothing sales that she makes earns a living in a dignified and honest way. Maria is a very hard-working person who wants to get ahead, and it is for this reason that she always participates in the training sessions in an active manner.

Señora [Maria] is applying for this loan to purchase clothing in quantity for women and men of all ages to thus have more variety, which will help her to solidify her business plan, which will help her to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing for men and women of all ages to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with three children. She is 31 years old and all three of her children are in school.

Josephine is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, underwear, etc.

Josephine has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim, a 35-year-old married farmer, lives in the Kandal province. She is blessed with a dependent child who is too young to attend school. Her family’s income comes from growing rice and working as a garment worker. Sim earns about 10 USD per day and can save about 5 USD each day.

As she is in need of working capital, Sim is now leading a group of three members to get loan from VisionFund. She is going to use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland. She hopes that she can generate more income to improve her living conditions, and to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to improve her farmland and gain more output.

loans.name: Las Poderosas Group

texts.es:
Las Poderosas se llama este grupo, está en su ciclo número 1, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Gladys, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de ropas se viene ganando la vida de una manera digna. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con sacrificio está saliendo adelante, y por medio de la cual ayuda a sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Gladys pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, polleras, y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando para poder cumplir con sus clientes y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Las Poderosas (the Powerful Ones) is the name of this group. It's in its first cycle, where everyone works and helps the others to move ahead. They are doing the poverty elimination survey, where each member puts their greatest strength for getting ahead.

One of the members is Mrs. Gladys, who, thanks to her effort and continued work, and through the sale of clothing, has come to earn a living with dignity. She is a very hardworking person who, with sacrifice, is making her way and thus helping her loved ones.

Mrs. Gladys is requesting a loan to be able to purchase various types of clothing for resale, such as knit tops, shirts, pants, skirts, and other items. This way, she will be able to continue fighting to be able to meet the demand of her clients and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase various types of clothing, such as knit tops, shirts, pants, skirts, and other items.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Virgen de las Mercedes está en su ciclo número 7 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose cada una por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nilda, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, lo que quiere decir que está en un nivel medio de ingresos. Ella a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de sus ventas ambulantes se gana la vida y tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de calzados, prendas variadas, artículos de bazar y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called "Virgen de las Mercedes." It is in its seventh loan cycle in the women's committee program, where everyone is in the program for the elimination of poverty, each one striving to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

One of the members is Señora Nilda, who on her last survey showed a level of poverty within level two, which means that she is at an intermediate level of income. Through her effort and continual work and through her street sales, she earns a living and has the means to help her family.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of footwear, a variety of clothing, variety articles, and other items to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity to get ahead that she is receiving.

loans.use: to buy footwear, various articles of clothing, variety articles, and other items that she can sell as a street vendor.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.en:
Mayra works hard to support her family. She is single and buys and sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Mayra requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to to purchase more underwear, bags, shoes, etc. She has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Mayra would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear, bags, shoes, etc.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano se llama esta grupo, está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están poniendo sus mayores esfuerzos 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Olga, una persona muy trabajadora que se sacrifica para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella pone todo su esfuerzo para poder ganarse la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Olga se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, y por medio de ello lucha para poder sacar adelante a sus seres queridos.
Olga pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de animales para poder criar y luego vender, como ser gallinas, patos, cerdos y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través del trabajo del grupo y de la unión de todas.
texts.en:
This group is called San Cayetano. It's in cycle number 5 in the committee program. They're doing a poverty elimination survey where everyone puts down their greatest strengths.

One of the members is Mrs. Olga, a very hardworking person who makes sacrifices to be able to improve her living conditions. She puts all of her effort into being able to earn an honest and dignified living.

Olga works raising farm animals, and through this she fights to be able to get her loved ones ahead.

Olga is requesting this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of animals to raise and later sell, such as chickens, ducks, pigs, and others. She appreciates the opportunity she is receiving to improve her living conditions through the work of the group and everyone joining together.

loans.use: to purchase animals to raise and later sell, such as chickens, ducks, pigs, and others.

loans.name: Daisy Mae

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Daisy Mae works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from a general store. Daisy Mae is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice for her buy-and-sell business.

Daisy Mae has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Nyesi

texts.en:
Nyesi is a single mother with three children and lives in Kasese, Uganda. She is their only bread winner and is charged with the responsibility of taking good care of her family. She deals in produce, specifically cassava flour, maize and beans. She also has side income from agriculture. Nyesi wants to buy maize and beans so that she can serve the available market and improve her income. 

She would be grateful to borrow money to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Soksan's Group

texts.en: Soksan’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Soksan makes a living cultivating rice. She also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and a man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Las Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre “Las Unidas” todas ellas se unieron para poder salir adelante y trabajar unidas y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus seres queridos. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por poder crecer y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien tiene una despensa bien surtida, empieza su día desde muy temprano en la mañana, hasta muy tarde en la noche, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que quiere mejorar para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Lidia comenta que con sacrificio ha mejorado, y hoy ya tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella sus productos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa y surtirlo con verduras, frutas, panificados, lácteos, enlatados y otros productos, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group carries the name, "Las Unidas". All of the members have united to be able to move ahead and work together, in this way improving the living conditions of their loved ones. They are in the poverty elimination program, making an effort to be able to grow and improve.

One of the members is Mrs. Lidia, who has a very well-stocked grocery store. She begins her day very early in the morning until very late at night. She's a very hardworking and determined woman who wants to better herself to be able to help her loved ones. Lidia says that with sacrifice she has improved, and today she has a good clientelle that always buys her products.

She is requesting this loan to be able to purchase supplies for her store, and stock it with vegetables, fruit, baked goods, dairy products, canned goods

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, fruit, baked goods, dairy products, canned goods, and other products.

loans.name: Ara Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ara Pyahu se formó en la ciudad de Itá, con la unión de amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, ellas están en su ciclo número 16                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        del programa de comité de mujeres, donde  trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del grupo. Todas  se esfuerzan en mejorar las condiciones, no solo de ellas, sino también de sus familias.
Rocio es una de las integrantes de este grupo, es una mujer muy modesta y luchadora, que se esfuerza para poder dar a su familia todo lo que ella no pudo tener, se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales que vende de manera ambulante por su barrio, y por medio de su humilde venta se esfuerza por poder mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas, esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The Ara Pyahu group was formed in the city of Itá by the joining together of friends and neighbors of that city. They are in their 16th cycle of the Women's Committee Program. Within the group they work jointly and in solidarity. All of the women work to better not only the conditions of their own lives, but also those of their families.
Rocio is one of the members of the group; she is a humble and determined woman, and she works hard to provide for her family what she herself could not have. She is an itinerant seller of natural remedies in her neighborhood, and my means of her humble sales works hard to make each day better. She requests this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of natural remedies for resale, so that she can continue selling and working hard to better her living conditions and the lives of her loved ones.

loans.use: To buy natural remedies for resale.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 60 years old, married and has five children. For the past two years she has been raising and selling pigs in the Philippines to earn an income.

Luzviminda has taken out and repaid two prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs. She is working to save enough to ensure a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 52-year-old married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rita has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Rita requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy cloth, needles, thread, and maintenance for her business.

Rita has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth, needles, thread, and maintenance for her business

loans.name: True Friends Group

texts.en:
Dung is 35 years old and a widow with 1 child. She has been operating a food stall selling crabs for 2 years. Dung lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is unstable for her to cover living expenses and save money.

The main hardship that Dung faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to increase her income by purchasing more fresh crabs to resell. In 2012, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Dung has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of True Friends which consists of five members.

In the future, Dung hopes that her business does well and makes enough money to provide for her kids and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh crabs to resell and increase her income

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old, married and has four children. For the past thirty years she has farmed rice in the Philippines.

Teresita has taken out and repaid six prior loans through Kiva's field partner NWTF. She has now applied for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her fields. She is saving money to enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her fields.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama San Expedito; está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, ellas se unieron para ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio del trabajo en conjunto luchar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes de ese grupo es la Sra. Carmen, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas de todo tipo, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por sus seres queridos, para poder mejorar cada día y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Carmen agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas frescas y de estación, y de esa manera poder tener una buena variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes y continuar ganándose la vida de una manera digna.
texts.en:
The group is named San Expedito; it is in its 4th cycle of the Women's Committee Program. All the women work and help each other to get ahead. They got together in order to help each other, and by means of working together, to fight to improve the conditions of their lives.

One of the members of the group is Sra. Carmen, who works selling all kinds of fruit. She is a very selfless woman who struggles on behalf of her loved ones, in order to make every day better and so that they don't have to live in need. Carmen is thankful for the opportunity she is receiving to improve the living conditions of herself and her loved ones.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy fresh fruits of the season and in this way offer a good variety of fruit to her clients, and keep earning a living in a dignified way.

loans.use: to purchase fresh seasonal fruits for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain dental treatment.

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en:
Sopha is 34 years old and lives in Siem Reap province. She has three children, one of whom is in school while the others are too young to attend.

Together with her husband, Sopha has been growing rice and cassava for sixteen years. Sometimes she works for others in order to earn more income. Weeds and floods are challenges for her as a farmer.

Sopha took out and repaid two prior loans through Kiva's field partner VisionFund Cambodia. Her previous loans helped support the family and buy school supplies for her child. With this 3,300,000 KHR loan Sopha will pay to have her fields plowed in order to prepare them for growing cassava. She hopes her profits will improve the family’s living conditions and help send her children to school.

loans.use: pay to have her fields plowed in order to prepare them for growing cassava.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Marlene Del Carmen

texts.es: Marlene tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil divorciada tiene un hijo David de 18 años estudia en una unidad educativa estatal, hace 40 años vende productos de primera necesidad como agua, arroz, azúcar este pequeño negocio le ha  permitido obtener dinero para pagar la alimentación,  educación de su hijo, la medicinas de su madre que tiene 90 años de edad. Marlene necesita el dinero para comprar mercaderìa  incrementando la variedad de sus productos obteniendo mayores ganancias para satisfacer las necesidades básicas del hogar
texts.en: Marlene is 60 years old, divorced, with an 18 year old son David. David studies in a state educational institution. For 40 years Marlene has sold staples such as water, rice and sugar. This little business has allowed her to obtain money for food and education for her son, as well as medicine for her 90-year-old mother. Marlene needs the loan to buy merchandise thus increasing the variety of her products offered for sale and earning a better income to satisfy the basic needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, thus increasing the variety of products she sells.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.es: Alba tiene 50 años de edad, 4 hijos, 5 nietos Michel de 9, Antonela de 8, Juliana de 8, Nicol de 6, Anahomi de 4 e Israel de 2 años de edad,hace 36 años desde que su esposo la abandono empezó a vender gelatina de sabores y fresas con crema en la calle este pequeño negocio le ayudado a no dejarlos sin comer a sus hijos. Alba trabajadora, responsable, valiente necesita el dinero para comprar un mostrador  poner a la vista el delicioso producto incrementando sus ventas e ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de esta humilde familia
texts.en:
Alba is 50 years old, with 4 children and 5 grandchildren (Michel, 9, Antonela, 8, Juliana, 8, Nicol, 6, Anahomi, 4, and Israel, 2). It is 36 years ago that her husband abandoned her and she became a street vendor, selling different flavors of gelatin, as well as strawberries with cream.

This small business has helped her keep her children from going hungry. Alba is hard-working, responsible and brave. She needs the money to buy a display case to put her delicious products on view, thereby increasing her sales and her income for meeting the basic needs of this humble family.

loans.use: to buy a display case for her products.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 47 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Veronica runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items, including beverages, canned goods, home-care products, and other groceries.

Veronica requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, including beverages, canned goods, home-care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Vallejo Mafla

texts.es: Verónica tiene 21 años de edad es madre soltera su hija Samanta tiene 3 años, hace 4 años  se dedica  a la venta de ropa deportiva, todos los días desde muy temprano  visita a sus clientes para lograr vender la mercadería luego regresa al lugar donde vive  le exhibe en una vitrina tratando de seguir vendiendo con las ganancias puede costear el pago de vivienda, alimentación de ella y su pequeña. Verónica con el dinero comprara mercaderia en ropa  generando mayores ganancias para incrementar su pequeño negocio y continuar cubriendo las necesidades basicas.
texts.en:
Veronica, 21, is a single mother. Her daughte Samanta is three years old. She has been selling sports clothes for four years.

She visits her customers every day, starting early in the morning, and when she gets home she displays her merchandise in a cabinet to try and sell some more.

With the profit she makes she can pay for her home and food for the family.

She will use the money to buy clothes merchandise so she can generate more income and expand her small business to continue covering her basic needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing merchandise.

loans.name: Mujeres Dinamicas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Mujeres Dinámicas” está en su 2º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias, sumado esto a la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya a través del programa de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Teresa, quien se dedica a las ventas, tiene una pequeña despensa en la que todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana, ya que sale a hacer sus compras para tener productos a buen precio. Teresa es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que pone todo de sí para poder lograrlo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas, verduras, panificados, hortalizas, carnes y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
The group called 'Mujeres Dinamicas' is in its second cycle in the women's committee. The members got together to try and improve the standard of living for themselves and their families.

In addition, they are members of the Poverty Elimination programme run by the Paraguayan Foundation.

One of the members is Teresa, who has small grocery store. Every day she gets up early in the morning so she can buy her products at a good price.

She is a hard-working woman who wants to get along in life, so she does her best every day to succeed.

She is asking for this loan to buy fruit, vegetables, bread, meat and other products, so she can continue to offer them in her store.

She is very grateful for the chance to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy food supplies.

loans.name: Sara Emilia

texts.es:
Sara es una mujer de 49 años, que actualmente es propietaria y administradora de su pulpería, la cual, a su vez es su principal fuente de ingresos desde hace cinco años. El mayor anhelo de Sara es ver crecer su pulpería cada día más, ampliar la gama de productos que ofrece, y obtener mayor ganancia por ellos, es por eso, que en el pasado Sara ya ha sido beneficiada con otros créditos.
El nuevo préstamo que Sara solicita, explica que, lo requiere para comprar más productos tales como gaseosas, galletas y golosinas que le permitan variar y aumenten considerablemente sus ganancias. En el futuro Sara planea seguir invirtiendo económicamente en su negocio, ya que no quiere que pare de florecer.
texts.en:
Sara, 49, owns and runs a grocery store. This has been her main source of income for five years.

Her wish every day is to see it grow. Therefore, she has had loans in the past so she can offer a wider range of products and generate more income.

She tells us that she will use this new loan to buy more products such as soft drinks, biscuits and candy, adding variety and increasing her profits.

She plans to continue investing in her business so it does not stop growing.

loans.use: to buy more snacks for her store.
